Summary Heading: Like Staying at a Friends, but better.
Summary: It's like staying at a friends, the standard amenities of fridge, stove-top, microwave and coffee maker, but with the added service standards of Hyatt. Daily housekeeping (if needed), breakfast, and pool. (Odds are your friend doesn't make the bed.) Breakfast comprised of an omelette station, several cold cereals to choose from, hot items (scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes), bread, english muffins, orange or apple juice, milk and coffee.  Great location, not on the main through-fare or next to a freeway, but access to them  are just minutes away. It was good spot to call "home base" for my stay in the area. Close to Anaheim, so I could visit Disneyland or Knott's, and not have to worry about paying the Anaheim resort fee or per night parking.  There are rooms that face the
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for choosing Hyatt and for taking the time to share your experience. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast items as well as our clean and spacious rooms, and exceptional customer service. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Stayed at this hotel as not a lot of quality hotels close to Knott's Berry Farm. The hotel offers a shuttle for free to Knott's Berry Farm but only runs until 10 p.m. . Uber or Lyft fairly cheap at 5 to $10. The hotel itself layout is quite confusing. It's a lot larger than you will assume by looking at it from the outside. Lots of noise in the evening coming from the courtyard around the pool and people utilizing the barbecues to cook. Beds were not comfortable. Shower was great pressure. Hotel is definitely dated and probably needs an update. Close to some fast food options for those late-night cravings. Breakfast here was standard fare and nothing special other than an omelette station if you partake in omelets. Definite off-putting smells in the hallway at night, not sure if

Had a two night stay. Was able to check in early which was great! Breakfast had a lot of great options! It is close enough to Disneyland if you want to walk, but also a close shuttle is within walking distance.

Summary: A disgrace. They could have assigned a regular room but got an awkward layout hc room instead. Was not happy. Full top price though. Staff did not care. This will happen again. I might not be going back

Overall good experience.  Very accommodating staff. The breakfast was simple but decent. There is a chili’s right beside the building.  The hotel offers shuttle service to nearby locations. Rooms are pretty standard for american chain hotels. Each room has a mini kitchenette and receiving area.

Summary Heading: Nice quiet location, great breakfast, huge rooms
Summary: Only complaint is my room had some kinda weird smell to it and carpets and a few stains....when renovating they probably should have went with something besides carpet. Breakfast was awesome and pool and hot tub was nice. Could watch my kids swim from balcony of our room

The Hyatt house worked out great for us since we needed to be out of our home for a few days. It has a kitchen complete with oven, microwave, stove, refrigerator and dishes/utensils. It’s nice to have a separate bedroom that can be closed off from the living room area. There are 2 televisions with several channels including HBO. The staff is very friendly and very accommodating. If you need anything they will do their best to get it for you. The breakfast is outstanding. Complete with freshly made hot and cold breakfast foods that are restaurant quality. I would definitely recommend this hotel and it is a good value.

Summary: This was our third stay at this hotel. I was not as impressed this stay as I was the first two. If this was my first stay I would have thought it was an average hotel. Staff was not as impressive as they had been.  Our room was not as clean as we had come to expect.  The pillows were rock hard. Seems like there must have been a change in management and they are letting a good thing disappear.

The room were a little smaler than expected, but we only needed to sleep there. The room were cleaned every day, and the bed were made. The staff and cleaning people were very nice. The breakfast was ok. There were omelet everyday. In general a good place to stay.

The hotel was clean and comfortable. We stayed with family and requested rooms to be close. Staff did a wonderful job placing us on the same floor and just across the hall. The breakfast was wonderful. I loved the fact that they had a person making omelets to order and it tasted great and fresh. We definitely enjoyed our stay!

Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for choosing Hyatt and for taking the time to share your experience. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast items as well as our exceptional customer service. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: As soon as I got into bed I discovered the AC vent was pointed directly at me. Even with the blankets tucked around my face it was a gale force wind.  Due to my health history I cannot have AC blowing on my face. I turned off the AC, switched the comforter for just the comforter cover in the closet. But it was too hot and stuffy. And little kids were stomping around overhead. (I asked for a quiet room at check in and was given the 1st floor.)  So I turned the AC back on and slept on the couch....for a few hours, until the bar outside my window closed and all the partiers decided outside my window was a good place to hang out till just before dawn.  Thanks Hyatt House - for a lovely stay, :/ Over it.

Very clean rooms (this is my second visit to this property), quiet and convenient location with lots of restaurants nearby. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Pool & jacuzzi were great and breakfast had a lot of choices. The suites are definitely great with lots of room and the kitchenette is fully stocked with full size refrigerator, plates, glasses, silverware etc. I’ve noticed rates can be high here at times, but having quality & cleanliness you can depend on are worth a bit more sometimes. Overall great place to stay in the area.

Summary Heading: Hyatt House Cypress/Anaheim is my new go to place to stay.
Summary: This Hyatt House rocks! The rooms are comfortable and the kitchen is useful. Unlike other Hyatt properties in Anaheim, this one does not charge for parking. The free breakfast is really good and varies just enough daily to keep it interesting. The staff was very friendly and helpful, but one staff member really made my trip. Joy the bartender was just great, she always had a friendly smile for all the patrons and was a joy to be around!

Summary: Highly recommend staying here! My family and I stayed for a week and enjoyed it very much! Loved the online check-in especially when we arrived super late. The welcome party was awesome! Then the variety of breakfast provided by the hotel....perfectly cooked bacon or link sausage and eggs one day, to oatmeal or cereal the next, then pancake, waffles or french toast and they served it with rice or potatoes. I forgot they also had a omelet station. Yes.....so if you're on a diet, good luck with that. Last for me of why I recommend this place is the customer service or courtesy of staff. Every staff that I encountered always greeted me and my family and housekeeping did an excellent job putting my room back to when we first arrived.

Summary Heading: When you can't get past the hair in the drain

I mean, ok the water pressure sucked but it was the long black clump of hair in the shower that did it. Or perhaps the dried noodles in the couch. Or maybe the bag of chips under the couch. I dunno, you pick.

Great place to stay, the room was much bigger than we expected to our delight. The breakfast was wonderful, and overall great stay. The hotel is located in a very nice street, you could probably reach everything you need within a 10 minute drive.

We only paid the rate for the 2 queen room!!! Both rooms were clean and spacious. The office area downstairs with free computer access was also great and offered free printing.  The hotel has a great free breakfast and the pool and outdoor area is very nice - the kids had a great time there. There are restaurants close by and it's
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for choosing Hyatt and for taking the time to share your experience. Summary: I paid just over $800 to stay here for 3 nights with my husband and one year old daughter. The first morning we were there I picked up a washcloth off of the bathroom counter to dry my hands and a huge spider was underneath it. That same morning we were eating breakfast in the kitchen and I saw a cockroach run across the floor (we were on the 3rd floor). Needless to say, not a great way to start off our stay.   Luckily we didn’t see any more insect activity after that, but we did have to place the do not disturb sign on our door while our baby was napping and housekeeping got skipped that day. We placed a call to the front desk at 4 pm to just ask for fresh towels and request that the trashes be emptied. We then left to have dinner, and when we returned about 2 hours later, it

Can’t go wrong with staying here. From rooms to breakfast to amenities to customer service, everything was top rate! Also provided courtesy shuttles to/from Knott’s which was an added bonus. Will stay here again for sure!

Summary: Nice hotel and room, but also not the greatest. Our room had a smell we couldn’t get rid of, multiple outlets didn’t work, we had to retrieve a blanket from the front desk when we requested an extra instead of it being delivered, had to wait to check in, food was just okay.

Summary: Hyatt house is one of the best hotels around. The rooms are HUGE, and the breakfast are TOTALLY better than any of those other "waffle house" breakfast's so many other hotels think that make them special. Nothing compares to Hyatt house.
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for choosing Hyatt and for taking the time to share your experience. We are overjoyed to hear you loved your spacious suite and our many breakfast items. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Great location, great customer service,  awesome property! The beds are super comfortable,  the breakfast is unbeatable,  and the courtesy shuttle for up to 5 miles is extremely  convenient. Across the street there is a fantastic Mongolian bbq restaurant highly recommend.
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for choosing Hyatt and for taking the time to share your experience. We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay here with us. Thank you for your kind words as we strive for complete guest satisfaction. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: I had stayed at another hotel the week prior (Not by choice), this hotel is too notch, service and environment is top notch.... Little to no noise, restaurants in walking distance and the staff is super friendly...

Everything was great, room was clean breakfast was delicious employees were friendly great location, great atmosphere I Had a great experience, I would definitely come back and I would totally recommend Hyatt to all my friends and family

This is my 4th time staying at this hotel. I am a great fan of Hyatt.  But this particular location is very convenient and the hotel is very clean. They serve fresh hot breakfast. The staff are very friendly.  I will recommend this to anyone without any reservation.

We spent 5 days here over the weekend for a wedding reception. The price was right booked through Tripadvisor compared to other places close to Long Beach Airport where we initially planned. Rooms were clean, service was great. Free breakfast was one of the best I’ve ever had. Lots of family stayed here as they had large family rooms.

Will definitely return. Hotel was amazing and staff was fantastic .We had never stayed in a Hyatt before but were very pleased. Our nephews loved the movie channels and then microwave so they could have popcorn. Breakfast was incredible and the pool was great!

Loved this hotel!  Great rooms with plenty of space, comfy beds, full kitchen and amazing, fresh breakfast buffet with fresh waffles, omelettes, miso soup, great fruit variety and excellent coffee.  My family and I enjoyed so much this hotelwill be back

This was our second stay.  The variety and quality of breakfast is best we've ever seen.  The patio with BBQ grills provided a great place for us to host our family.  Staff are extremely friendly and helpful.

The bed was nice, but as soon as we got into the room, a cockroach ran across the countertop. My wife freaked  out and we insisted on changing rooms.  The next room was much better.  Would probably not recommend this hotel to families with  small children.

Down for a basketball tournament. Room was great, except for the shower. Water kept sleeping out to the bathroom floor. Beautiful shower door, but it doesn’t keep the water in the shower. The shower floor was also sloped so the water was pooling away from the drain.

Everything was great but they do not accept cards without a chip. Very inconvenient pulse slowest elevators in the world with only 3 floors.  Food was also good but no bacon on the weekends so my kids did not eat much except on Friday.

Poor service. Staff wasn’t not helpful when I told the supervisor I wanted to stay another night she could not accommodate my friends and family code. Also, I decided to stay one more night and instead of offering me to stay in a temporary room I had to wait three hours to check in my new room.

Front office staffs, Manager are good. Response quickly. But sadly, the housekeeping as if they lack of training or she was in hurry....  we believe on Hyatt Brand and Hyatt standard service and cleanliness.

Check in was quick and easy. The gentlemen who check me in was courteous and efficient. The young lady at the front desk was polite but not pleasant. In general, the staff was polite but never quite friendly; I definitely did not get that welcoming feeling I've experienced at a different Hyatt House. The staff during breakfast were pleasant and helpful when asked. The gentlemen who checked me out and printed my receipt however, was helpful, friendly and pleasant - that was a welcome change. It was obvious the bathroom was not cleaned properly after the last guest; chunks of soap remnants in the wire soap container and stains on the counter. I returned the 2nd day hoping for a cleaner room, but instead returned to hair on the bathroom floor and the same issue in the shower soap

Summary Heading: Business or pleasure it’s all good
Summary: Good location for business and vacation. As we saw a lot of people here for Disney. The room rate was a bit high but it's summer time. Very spacious rooms with a kitchen, living room and separate bedroom. Restaurant is more of a bar but Very good service and not noisy. There was something for everyone to eat. Very healthy food too

This is our first time staying here and not too sure if we would go back there again in the future.   We booked 2 rooms for 4 nights each. We had a great start in this place up till the last night of our stay.  Here are some list of the pros to this place :  1. Room size is huge.  2. Kitchen is a big help for traveller who is       traveling with kids.  3. Breakfast is good with many good options.  4. Guest laundry and dryer are available.  5. Parking is free.  6. Some of the receptionist are giving warmth service towards us.  But then, after all the good things we experienced for the first 3 days, we faced what many reviewers wrote about this property, HOUSEKEEPING would be the big problem in this place.  In one of our room, the housekeeper did not throw the trash for 2 days

I have stayed at this hotel multiple times now and have always had a great experience. I recommend this location if you are military. Not far from the base. Great location for food and restaurants. Staff are always welcoming.

The light in the kitchen did not work. The couch also smelled like urine,  it needs to be steam cleaned. I let the front desk employees know when I checked out. Overall, check in was very nice and the room was a perfect size. Since it is a family place, I  would suggest a step stool for the bathroom, as I had to carry my kids to brush their teeth and wash their hands.

Overall, the hotel/room was nice.  Housekeeping could have done a better job at cleaning our room in between our stay.  I feel there wasn't much effort in cleaning the room.  Other than that, everything was good.

Only problem a children cheer leading group they were so noisy at all hours was not supervised by an adult.  Rude.. There were families wanting to use the pool they could not cause the children were loud, splashing everywhere.  Some of the cheer leading kids were above us were jumping, screaming so the girls went down  to the front desk at 1 am to complain. Problem solved. The breakfast was just okay not the best.  I would go back.

Very spacious suite with a full kitchen: stove, fridge, dish washer. They have complimentary grocery shopping for guests, just give them your list. Free hot breakfast every morning with an omelette bar. Very clean. There is a heated outdoor pool with a hot tub. They have a coin-operated laundry room. $2 for wash, $2 for dryer. Pricey, but convenient. Rooms have a balcony overseeing either the pool or patio area. They have a pretty patio area with seating and a fire pit. It's very close to Disney, but quite a drive to all other LA attractions. Attractions are not really far, it's just that LA traffic is a nightmare. Plan ahead.

I stayed here recently and found this Hyatt House to be such a great hidden gem. It's tucked away in Cypress but close to lots of good food options, 7 - 10 minute drive from a Target and several shopping centers. Loved the free parking and full bar offering happy hour. Check in was pleasant and a breeze. I had a one bedroom king suite, which was very spacious and the prices for rooms here are affordable. The full kitchen was a nice touch as well. I had a great evening and would return again in a heartbeat!

Very friendly and helpful staff throughout our stay, including reception, cleaning staff, breakfast team.    Very good breakfast with wide variety of good quality selections.   We occupied two rooms.  Both were spacious and clean.

We've stayed at this property many time and find it clean, quiet, and very accommodating. We prefer Hyatt House Cypress/Anaheim whenever we go to Orange County for family events or just to escape the desert heat

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, short drive from Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here during our visit to Disneyland. The hotel is ~15 mins drive from Disney. The room was spacious and looked new / recently renovated. They had a fully equipped kitchen that we didn't get time to use. Breakfast spread was decent and made-to-order omelets were excellent!

This property is in a great location. Close to all kinds of stores to meet all your needs.  Kitchen was a great amenity and we did cook dinner two nights.  The pool and lounge area are nice, and the breakfast was better than expected.  The rooms were clean, and the guest service staff was great. They were super friendly.  For families on vacation, this is a good clean location to stay.  I spent most of the trip in LA, but it was worth the drive to stay in a reasonably priced hotel with great amenities... and from what I experienced great staff!

Very satisfied and surprised with the room service and breakfast options. Staff was very informative and helpful also available at all times. 2nd time staying here and would stay here again in the future.

Great place to stay! Suites are spacious, bed very comfortable. Staff is very professional.  Great breakfast buffet and outdoor omlett station. Beautiful outdoor fireplace for social gathering and drinks.

The room was very spacious. My kids loved the fact that that the bedroom was separate from the living area. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Next time we go to Knott's berry farm we will be staying here again.

Rooms were very nice (decor and size), including kitchenette. Pool and Hot Tub were fabulous. Staff from Reception to Housekeeping were AMAZING. Breakfast had a fantastic selection for all types of appetites and dietary needs. Didn't find out until check out about Happy Hour, but I assume it would have been just as great as breakfast.

I stay here for work trips almost annually, I always have the same level of professionalism and respect from the staff.  We came here this time for mine and my wife's 12 year wedding anniversary. It is very conveniently located for Disneyland and many other tourist spots in the area.  I highly recommend.

Very clean hotel and nice location. Staff was good and the stay was comfortable. Very good for families. The breakfast also has nice options, specially the omelette station. I would definitely stay at this location if I am in the area

Summary Heading: Excellent choice for Long Beach/Anaheim Convention attendees
Summary: The hotel may be further than other properties to both Long Beach and Anaheim convention centers but the 18-30 minute drive is absolutely worth it considering it’s in a clean and super safe location with lots of dining options, and it’s withkn pee diem if you sign up as a Hyatt member. The room was spectacular-super clean, modern, and comfortable.

A great place to stay, near restaurants and if enjoy walking, it’s in a safe pace of town. Many food options to chose from and just down the street from a grocery store to stock your fridge. I’ll stay here again.

This hotel is in very great conditions.  The beds are firm yet relaxing to sleep on.  The bathroom is a little worn and needs additional cleaning and touch up.  The sofa bed in the living room with kitchen with all the amenities including a refrigerator, microwave, stove, dishes, cups, coffee, silverware, pots and pans plus other item including paper towels is excellent.  The check in and check out was prompt.  The breakfast was great with the made to order omelets, scrambled eggs, assorted breads and muffins, the juices, miso soup, oatmeal and the hot coffee.  The swimming pool with the hot tub is a plus.  The best was that Alex provided an upper floor unit facing the pool.  Second time staying here and it is definitely a place we will stay again.

Nice hotel and staff.  Large room with expected amenities.  Able to support a 4 person family Comfortably with privacy.  Fire pit , pool and hot tub are well positioned and maintained with close proximity to bar.

My recent stay at the Hyatt House was very good. My room and the hotel common areas were clean and modern. I really enjoyed the omelette station at breakfast. If I am in the area again, I would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Hi,  Thank you for choosing Hyatt and for taking the time to share you experience. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed our complimentary omelette station and enjoyed your suite. We look forward to your next visit.  Cordially,

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel For A Family Trip
Summary: This hotel is above the average Hyatt House/Place hotels in LA area. Its breakfast has plenty of choice, including made-to-order omelets. The fire pit is cozy, the jacuzzi is relaxing, and the happy hour drat beer is tasting. Staff is nice, and the room-with-kitchen is well designed. It would be perfect if the mattress could be a little bit softer.

From the moment I walked in to the last day the entire crew made me feel at home. They were able to suggest restaurants and nearby attractions. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone of my friends and family!

Summary Heading: Great Value - Excellent, Clean and Spacious Hotel
Summary: We were SOOO happy with this hotel. I was a little hesitant because it seems to be in an industrial park. It's nice to be off the beaten path a tad though. AWESOME rooms - clean, spacious - plenty of space of the 5 of us (2 adults, 2 teens and our little guy who is 4). Full kitchen. Grills outside in the very private courtyard area. Our room was 129  and we couldn't have asked for a more perfect set up. We walked through the courtyard every morning for their phenomenal breakfast (eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, waffles, french toast, made-to-order omelets, juice, coffee, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, EVERYTHING you could want. Even miso soup and tofu! Plenty of room to spread out at breakfast even when it got a bit busy. The bar/restaurant is in the breakfast area and when the

The stay was out if the blue and I wasnt sure about the place but I'm so glad I did. I only had one night but I wish I had more. The service was excellent. I will be looking for Hyatt House's when i go out of town from now on.

Summary Heading: Little Gem Out of The Hustle & Bustle of LA
Summary: I have stayed here 3 times now, each a minimum of 7 nights and recently 12 nights.  It's a great location and easy access to I405 and beaches. Good restaurants locally and quiet venue. Highly recommend.

We were there for a basketball tournament for 3 days.  The hotel staff is excellent and the rooms were very nice.  The boys were able to play at the pool and there is a nice area just outside the pool to drink and relax.  Nice firepit at night too.  Hotel is within 30 min of the ocean.  There are places to eat within walking distance.  Very close to Long Beach Airport.  Will definitely stay with them again.

The bed was super comfortable! Everything is really clean. The breakfast options were good and the taste was good too. Inside the room you have a stove and fridge that I didn't use but I guess it would be really useful to other people.

Summary Heading: Very good hotel, good for weekend trip in LA
Summary: HYATT house Cypress has provide free upgrade room for us. We are Hyatt credit card member. I love the free parking and free breakfast services. The only thing you need to consider is the traffic. They are 40 mins drive from LA downtown.

Loved this hotel! The location and hotel itself was great. Super close to tons of places including Disney.  Very clean and cozy. Breakfast in the mornings was much more then we expected so that was nice!

Decent prices. Clean Rooms. Excellent Customer Service and Housekeeping. Definitely recommend this hotel. Breakfast is really good. Bar is well stocked. Looking forward to re-visit. Close to shopping malls and restaurants.
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for choosing Hyatt and for taking the time to share you experience. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed our breakfast and enjoyed our exceptional service and performance from our staff. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Eather if you are travelling for work or pleasure, is a great place to stay in. Close to office buldings, and also to 15 min to Disney. the rooms are very big and with everything you need to prepare your meals in there.
Manager Response: Hi,  Thank you for choosing Hyatt and for sharing your experience. We love to hear your stay was great and enjoyed our spacious suite. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Clutch in Cypress. Free Parking , Free Breakfast and all amenities of home. This Hyatt House is a win all around. Proximity to Disneyland was perfect. Lots of places to eat and a Target close by was CLUTCH!
Manager Response: Hi,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and for choosing Hyatt. We are certainly a hidden gem, we look forward to your next visit.  Best,

Summary: This Hyatt property is a great property. The rooms were nice, clean, and very well maintained. Full Breakfast every morning, and great staff.  I stayed here with my family for seven nights on vacation so we could visit Disneyland, the beaches and Hollywood. This HYATT is in a great location to both Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm, and the beaches. The plus is you are only 20 mins from Disneyland and you will save $$ since it's not in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Hi,  Thank you for staying with us for such an important trip. We truly enjoy having families come and enjoy the many attractions nearby the hotel. We hope you had great travels back home and look forward to your next visit.  Best,

Summary: This was our family vacation.  It is a beautiful location with plenty of restaurants and various stores minutes away.  This is also a nice area without all the fast pace an hectic LA traffic.  There is a Sunset beach that is about 15 mins away in Huntington that is a must see at sunset. Long Beach is also not that far away. The check in and check out was easy.  Every single staff I met was friendly and helpful.  The room has a full size refrigerator, stove, dishwasher and dishes.  The breakfast has a nice variety and there is a lady outside near the pool area that makes omelets to order. The only thing I would like to have had was some better pillows. If you are planning on traveling up to Hollywood or LA, be prepared to deal with heavy traffic. You are looking at anywhere from
Manager Response: Hi,  Thank you for choosing Hyatt for your family vacation travels. We are delighted to hear you and your family had a great time and enjoyed our amenities and the nearby attractions. I totally agree, that sunset is amazing!!! We have taken note about the pillows and will share with our corporate team. We look forward to your next visit.  Cordially,

Summary Heading: Very friendly staff and consistent rooms
Summary: Very friendly and helpful staff. I've stayed at many Hyatt properties and they are usually very consistent and helpful. The Cypress location has the friendliest staff so far. I stayed here about 3 times for business. Even this location is 20 minutes away from the office, I prefer it because the location is quiet and caters to the business traveler. I like having a kitchen when I want to have a light dinner. They offer in-room massages, which I intend to take advantage of next time.
Manager Response: Hi,  Thank you for your loyalty and for choosing our location. We are delighted to hear our staff is delivering as expected. We look forward to your next visit and please do take advantage of the massages and relax.  Best,

Summary: The king suites are very large, comfortable, and well equipped. We like having a sitting area distinct from the bedroom. They offer a very good breakfast with omlettes made to order and a wide selection of other items.

First, Room looks outdated and dull. Second, They don't provide basic amenities like moisturizer, shaving cream. Third, There is no dishwasher nor the room service bothers to clean your vessels. Fourth, I see salt and pepper sachets taken from nearby Wendy's in my room kitchen. Price management to the extreme. I never expected such poor standards from Hyatt. Utterly disappointed

I was really impressed with this place. Big rooms with kitchen, living area and dining area with separate room. The gym was nice and the breakfast was a great way to start the day. There are many restaurants within walking distance and very close to grocery stores and gas stations. The only complaint I have is when we checked in at 6pm, our room wasn't ready. I was confused and asked, "Isn't check-in time at 3pm?" Front desk gal said yes and apologized. She gave us complimentary water while we waited. This is not what we wanted to do after driving over 2 hours and a full day of volleyball. Other than that, everything was perfect. I would definitely stay here again and recommend.

The room was so very nice.  It felt like a home away from home. I really like that great little kitchen area - and they provide cooking utensils too: flatware and dishes - awesome!  It has the characteristics of a suite

Summary Heading: Not what we expected from Hyatt
Summary: My family stayed here for our Disneyland vacation.  The hotel is only about 15 minutes from Disneyland but they will not shuttle you to the Disneyland park b/c it is over five miles away.  That ended up costing us $75 in parking fees (three days parking at Disneyland).  The mattress in the master bedroom was very hard and our backs were killing us in the morning.  The television in the master bedroom did not have a swivel and was mounted in the far corner with no ability to swivel to watch from any sort of distance.  The bathroom had hair on the toilet tank cover before we even used it.  The breakfast was good with excellent variety but the staff had a hard time keeping it full so you have to wait to get everything you might want.  It is close to Disneyland though - only about

Summary Heading: Home away from home (but buy your own groceries)
Summary: The rooms are very nice. Located near great restaurants and walking distance to store. They even have a shuttle that will take you to the grocery store. The breakfast is awful though. Same thing day after day

Summary Heading: Not the high value I was expecting for what I paid
Summary: Was there for over a week and at the end I felt I could have done better in some of 100-120 per night alternatives in the area. Location was good and central enough in clean business area with plenty of restos around. My main concern was on the cleaning of the room which was not consistent. I have concerns also over the qualities of some of the finishing touches of the room such as shower head, lighting intensities. I would not comment on things like that if it was a lesser brand with a lower rate

Depending on the room, it’s either beautiful or awful. Management was a pain to deal with and had zero customer service. The hallway to the bathroom is so small it won’t open all the way and you have shimmy through, not handicap friendly at all.

Was there on business for a week. Great staff, very accommodating. Hotel shuttle available to take you to the store anytime. Great bartenders.. and food options at walkable distances, overall ambience made the extended stay a good one.

Summary Heading: Great location and room for extended family stay
Summary: If you have a group and will need space or an extended stay and want to prepare some of your meals then this hotel is perfect. Likewise if you are traveling throughout the LA basin then this hotel is great as well.

Love it The Hotel is very clean . I love the room very nice and lots of space Thank you Thank you Thank you. Great place Joy is amazing . We will soon Perhaps the Bar could stay open until 11 sometimes we work late and the kitchen

Stayed at a Hyatt House before, but I was surprised when I entered my room at Cypress/Anaheim. My room was like a Bachelors Pad. The room was huge and the amenities are complete. I am considering staying there again when I go for a business trip around that area.

The hotel is generally very quiet, is very well kept, and the staff are friendly and helpful! The location is in a safe area, accessible to nearby grocery stores and restaurants. The rooms are spacious, well-kept, and clean, and this hotel always provides me with peace of mind. This isn’t my go-to hotel for when I need a vacation!

Excellent value.  Clean and well run.  Helpful staff.  Kitchen very workable.  Good breakfast.Nice bar.  Dinner was good in a pinch.  Hot tub nice feature.  Only issues.  We were at a trade show and had to leave at 6 every morning to set up the booth.  So we only had breakfast there once (which was free).  They have an omelette station which is nice.  Also, no shuttle to the convention center.

Our thermostat broke and heater would not STOP in hotel room. It got over 100 degrees Fahrenheit. Was not offered replacement room until demanded at check in counter at 3AM. Also room smelled like Tobacco smoke in a NON SMOKING hotel and reported upon check in with no change of room offered.

This is a great hotel that is in a quiet area of the city.  Our trip was about going to Disneyland and it is an easy 10 mile drive. The check in process was smooth.  Breakfast is great!  Pool and hot tub were nice also

Gorgeous place, high quality service and delicious breakfast!!! I will surely stay there again! the sofa bed was very uncomfortable, but even though i loved everything!SUPERB! You will enjoy your stay for sure!

The room was comfortable and having the kitchenette was helpful.  Also, having the extra living room space was a nice area to work from the hotel.  The breakfast was a time saver in the morning as well as a great value.  I loved the variety of the daily breakfast choices and omelette station was great too.

Hotel is in the middle of the city but very quiet location. Free parking and spaces were enough. Check-in was very easy and nice. Front desk was very helpful and informative.  Room was very clean and quiet.  Very nice hotel and will come back.

Check in went smoothly. The room was large with everything that I Could possibly need present. It was spotlessly clean. The bed was very comfortable. The exercise room was decent for a hotel fitness center.

The location is great for Disney or Knotts Berry farm. Hotel itself was apparently renovated - which looks nice but very filthy.  during our 4 nights stay, house keeping didn’t bother to clean or vacuum and every night after we came back, towels were still on the floor. the only saving grace is that breakfast was decent.  personally i will pick another hotel if i am back in town.

Summary Heading: Nice place to "escape" the busy pace of LA and sightseeing
Summary: We chose this hotel because the Chase travel points were an excellent value. We were a little hesitant being far from a lot of the sights we wanted to see but felt the money we saved would be worth it. The location actually turned out to be perfect! Seal beach and Long Beach were a short drive. So nice to watch the sunset at the beach after a long day. The commute in to the city was long but we felt worth it to be OUT of the city where it was peaceful and quiet. The rooms were clean and comfortable though nothing fancy. Same to be said of the pool and hot tub. Breakfast also good with a nice amount of options. They even had almond milk. The kitchen was well equipped and groceries were not far off.This turned out to be the perfect base of operations  for our LA adventure.

Over all experience was very good and satisfy. Staff were very friendly and will say hello to guest. Location is very good and quiet, not near by the high way. Facilities can fulfill our need and we were very relaxed.

Booked a one-bedroom suite. Stayed in with my parents and I slept on the sofa bed, which was pretty comfortable as well. Breakfast was really good considering we have 3 people in total, thus saving us a lot of time and money

This Hyatt house was fantastic! Free parking, free breakfast, clean rooms, attentive staff, and a lot of niceties and amenities. The courtyard area is very nice with a fire pit and pool and hot tub. The overall value and it's location was excellent. I very highly recommend. Hyatt takes care of you and your family and this hotel is a model example! It also is located near a lot of stores and a lot of good places to eat that it made everything very convenient.

Big spacious rooms with full kitchens and bedroom.  It's a great place to stay if you need to work and spend several days there without eating out every night.  They had some cool happy hour stuff that I didn't have time for but looked fun.

Everything was perfect. Clean room, helpful staff and great breakfast. Malls are close by and there are a lot of good restaurants in the area. The pool and spa tub are great in the evening. There is also a shuttle that takes you in a 5 mi radius.

We really enjoyed our stay. The breakfast was great and there was an omlette bar. The room was comfortable and clean. There was a kitchen with plenty of storage, dishes and utensils. There were two tvs. It was perfect for our needs.

This hotel has been nicely redecorated and upgraded since my last stay here.  My greatest compliment to this hotel would be how comfortable the bed and pillows were, so much so that I wanted to take them home with me!  Best night's sleep I have had in some time.  The rain shower head in the bathroom was wonderful.  Also, there was a microwave and a refrigerator in the room.   The complimentary breakfast buffet was quite extensive, including made-to-order omelets, waffles, breakfast breads and meats, fresh fruit, juices, and more.  There was something for everyone.  It was raining so we weren't able to enjoy the outside facilities.  Hope to next stay.  Staff was friendly.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed he stay at Hyatt House
Summary: Special thanks to Hyatt staff who understand our needs and requests at check in, outstanding staff who are serving breakfast including the omelette station outside, room is clean, a little improvements can be done with outdated carpets, maybe as simple as shampooing the carpets will solve that issue, other than that the room is clean, thank you to the house keeping team, we had great time there, and for sure to come back next time when we are in the area.

We stayed at this Hyatt House Hotel while attending a concert. The hotel was not near tourist attractions, but we found it to be an extremely nice hotel. The room was large and comfortable, and very clean. The staff were efficient and readily available for questions. The breakfast was exceptional with an omelette station and many choices.

Hotel is in a good location plenty of restaurants and close to Disneyland and Anihiem convention center. It's about a 15-20 minute drive to neighboring cities such as long Beach I would stay here again however for the cost I might choose another hotel

Well located for my meetings. Welcoming staff.  Spacious rooms with a good bed. Bar with some good draft beers and a limited selection of food, I had a tasty cheeseburger. The only minor discomfort was a rumble from an  equipment (transformer?) in an adjoining room to which I was sensitive due to jet lag.

I'm at a big convention in Anaheim and finding a hotel is tricky unless you have very deep pockets.   This place is a 15 minute uber ride and was exactly what I was looking for.  A comfortable bedroom and a good sized living room and kitchenette. There's a reasonable gym, outdoor pool and laundry if you are so inclined.  Breakfast isn't bad, fresh omelettes is a nice touch.  No complaints here!

I selected this hotel for an overnight stay because:  1. I was traveling with my sister and 3 nephews. 2. I had family that lived nearby. 3. Close to Disney.  After I read some of the reviews, I knew this was the hotel to stay for my one night stay on New Year's Day.  The hotel is located in a very quiet area with various walkable eating options. The parking is free and so is breakfast/wifi.  The hotel is small but very nice. The check in was fast and everyone was very friendly.  The highlight was the room. Huge and very practical. We had two queen beds in a separate area from the living room where we had a sleeper sofa (which I used and was fine). A full kitchen. And I mean FULL. Fridge, microwave, dishwasher, dishes, silverware. Everything you would need for a longer stay.

This hotel is great, especially for extended stay to visit family. We were able to grill and have dinner with the family there. Great outdoor area with a fire pit. Pool and jacuzzi are nice, it's nice having everything in the inner courtyard, making it easily accessible & yet private from parking and roads.

This Hyatt House is very good since it's larger than a regular suite, more like a bedroom with a separate living room with large kitchen area, very convenient for couples or families.The room rate is ok, not the lowest in the area. But we got an excellent deal with only 8K points of Hyatt.

Summary Heading: I always stayed at HYATT house Cypress/Anaheim
Summary: During the past 14 years, when my boss sent me to Cypress Office in California, I always stayed at HYATT house Cypress/Anaheim. Hyatt House was only 5 minutes from my office and it had the best Made-to-Order Omelet Bar daily FREE.

Ive stayed at this location on severe occasions, always consistent,  good locations friendly staff , plenty of dining options nearby, would recommend this place to others. free beakfast is good with wide menu selection and Great corporate pricing courtyard facing rooms are a little noisy....  still highly recommended

Summary Heading: Good and quiet hotel business or temp stay
Summary: Booked a room here for 5 nights in November with house being remodeled.  I checked in using the app at 9AM and the room was literally available in about 20 minutes.  The hotel is in a pretty quiet/low-key location with many fast food and restaurants within walking distance.  Room was clean but felt claustrophobic by the design.  It was weird that the bathroom has so much wasted space that can be used to increase the bedroom size.       Free parking and breakfast is a big plus.  I also get 2 water bottles daily so certainly can't complain too much.  Overall it is a good hotel to escape for a few nights.

very small room for the price... No didn't have adequate seating or even a mirror to check our appearance. not what I expected at all. Then when I told the front desk she said well you can pay the going rate and get a better room. No Thanks.

Great hotel, good resturants around. Breakfast was tasty. To cold for trying the pool during my stay.If you are there for Disney or the rooler coaster, fantastic location, if you are looking for shopping and sightsing, far off. 1 hours drive from LAX.

Booked a week before our stay due to issues with our Airbnb and got a great room near the elevator. It was clean and smelled fresh. We were greeted and then given info how breakfast and checkout would be handled. The rest of our stay was seamless. We booked the King Hyatt Grand Bed Full Kitchen with hot breakfast included.

I have no complaints whatsoever.  I was especially impressed with Housekeeping.  They were very thorough and efficient and friendly.  One day we forgot we left a "Do Not Disburb" sign on the door and they slipped a note under the door reminding us of that and for us to let them know if we wanted them to come in and clean.  I thought that was a very nice touch.

Summary Heading: Very pleasant and comfortable suite hotel
Summary: Very comfortable, elegant and well equipped suite with a well-appointed kitchen. Everything in perfect order. This was our third stay and we will be coming back again,Good breakfast. Excellent California Fish Grill restaurant just outside of the hotel.

Summary Heading: I really enjoyed my extended stay here.  Breakfast was great, and all other Services were fantastic!
Summary: I was stayed here on extended business travel, and brought the family with me.  We all loved our stay, and would do it again in a heart beat!Which the rate was cheaper, but the services was magnificent!

I've stayed in different Hyatt hotels before and this hotel is by far the worst, I will not stay here again. If not for the staff that night we were there I will rate this hotel a 1-star. Check out the other Hyatt hotel in the area.

I would defiantly book this hotel again.Great Staffings who always greets you with a smile! Clean rooms and quiet. Just what I was looking for.Thank you Hyatt for the great experience.Loved the check in staff (wish I remembered her name) she was Fabulous! Made my day a whole lot better upon arriving to the hotel.Thank you!

From making the reservations to check out, everything was exceptional!  Hotel personnel was great and very clean rooms!  Would recommend Hyatt House Cypress/Anaheim to everyone!  Also, close to many attractions (Knotts, Disneyland, Performing Arts zcentets, Airport).

I've never had a bad experience with Hyatt, and this is no exception. The front desk staff welcomed us and made it easy to get our hotel keys. The housekeeping staff respected our no do disturb requests. They even had a contest for best decorated pumpkin for the guest to participate in. I enjoyed my stay here and highly recommend this Hyatt House.

Visiting California to attend a wedding at the Naval golf course country club. Hotel was very close and very nice. Very clean. The suites are big for the money you pay. Breakfast is good also. Close to the 405, 22, 605, 91 and 5 freeways. Easy access to most of OC and LA.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Cypress Hyatt. The service was really great. The rooms were a nice size. Staff was helpful and friendly. Was a short drive to Disneyland. There was so many different place to eat at. Target was also close by. Close to Huntington Beach. Plan on staying here on my future trips.

Love the cleanliness of this hotel. The Complementary breakfast is one of the best ones we have had. Rooms are clean and very home like. Would stay again over and over. My children enjoy staying at the Hyatt very relaxing.

Great place, my room in particular was somewhat musty. Had a bad odor. Almost smelled like toilet water had gotten on the carpet and never really got cleaned up properly or dried out properly. No screen on the bedroom window and I could not open it to get air even if there was a screen.

This Hyatt does not live up to the Hyatt name and reputation.  Rooms need updating.  Doors slam shut all night and keep you awake. Not a good business hotel.  This is a loud hotel.  The good going for this hotel was the breakfast.  It offered a nice spread.  Other than that, stay away.

Staffs are very friendly and everything is fairly clean. My two daughters loved and enjoyed to stay there.Breakfast was good and they had miso soup! Kids loved waffles. My husband and I liked the omelettes they made for us.

My sisters and I stayed here. I had a rent the runway dress shipped to the hotel and the front desk was so great with holding/getting it to me. We had a busy week so unfortunately could not experience all the amenities of the hotel, but what we did experience was great.The area was good too around a few different food/Shopping areas. Very close to disney & not a bad ride to our cousins wedding in Los Angles. Would stay again.

Summary Heading: Great Stay!  Peaceful Environment!  Hotel & Room very Clean!
Summary: Great Experience! Very clean! Modern rooms with a cozy feeling of home. Staff very friendly!  I Highly recommend you stay here.  Very safe and secure environment.  Weekend stay and hotel was very peaceful.

The Hyatt House brand in general is solid and this hotel is very typical of the brand. Large stylish rooms, very comfortable. Nice outdoor courtyard with fire pits though the cushions on the furniture are well past time to replace. Specific to this property, business travelers should be aware that like most extended stay properties within striking distance of Anaheim, you are going to get families of Disney goers. Which often means noisy groups in the courtyard and pool in the evenings, and loud crowded breakfasts. Especially thru the summer months.  So ask for a room that does not face the courtyard. Also their DirectTv selection is truly abysmal, and they do not have smart TV’s.  They tend not to remember preferences for rooms, which as a Globalist is annoying. One desk clerk

Love staying at this Hyatt! The staff is efficient and friendly. The property is well kept. Love the breakfast variety and quality. Housekeeping staff is great. Additionally -  they always have met my room preferences.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay! Plus GREAT OMELETS!
Summary: Can't wait to come back again, plus the young woman making the fresh omelets in the courtyard was FANTASTIC Chef! Best omelet I have had in years! Room was great as it made me feel like my home away from home!
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for choosing Hyatt and for taking the time to share your experience. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed our omelet station as much as we do. We look forward to having you stay with us on your next visit.  Cordially,

Summary: excellent staff and stay.  very clean room and staff was very friendly.  breakfast was great with an omelet station small bar but great prices and quality food.  will stay here again if I need to. very enjoyable
Manager Response: Hi,  Thank you for choosing Hyatt and for taking the time to share your stay. We are happy to hear you enjoyed our hot breakfast and look forward to your next visit.  Cordially,

Summary: Was there for 8 days on business, felt very welcomed and pampered and the staff were just wonderful. Always had smiles and a hello and made me feel that they wanted me to be there! Was very happy with my stay and would definitely go back!
Manager Response: Hi,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us and we look to forward to your next visit in town.  Cordially,

Summary Heading: Awesome, The best family hotel to stay at
Summary: It’s quiet with great privacy and provides a calming sanctuary upon entry thru it's wide door. This suite we stayed in for our trip had a full kitchen, 2 bedrooms and spacious living room. The outdoor pool was great as well, and the continental breakfast had a large assortment of foods. This hotel is a top notch. It  felt like great home away from home, would highly recommend it
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are delighted to hear you and your loved ones had a great stay with us. It is your feedback that allows us to continue to improve on our offerings such as our complimentary breakfast hot breakfast and our spaciuous suites. We look forward to your next visit.  Cordially,

Summary: Central location to theme parks and Vietnamese businesses. Very clean, nice and roomy suite with Double Queen Beds. My family loves this hotel. I stayed here in July and come back again in August. My friends also really like this hotel.
Manager Response: Hi,  Thank you for choosing Hyatt and for sharing with your friends and family. We are delighted to hear our convenient location suits your needs and those of your loved ones. We look forward to your next visit.  Cordially,

Summary: Located about 25 miles from LA, this Hyatt House is TOP NOTCH!  Quite possibly, one of my very favorite hotels. The property gets families going to Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm, people relocating to the area, and many many business travelers.  What the hotel has going for it most are the employee’s commitment to great service, and the outdoor heated pool/hot tub/fire pit area. Employees are courteous and keep things running smoothly, especially a man named Alberto. We saw him working hard early in the morning in the breakfast area, vacuuming in the afternoon, and still helping out around the pool at night- hardest working man I’ve ever seen, and obviously wearing many hats. Housekeeping staff is also extremely efficient and professional.    The beautiful pool in the

Great breakfast and excellent stay! Breakfast had an omelette bar, miso soup, and then the typical eggs, french toast, etc. Great job! Bed was super clean and comfy. The only thing I wouldn't recommend is the grilled cheese from the bar, it was awful. Also, kids in the pool can be pretty loud until 10 pm. If you have a room overlooking the pool you won't be able to go to bed early

I chose this hotel for location first and foremost but was delighted when I arrived - stayed for 10 nights. Great service, great rooms and breakfast is ok, needs bacon though :DHighly recommend this hotel.

Hotel is in great condition. A car is a must in this suburban area. Breakfast was delicious, including cooked to order omelets and miso soup with the condiments. The room was impeccably clean and the AC worked wonders. Although I didn't use the full kitchen, it appeared fully stocked with kitchen supplies. Would stay again.

We arrived for an extended weekend getaway. And found this place to be better than we had expected. The front desk service was amazing. The rooms are extremely large and the beds are bid and comfortable. The rooms are equipped with a full size refrigerator, top stove, microwave and a sink. All the comforts of home. The rooms were clean and plentiful of towels. The breakfast had eggs to order which was a great treat    We will make Hyatt house our preferred place to stay anywhere we travel.

We stayed at the Hyatt House- Cypress Anaheim and so glad we did! Very clean and accomadating.  So close to everything! We spent half the week up in LA and the rest of the time in Orange County.  We were able to take advantage of the wide selection of daily, fresh breakfast included, go night swimming with the kids and even do a little laundry.  The place was equipped with all the basic needs and was very peaceful and family friendly.  The staff was great! Definitely a place to stay at again when we return!

Summary Heading: Noisy anarchic out of towels hotel
Summary: How can you be out of pool towels for an entire weekend?  Noisy inconsiderate families with no supervision, and the breakfast was so crowded and packed in, it was not a viable option.  Parking was ample, the room was clean, and the staff was pleasant enough, even as they refused to ask other guests to follow the hotel's rules.

Although a long drive to many of the LA sites this hotel was a welcome oasis of calm after the madness of the freeway. Very well maintained property, good rooms, very good breakfast and felt very safe. Nice to use the hot tub or sit around the firepit in the evening

My family stayed at this Hyatt House for 4 nights. We enjoy the Hyatt House experience whenever we can find one in our travels- wish there were more! Great hotel for a good price. The kitchen has full size appliances and provides plates/bowls, cups/glasses, utensils, pots/pans, dish soap, paper towels, etc. The kitchen and living room were separate from the bedroom/bath. The bed and linens were comfortable. Black-out shades on bedroom window and patio door. Plenty of places in the room to plug in phones, iPads, etc. for charging.  Our room over looked the inner courtyard where there is a pool and hot tub (hotel provides towels), fire pit with surround seating and 2 grills. This courtyard is a nice gathering area to talk to other travelers and order a drink or food from the H Bar

The Facilities were fantastic from the free WSJ or Today newspapers to free computers and printer, was nice. The jacuzzi was perfect. Breakfast was outstanding, with made order omletes.  The bed was so comfortable I just fell right to sleep, just great. Randy h

Hotel was very clean. Good location. Professional and curteous staff. Good needs improvement. Real eggs not carton eggs, half and half for coffee, free coffe all day, more pastry variety would improve food

The hotel was in a great neighbourhood, close to many good restaurants.  It was only a 20 min drive to HB Pier.  Room was very clean and was perfect for the three of us.  Full kitchen, separate bedroom, great walk in shower.  And the breakfast buffet was much better than I thought it would be.  Overall just a great location and value!

Summary Heading: Complicated, multifamily, multi change, multi-need visit
Summary: Our stay at the Hyatt House was awesome. We had three branches of a family there for 4 nights. Due to trying to organize all of these stays, we had to make multiple changes to our reservations, one part of two reservations was booked on Travelocity (meaning we could not make changes...adding one night), the hotel accommodated us calling me multiple to make sure they understand the two reservations that had to be made separately from the Travelocity reservation for the same groups. In addition, a wheelchair had to be rented for one family member, they recommended a company and facilitated the delivery and return of the wheelchair.   Truly, we had to be a bit of a pain to staff, but they were friendly, accommodating and thorough.    In addition, with their included breakfast,

Be careful when sleeping on the sofa bed. I’ve traveled all over the world and this is the first time ever I got infested by bed bugs. When I notified the front desk, all they told me was it was the first time hearing about that issue from my room. Of course it would be the first time otherwise it would be fixed! I asked for procedures and he didn’t seem to know what to do so I asked for zip loc bags to put my clothes in.

Lots of problems with a super narrow room, nice, comfortable bed too big for the room, good bathroom and shower, had refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot, but no balcony or opening window yet a king room at $200 a night! Had to complain about noise and no cleaning of my room one day and room. Manager gave me a decent discount, best part of my stay. Also nice clean pool and jacuzzi and great location in Cypress near Huntington Beach.

Summary Heading: Son’s first time to Knotts Berry Farm
Summary: This hotel is in a really nice spot. Many places to choose from to eat. They have a restaurant but it has a few items to choose from. The bartender took really good care of us I believe her name was Pam? Rooms were comfy and my son enjoyed the pool. We had a nice view from our room of the pool and the breakfast was decent. I would definitely stay in the hotel again although when I called before we were headed to this hotel they said they had a shuttle for Knotts Berry Farm. When we wanted to use it the day we were going to Knotts they didn’t have any drivers. That was the only downfall.

The beds were so comfortable which was important after long days at theme parks. The room felt like a home away from home, nice size kitchen and living area. Breakfast was AMAZING! We will definitely be back again!

This was a great place in avery good location close to many different restaurant. Hotel very clean and tge staff was awesome from check in guy to the maid if you looking for a great place this is it thank you.

Room was clean and updated from the last time we visited. Also it was a breeze to update our reservation. No issues when checked in or out. Would be great if they could lower the pet fee. They were welcoming to our dog though!

Summary Heading: Would highly recommend this Hyatt House
Summary: We rarely have had a bad experience at a Hyatt House in the United States. This was no exception. It was in great condition, plenty of parking, in a good location, and friendly staff. The free breakfast was excellent. The eggs, potatoes and sausage were very good and the omelets excellent! Unlike some hotels these days where they govern how cool they will let the room be (which is normally too warm), we were able to adjusted the A/C to a comfortable level. Although the sleep comfort was great as we could have the room at a comfortable temperature, I am not a fan of the pillow they use. They are overstuffed and very fat. I do not find them to be that comfortable. I would prefer a flatter pillow and if I wanted more height, I would use two. We had a good experience with the check

Excellent customer service and the rooms are clean and well kept. The complementary breakfast was more than I expected. I highly recommend this hotel for your stay. It’s in a convenient location and has everything to make your stay as close to being at home.

Summary Heading: Another top hotel in the Hyatt Family!
Summary: This hotel is located in close proximity to many Southern California attractions.  It has a personality of being a business friendly as well as a family hotel.  The Hyatt staff is always wanting to make sure your stay is enjoyable!  Would highly recommend!

Clean, spacious with a living room, kitchen and separate bedroom. Ideal for an extended business stay nestled in a quiet corporate park. Several good restaurants adjacent to the hotel complex. Rooms are nice but hallway and elevators could use some spiffying up.

This suite I stayed in for this business trip had a full kitchen, 2 bedrooms and spacious living room. The salt water outdoor pool was great as well, and the continental breakfast had a large assortment of foods.

This was our first stay at a Hyatt House. A friend had recommended it and I'm glad we took her word on it. The rooms were very clean and modern. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful!I My kids had a great time. We will definitely be coming back!

Was not happy with room conditions, needs renovations, not worth money. We will not recommend this property friends or family in future stay. Need to re do guest bathrooms, new bedding , new furniture.

PROS: This facility is close to our kids and Chili's next door is great for dinner. The patio seating is very nice and a comfortable place to visit. The check-in staff are very nice and accommodating.   CONS: The shower is a terrible design and the living room seating is extremely uncomfortable. The pillows on the bed are like bricks.

Loved the location. Extremely clean, room was so spacious and having a kitchen was a plus. Breakfast was awesome too! They have an Omelette station . We enjoyed making our personal omelets every day .

First your staff needs not to charge my card when the company card is on file!! Next AC vents are above the master room bed which blows cold air right onto the bed. Also, after my 2 week stay I decided to stay an extra day and they came in the next morning telling us it was check-out by house keeping making my family uncomftarble, I think the staff needs to be more friendly towards their tenants. As my wife felt housekeeping barged in the room and rudely stated its check out with out knowing we paid an extra day. Staff has lack of communication towards its housekeeping associates.

This was our second choice for a hotel on this occasion.  So glad we were able to book a night here.  You have now become my top choice in hotels.  Your rooms, value, cleanliness and service left little to desire.  See you again soon!

This hotel has it's good points and not so good but it grew on us after a few days stay. The lobby was clean and updated but our room was a little worn. The hallway always seemed like it needed to be vacuumed, like someone had crumbled crackers here and there. On the weekend parking was very hard to find. We ended up having to park across the street which wouldn't have been that big of a deal except you had to cross a sometimes busy street with no crosswalk nearby. The bed was comfortable and there was enough space in the room. The area felt safe and we could not hear the traffic in our room. On Friday and Saturday, it kinda felt like a party hotel. One night seemed like people were partying in the parking lot and the next night sounded like a huge party in one of the rooms we

We have a need to stay at a hotel with a roll-in shower after surgery. Room 362 is a very spacious, comfortable room equipped with a big refrigerator, microwave oven, etc for longer stay. It’s located conveniently near the elevator; yet it’s quiet with great privacy and provides a calming sanctuary upon entry thru it's wide door. Our room faces the front; Interior facing rooms have view of a nice courtyard patio and pool. In addition to the usual breakfast fares the buffet offers Asian items like hot miso soup, rice, etc plus omelette made to order. The hotel ambience is clean, quiet and relaxing. The front desk staff are friendly and helpful. It’s proximity to the intersection of two major boulevards (Valley View and Katella) ensures many eating choices close by.

Beyond our expectations.  Great breakfast.  Pool and courtyard area were available for all our family.  We even had our Memorial Day BBQ there using the grills provided.  Hotel was accommodating to all ages.

My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt House before and after our cruise.  Let me tell you, the rooms were clean, the bed was comfortable, minimal noise, and the breakfast was wonderful.  I definitely will stay here again!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, quiet area, lots of good food nearby
Summary: We got a suite with 2 queen beds and sofa in front room, full kitchen, TV in each room. Inexplicably, there was a Cheeto in the sink when we arrived. Apparently the maid wasn't tall enough to see it. There was even a balcony, but beware of letting in mosquitos. Breakfast was good - waffles. Hotel is in a quiet area, but there are lots of good restaurants nearby. Kids' electronics hooked up to TV with no problem. Internet was fine.

Room was excellent, they made sure I had clean towels every morning. The breakfast omelets were the best thing in the morning. Each day I got to taste a different style of omelet. There are good restaurants in the nearby area. and only 20mins from the nearest beach.

Summary Heading: Dirty room. Breakfast made me sick
Summary: I was in a king suite and I found many dirty spots throughout the room and bathroom, including something that looking like make up on the sheets and a pubic hair on the toilet. The breakfast made me sick all day after I left. I came here for a business meeting but I definitely won’t be coming back. I always stay at Hyatt’s and this might be the worst one in Orange County.

Best hotel breakfast I’ve ever had, and it’s free. No joke. They don’t start serving it until 7:00, but it’s worth waiting for. Spacious room and very clean and comfortable. Had a crib for our son so we didn’t have to bring one with us. Highly recommended!

Summary Heading: Fantastic place to stay right outside the crowded Disney area!
Summary: I didn't want to be in the crowded Disney area, so I stayed here for the weekend while attending a sports event at the Anaheim Convention Center.  Check-in/out was fast with no problems. My king-sized room was fantabulous!  I didn't expect there to be a full-sized kitchen (I thought maybe kitchenette at the most), a full living room area with huge L-shaped sofa and large, flat-screen TV, a separate bedroom with it's own TV as well, and a very roomy bathroom. Breakfast was awesome, with each day offering a different type of omelette made-to-order outside next to the pool area.  Very easy to get to with freeway access nearby, quiet and convenient location, and Chili's, Wendy's and Burger King are all within a very short walking distance.

The front desk staff was helpful and caring to all of our needs. My wife and I received the larger ADA suite as an added bonus. Large spacious well kept room for our comfort. Although the bed was acceptable, time to be updated 🤨

Loved this hotel.  We would stay here again.  We really liked the buffet as it was a full buffet with hot food and an omelet bar.  The suite was very comfortable and perfect for our stay as we were staying for a week and the extra room made our stay very comfortable.

Perfect two night stay for my family of four. The place was clean and relatively updated. It had everything we needed. Lots of food options nearby and only about a 10 min. drive to Knott's and Disney. About 15 min drive to Great Wolf. Full kitchen with all the amenities and the full breakfast served in the morning if a definite bonus!

Nice rooms, but the noise level from down stairs from third floor up woke  me up each morning. Rooms needs sound proof panels  or curtains to keep it quite. Nice to be able to park free , close to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Nice for any type of stay.
Summary: The Hyatt House is a nice property. The lobby is large and open, and there is a great dining area that turns into a bar in the evening. The courtyard has plenty of seating, a fire pit at night, and a nice pool with hot tub. The rooms are very spacious with a smart floorplan. My only complaint is my shower's tile floor was missing grout between the tiles which allowed water to pool around my feet. My thought is that this yucky shower is an anomaly that will be fixed soon. Overall I'd recommend this hotel for families, groups of friends, or business travels.

Room was nice and clean. Breakfast had different varieties each morning with lots of choices. We liked having the shuttle available for short trips when other family members had the car. Center court yard has bbq grills, fire pit and night and pool and hot tub. Staff was friendly and welcoming.

Really clean. Breakfast was awesome. People were nice and polite. The room and spacious. We had a 1 bedroom suite with the works. Very quiet and slept like a baby in the soft bed. This was a great stay.

We have stayed here 2 times when visiting California the hotel is clean, the staff is nice and the rooms are awesome. Breakfast is very good and lots to choose from including omelettes to order. I recommend this hotel. Five stars

This is my second time to stay here, so obviously I really enjoy this place. Comfortable and safe place to stay. Loved it! I was able to check-in and check out online. It’s very convenient. My son who lives nearby, was able to visit and stay with us overnight. Extra bedding is available. And that is awesome 👏🏼.

We were looking for a nice place to stay near Knott's Berry Farm for our grandson's birthday.  Our room at the Hyatt House was fantastic.  It was clean and comfortable and close to Knott's. They offer free breakfast with a waffle bar and an omelet station.  We would definitely stay there again.

This Residence-Inn like hotel was spotlessly clean, spacious, with a nice efficiency kitchen, free full breakfast included, dog friendly and super accommodating.   It was 15 min to Disneyland and Knotts, and less than 45 to Universal Studios. Restaurants within walking distance (Chilis, El Torito, a fish house, a sushi and thai place). Loved it.

Had an extended stay waiting for our new home to close escrow. Entire staff was very welcoming and always willing to assist. The property was impeccable— extremely well kept and the rooms very clean and comfortable.

Summary Heading: Marriott customer trying staying at Hyatt
Summary: I usually stay at the Marriott and wanted to try Hyatt. IT was good but Marriott usually provides food and drinks in the evenings as well that is a definite plus it has over Hyatt. I did have a little bad experience as the water from the tub was not draining and on calling the front desk was told that "I will be provided with a plunger" !

Summary Heading: Gem near Knott's Berry Farm and Disneyland
Summary: Great place to stay with a family. The suites were perfect for our family of three. The couch is a pullout and the king has a door that closes. The bathroom is a tad tight and the show door was extremely heavy, but it was so cute. The kitchenette was a decent size, but we didn't really use it. If we had stayed a while it would have been a great addition. The pool is heated and opened from 10a-10p. A night swim was fun since no one was in the pool or hot tub. The reception and housekeeping staff was friendly. We asked for a quiet room away from others and that is what we received.

The main reason why I love hyatt hotel is because they have a designated area and bedrooms for pets, unfortunately I can't be in contract with pets Im extremely allergic. I got the hyatt membership for that reason then I can go any part of the world with with that amazing benefits for me. In this particular hyatt hotel they only admit pets in tbe 1st floor bedrooms.

I checked in online. Got an email that our room was ready at 2. Got there at 4. The front desk didn’t know anything about our check in or anything about the emails. She gave us directions to the opposite side of the hotel for our room. Gave us our key that didn’t work to open the door she directed us to. We had to lug our bags back around to the front to get another key, walked back around to find we were parked pretty far away. Moved the car. Opened our very musty, moist smelling room. We immediately opened all the doors and windows trying to air it out. You can’t turn the shower on without getting hit with cold water. The sheets were a little rough. Checked out at the desk at 10:30. Then got a message that my checkout was late. Called and was told I never checked out.

This hotel was a very good hotel and the service was great. It was awesome to just get away from everything and just relax. Me and my family will be coming back very soon. I have already recommended this hotel to my entire family. :)

This facility was fabulous. The staff, room, breakfast, check in, facilities were awesome. This is my go to hotel whenever I am in Orange County. I enjoy this hotel and on a whole this is the best hotel and the price is very good. I always feel that I get more bang for my buck here.

Summary Heading: My Business stay at Htatt Cypress California
Summary: My stay was very good. The Food was good and my room was always clean and ready for me when I arrived back from my work day. The shuttle service was very helpful in taking me to restaurants in the local area in the evening

This hotel was great place to visit garden Grove and Disneyland. The fact you have a kitchen in your room made it feel as if we were at home. The staff was great and breakfast was a feast. The only thing to wish for was screen doors for the windows. Without them bugs can fly in your room and was very annoying to get out

We usually stay at Hyatt when we travel, and this was the first time we stayed at this location.  I enjoyed the convenience of be close proximity to most of LA.   Plenty of restaurant offerings and nearby grocery and Target.  The staff are helpful & courteous.  The rooms are well maintained & stocked with everything you need for a suite.  The H bar happy hour and morning spread breakfast are what draws me the most.  We would definitely stay at this hotel again. 😁

Summary Heading: Stayed here for a 2-day Disneyland trip
Summary: Stayed here for a 2-day trip to Disneyland. We normally stay about a mile away from the parks at another Hyatt House location, pay for parking and walk over but there was no availability there so we stayed here. Its a little further and we had to drive about 15 minutes and park at Disneyland, but the Hyatt House here has free parking which worked out great.   Upon check-in we were advised that we were upgraded to a King suite. It wasn't necessary as we were pretty much just sleeping here overnight, but it was nice bonus.  The complimentary breakfast here is better than any of the other hotel hot food breakfasts, including other Hyatt Houses; really random they have miso soup and pickled Japanese plum.  Nearby they have several food options. Wished Lee's Sandwiches was open while

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a Disney vacation
Summary: We stayed here 5 nights and 6 days while visiting Disneyland and Universal Studios. Loved the spacious rooms with full fridge and where to cook. The breakfasts are amazing and the receptionists are super nice. Disneyland was only 15-20 min away and Universal like an hour away. We really enjoyed our stay here and will probably come back here for future visits to the area. I chose this place after a ton of research on affordable good hotels and Im glad I picked this place. The only thing we didn’t like was the pullout bed. It was very uncomfortable. You can feel the bed bars when you sleep on it.

Breakfast was excellent for hotel. Smoke alarms went off one night due to someone in their room burning something hotel staff didn't inform us that it was safe to return to our room had to ask fireman.

To be clear, the hotel staff, room, etc. was very nice. My review  focuses on the guest room itself. The room itself is average for this price range but what made my stay miserable is the a/c unit, bed, pillows, and fridge. First, the a/c unit was extremely loud that it woke me up every time it kicked in so needless to say i didn't get a good nights sleep. Second, the bed was just not comfortable. It felt like my feet was higher than my head. Third, the pillows looked like they were fluffy but once you laid your head on them, i can feel the bed. Lastly, the mini-fridge when going through its cycle kept making these popping noises. Needless to say, all these things made for horrible stay and would not stay here again.
