Parking was safe , having stayed in many hotels in he surrounding area, not all parking lots or garages feel safe. Hyatt is the perfect stay in the area.

very nice rooms some are small but the suites are big with its own living room , not too espensive. Close to dinning restaurants and to Disneyland .Parking is big and secure. Nice swimming pool and spa.

This hotel is super clean, excellent staff.  Good choices for the complimentary hot breakfast - from ham, sausage and eggs, omelette, to bagel and bread, cereals, yogurt, fruits, juices, coffee and teas. Very close to Downtown Disney and Knotts Berry Farm.

As last year, my family (hubby, teen, 7 year old and toddler) and I traveled to the US for the summer holidays, this time to the West Coast, so I embrace the chance to review a few properties around... This time all properties were pre-selected, I did a lot of research and decided to give a chance to the Hyatt chain, despite my not-so-secret and deep love for the Hampton Inn properties all over the world. We visited Hyatt Place Ontario, New York New York in las Vegas, Hyatt House Cypress-Anaheim, Seacrest Oceanfront Hotel Pismo Beach and Hyatt House Emeryville-San Francisco Bay. After a fun few days in Vegas, we headed back to California to stay five nigths in the Hyatt House Cypress-Anaheim. First I have to say again, what a lovely little city Cypress is! We loved it as much as

I've stayed at other Hyatt houses and places. A lot of them were similar so I didn't expect anything too different, but I really liked the room here! I also appreciated that it was affordable (don't get me wrong, expensive) and worth it. It was clean, comfortable, and the staff was pleasant and understanding. You also can't beat a decent and complimentary breakfast in the morning! Honestly, I didn't utilize it that much because I went out to eat a lot but when I did, it was nice to have as an option. I also appreciate the fresh fruit. This is one of the nicer Hyatt houses, I think!

Excellent Hotel in an unbeatable location. Good Amenities. WI-FI faster and stable. Restaurant Service & Bar until 10 pm which is good   because the majority of the  restaurants in the zone closes at 9:00 pm. Also, they have amazing Breakfast!!

The rooms are quite spacious and comfortable. The work area and kitchenette are very functional and its easy to just relax. The surrounding restaurants give a discount if you tell them you're staying at the Hyatt. We found this hotel to be close to everything we need while visiting family in the area.

The set up here is pretty nice a small kitchen a living room and a bedroom with a matress came out from a dream. Make you feel like home even thou you aint going to use the kitchen for nothing and the bottle beers at the lobby are $7.50 the premises are well maintain ooohhh and they got pretty good complementary breakfast maybe that's why they charge so much for the beers. But overall is a pretty good choice to stay if you are in the Cypress area for business.

I was so taken care of by this property and in particular 3 of the employees.  Sharon, Ben and Paula, these 3 Amigos are FANTASTICO!!! I will go back to this property because of the these 3. And of course Hyatt House being an excellent property as well.

We have stayed at the Hyatt House in Cypress a number of times and always enjoyed it.  The hotel is very convenient to our family and friends in SoCal and works out well for us when we visit California from Texas.  The rooms are great because they have a kitchen and dining area along with a separate bedroom and good sized bathroom.  We like that there is a nice breakfast each morning which includes made to order omelets, potatoes, breakfast meats, cold and hot cereal plus fruit and breads.  Way more than just a cold continental breakfast.  The pool is not real large but it is enjoyable and there is also a hot tub.  Just outside the pool area are a number of large tables with umbrellas and a few grills too so you can enjoy a bbq.  We have always had very good service from the

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great location, great staff!
Summary: We've stayed at many Hyatt House locations in New Jersey and California. This is now, by far, our favorite location because of the design, space, set up, and perfect distance to stores, restaurants, beaches, cities, etc. Hyatt House Cypress/Anaheim staff were absolutely amazing, especially Sharon and her front desk staff. Sharon was very accommodating from prior to check-in via phone, actual check-in, throughout stay, and check-out. Sharon and her team was very attentive, thorough, genuine, and a pleasure to speak to and have during our visit.

The hotel is in a convenient location, close to Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm. It has many restaurants around it so it's easy to find food in the evening.  The rooms a pretty spacious, our family of 5 fitted in well. They are clean and tidy and have everything you need. Beds are quite small though, and a little uncomfortable. Bathroom was adequate, but the shower pretty poor, a trickle of water rather than a nice power shower. Bathroom products were basic.  The free breakfast is a bit limited, but adequate. Food quality is not great, but fits the bill for most families. I would probably stay there again if in the area.  Staff were pleasant and helpful when required. The patio door had a steel bar to keep it shut, which, whilst useful, did not give much confidence for the area.

Summary Heading: Very good for families and long-term stays
Summary: We stayed here for 3 months during a remodel (and my parents stayed here for 3 months themselves for their remodel) and this is a good place to stay.  We had the largest room in the whole hotel and it was spacious.  They don't have a shuttle to Disneyland, FYI, but I did take a shuttle back to our neighborhood not far away.  Breakfast is nice and they even have Asian things like rice and miso soup at breakfast.  Pool is small and nothing special.  Service at front desk just OK, nothing outstanding or what one would expect at a Hyatt Regency or a Grand Hyatt.  Quiet hotel otherwise.  Sometimes there is noise in the front of the hotel from the street because for some reason people race down that road which is an entry and exit for an office park area.  Good convenient food nearby

Summary Heading: Great Family Hotel Close to Disneyland
Summary: We enjoyed our stay here in a one bedroom suite with two queen beds is and a pullout sofa. The room is very nice and updated. Housekeeping did a great job keeping the room clean. Kitchen area was very nice with the full-size fridge and a large kitchen island. 15 minute drive to Disneyland. Only criticism would be the selection of toiletries that they leave in the bathroom.

Wonderful experience, we have now determined that this hotel will be our home-away-from-home whenever we're in Southern California to visit our kids attending area college, Disneyland & Universal Studios.  Such a big bonus to have rice and miso soup included as the breakfast - that's a first!  Only wish the pool hours were extended to 11 pm or midnight and open earlier in the morning.  After a day at Disneyland, wanted to take advantage of soaking our feet in the hot tub but disappointed the pool closed at 10pm!  Thank you for an incredible stay!

We spent three nights at this hotel and it was lovely!  The morning complimentary breakfast was delicious, the beds comfy, and the rooms spacious.  We opted to eat dinner two nights at the hotel, and the food and service was top notch - thank you Robert!  Perfect place for families, couples and business travelers!

This is an ideal place for business travelers. The location is ideal, rooms were clean and accommodating to the business traveler. Friendly staff and very helpful when I needed directions and assistance with presentation materials.

I stay in that area on the average of every 8 weeks.  I have now stayed at all three of the big name hotels that are within a mile of each other. Hyatt House is by far the BEST.  The environment within the hotel is very pleasing.  The staff are all very friendly and present a sincere desire to assist you with anything that you need.  I will continue to stay there as long as I am traveling to that destination.

Only issues with this hotel is the very bad WiFI service. Throughout our stay here, we could not get WiFi service 100% of the time. The WiFI service we were told by the Hotel and tech support was due to scalability issues.

Summary Heading: I think this is my FAVORITE hotel!
Summary: I love love love this place.  My checking account however ... not so much especially in the summertime.    The staff was nice and friendly, the rooms were amazing!! This is weird but I even loved the shower.  For those looking to take a bath , no bath tub.  It was like a mini upgraded condo.  The breakfast was just as amazing as the room with white rice and cook to order breakfast.   The kids keep asking to stay here again but we will have to wait till the prices drop a bit.  It is well worth it for a family!

love staying here for business/pleasure twice a year. The hotel is clean, up to date, and the staff is more than friendly. The breakfast is full of choices. The pool is enticing and the fire pit is a nice touch at the end of the day.

This hotel is so comfortable a lot of the guest stay in all day. They have good breakfast buffet made to order omelets. And for dinner plenty of restaurants close by as well as Costco. WiFi in the area is not that good. However requesting a Atrium view room paid off not only did we have a patio we were also on the first floor which made traveling for our family of five a breeze. The bathrooms in the suites are beautiful. I would definitely recommend to my family and friends.

This was out 8th stay - The Hyatt house has been our go-to hotel for basketball tournament stays.  The large rooms give our faily of 4 ample room and the kitchenette is an added feature.  On this last visit we found the room not so clean - trash was left from the previous guest and there was food on the kitchen floor so it obviously had not been cleaned. Other than the made to order omelets, breakfast is mediocre.  The Hyatt House is a bit above average for a somewhat reasonably priced hotel however attention to detail was lacking.

I had a wedding to attend in the area and decided to book a night at the hotel. I am a platinum member and always try to stay at a Hyatt when looking for accommodations.  The hotel lobby is open and nice. They have a tiny convenience store to purchase essentials, a bit pricey.  The breakfast was PACKED, we arrived a little after 9am and the oatmeal was gone. I asked a server if they were going to bring more (since breakfast finished at 10) and she said NO, it takes too long to cook. That was disappointing as that was what I was looking forward to eating..But, breakfast is free...so we can't complain too much. The line for an omelette was extremely long and I gave up as it just wasn't worth it. I recommend during the busy summer months to anticipate running out of food and figure

Our gymnastics team, 20 girls and their families, stayed at Hyatt House Cypress for a week. The facility was excellent with modern spacious rooms, a beautiful pool and common area, and  plenty of free parking. The staff was amazing. They helped us arrange for each of our athletes to receive a goodie bag at check in (we shipped them ahead of time and they handed them out), they helped us arrange a pizza party for all of our girls, and they answered a million questions about surrounding areas and attractions. Every person, from the housekeeping staff to the bar tender, was so nice.  Breakfast was fantastic with lots of hot and cold options, fresh fruit and other healthy options, and made to order omelets! Everything was spotlessly clean, from the rooms to the pool and hot tub.

Summary Heading: Good hotel at decent price with poor breakfast
Summary: Stayed four nights in one bedroom suite. Compact property, nice courtyard with a small pool, good, tidy, recently renovated room (no balconies), excellent wi-fi speed, very convenient parking. Personnel friendly and helpful. Scarce breakfast offering (omelet station was ok but no vegetables, very few cold cuts etc), smallish breakfast room with more tables in the courtyard but does not help when morning is too chilly to sit outside..., plastic cups and plastic cutlery!!! (at morning rush hour they struggle to replenish 'normal' cups/cutlery).  Few steps away is a nice 'food court' type location Cypress Pointe which is very convenient (California Fish Grill highly recommended).

This hotel has everything....kitchen two room, laundry, breakfast.....it was like living in an apartment with maid service and a chef!  The breakfast was incredible.  They even have restrooms in the hallways on all the floors, which was super convenient to stop there on the way to your room if everyone needs to go and only have one restroom with 3 of you!

We checked into this hotel twice with a gap in between because they were sold out. Stayed in the large King suite with the separate living room. It was a wonderful stay while we are in the middle of moving here from out of state. The only complaint I would have is the noise level. Every night and early morning we can hear people talk from outside the front of the hotel. Our windows (2nd floor) faced the front of the hotel. It woke us up early and kept us up at night. I think of the windows were sound proof it would have been perfect! Bonus is that our small pup was able to stay with us. The service and customer service is superb! Def will stay again!!

They have very professional & friendly staffs, willing to help and recommend some places for shopping.  Also has a hotel shuttle service to drop or pick you up within 5 miles.  Breakfast is really good and surprised with their Japanese miso soup as well.  Room is clean & tidy.  Their swimming pool is really great, too !!!

Summary Heading: Has potential, but unclean & BED BUGS
Summary: I have stayed here many times, before when it was Woodfin, & now as Hyatt House. As Woodfin, I felt that they needed major improvements so I was happy when Hyatt took over and did renovations. With that being said, the last 2 times I have stayed here (last month and now this past week- from 6/21~6/24) I felt the housekeeping was really bad. Last month my bathroom was filthy, with hair all over the bathroom floor and soap scum all over in the shower tile & glass.  This stay, (I was in Room 128 on the first floor) I had some sort of beetle visit me in the bathroom, 2 small spiders, and I had bed bugs!!  (totaling over 30 bites all over my feet, legs and back!! 😲)-pics attached. I think I will have to pass on this property for any future business trips. It's too bad because I like

Was in town on vacation. Stay was for 5 days and we really enjoyed it.  Rooms were clean and staff was very friendly and courtious.  Hot breakfast was good.  Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Summary Heading: Hyatt House one of the best in the area
Summary: I was pleasantly surprised to find this hotel. I was with my family of four. Enjoyed the stay wish we had more with similar features. Refrigerator Microwave and dishes were present in the rooms. Great Value!!!!

The staff, the lobby, the breakfast, the rooms...all wonderful!  However, after three stays, I don't think I will return...the wifi is simply horrible which makes it very difficult for business travel.  Very difficult to log on.  Drops you.  I've spoken with their tech support each stay.  They just need to upgrade.  Good mix of family and business travelers.  Feels very friendly and inviting.  Fire pit in the evening is a nice touch.  The Chili's next door is very good too!

Summary Heading: Very attractive recent update to rooms and lobby.
Summary: Nice new flat panel TVs but Cable service is 2nd Rate at best.  WiFi is kind of weak, difficult to connect.  Ample outlets near bed and workspace.   Shower upgrade is pretty but single moving glass door means you have to be IN the shower before turning it on. You're going to get wet with cold water before getting in. Shower shelf too small to be useful. Toilet is quiet and slam-proof.    Breakfast buffet (included with stay) is better than most "free" breakfasts with good coffee, lots of juices and a pretty okay omelet bar.   Beds are pretty decent.   Exercise room is kind of small to suit the free weights, pully weights, and 5 cardio devices.   I've stayed here often over the last ten years. It continues to improve.

Hotel staff were very helpful. Cypress has many thing to offer for visitors. I went to music on the green, the open market at Cypress College and Seacoast Grace Church. All were within walking distance from the Hyatt.

This was my first time staying at a Hyatt House and I will definitely at this hotel again.  The beds were extremely comfortable and the rooms overall were spacious.  I really enjoyed the fire pit and the heat lamps for a family gathering.  If you are in the area, this is the hotel to stay at!

Having a suite with bedroom, kitchen, and living room was great.  My husband could watch tv in the living room while I closed the bedroom door and slept.  On our last night, we were able to heat up and eat all our leftovers from earlier dinners.  Our room was quiet and comfortable.  The condition of the hotel and room seemed fairly new and well maintained.  Also great having the laundry facilities available as we did a small load to tide us over.  Free parking and breakfast made it very economical.  This is a great place to stay!

We booked hyatt house for 1 night. Stayed in the 1 bedroom (2queens) with one sofa bed.  This room includes a kitchen. Set up for the room is as follows: kitchen with sectional, turns into bed) there are two double doors which can be closed (this is where the beds and bathroom are) Crib for baby is a playpen. It was ready in our room when we arrived.  Breakfast is good they have somebody making you omelets. They also had miso soup, cereal, scrambled egg, toast, sausage along with juice and coffee.  They do allow dogs but you wouldn't know it unless you see them. Highly recommended

Summary Heading: Nicer (larger) than home; free breakfast bonus perk
Summary: Décor and everything impressive for reasonable price (chose for Costco discount and location). After arriving hotel, got into GPS hell where "location I'm at" became middle of LA on Hwy 710. Hotel WiFi invaluable to figure out how to get to where I wanted to go. However, it took 3 times longer so didn't have time to enjoy pool and fabulous sunny SoCal weather.

The hotel is good, clean and close to many restaurants.  I would recommended it.  The only problem we had was with the hotel breakfast.  If there are alot of people, they will run out of food and not replenish it.

I am staying here on an extended basis and had checked out the Residence Inn and Extended stay as well and so glad I decided on the Hyatt.  While this is  Hyatt House, the service is as good as a full service.  The breakfast is nice with an omelet station. The happy hour is a real value for food and drinks.  The rooms are large and comfortable.  The setting is nice and quiet.  The staff are super friendly.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone.  Management has this place in top shape.

This hotel is conveniently located near Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm.  Although i was visiting universal studios and couldn't find a close location there.  The drive from hotel to universal studios was about 40mins.  The room was very clean, hotel staff is very friendly and courteous.  Hotel serves good hot breakfast which includes eggs, sausages, toast, bagels, freshly prepared omelette as per your choice of ingredients.  We had half a day to spare and drove to disneyland park - which was just 10mins from the hotel.  Overall, i had a pleasant stay at the hotel, bed was very comfortable, comfy pillows as well.

Nice & clean. Comfortable stay. The bedroom was separated from the kitchen/living area, which was a pleasant surprise. Even though it's in a quiet area, a 20 minute drive will get you to Little Saigon, the beach, shopping areas, etc. This is my 3rd time staying at a Hyatt, and it's always a pleasant stay.

I will coming back for sure, i was here for buisness during 6 month , after that i decided to come back a the same place due to the situation and the people are workin in , very proffessionnal team and very friendly , Housekeeping is always very good , hotel himsef with swimming pool is top

I have stayed at this hotel on multiple occasions over the years.  I have always had a pleasant stay.  It is newly remodeled.   The breakfast has an omelet bar.  The staff is very helpful.  Free Breakfast, free parking,  free Internet.  This hotel is a great value for your money.  The rooms are huge.

I was really impressed with this Hyatt House. I hadn't stayed at one before. Just saw the reviews online and after not finding anything in Long Beach that I liked, booked here. Quick 20 min drive to Long Beach for my meetings.  The room was VERY spacious with a kitchen and the sitting area with a giant L shaped couch. Double doors into the bedroom and then the bathroom with a glass shower.  I was on the lower level and really enjoyed the sliding door out to the patio facing the courtyard and 2 seats out there to relax on.  Sunday morning I went for the free breakfast and was pleasantly surprised to see a lady running a made to order omelet station! It was delicious! Seating inside and outside for breakfast.  Overall the hotel was clean, spacious and modern.  A deal for what they

Summary Heading: Not a Hotel, a Home away from Home
Summary: This is not your ordinary Hotel, it is of better class and the rooms are mostly Apartments with a separate bedroom. This helps me decompress after long days of meeting and work.I highly recommend and surprised at the great price. Try it and you will be hooked, I stay 15 miles away from my office just relax here and pass 10 hotels to get here. I have stayed at all 10 and this is by far the best.

Summary Heading: Lots of room for a family of 4
Summary: Our family of four had a roomy K suite with pull out sofa.  We enjoyed a full kitchen and two TV's.  The free breakfast needs improvement. There were two lines - one for buffet items and one for the made to order omelets - because the small breakfast area was crowded the two lines converged and people were crowding people that had altready been in line a long time.  I waited 20 minutes before opting out of breakfast all together.  The hotel was clean and well maintained.  We will likely stayagain but will plan on breakfast elsewhere.

Clean, friendly, comfortable.  Great for business traveller and family.  Staff works hard to keep the breakfast replenished, especially on weekends when the family's visiting Disney and the youth sports leagues show up and overwhelm the dining room.  Great team there.

If you want more than you expect, when staying at a hotel, stay with Hyatt.  You'll experience, just like we did, a friendly staff, good food and quiet hallways.  Call a Hyatt Hotel today and say "I want to stay with a proven winner."  You won't be disappointed if you do!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, spacious rooms, good soup
Summary: I lost the photos of the rooms. But they are spacious . With hall kitchen and a separate bedroom. A cute balcony. The kitchen is well equipped and the service reflects the brand Hyatt. The staff are super friendly always willing to extend a helping hand, even for minor things like a good barber shop around etc. Swimming pool and facilities are good. Kitchen is small but I found their chicken soup delicious.

Summary Heading: Feels like home,cozy, comfortable and warm
Summary: I don't think that I could add anything less than,  it is always a pleasure to stay with you.. feels like home. It is important to us to feel comfortable in our stays at the Hyatt.  We are not so young anymore and it is important that we are able to have a good nights rest.  Your bedding and pillows are great..We cuddle right in, just like home

Everyone is very nice,  this hotel is in great conditions. Complementary breakfast  is average, and a  super busy kitchen during breakfast. I have to say that I'm very thankful for having so many people working in the kitchen area.  Great Job!!

I would like to start off by saying that we really enjoyed this hotel. We stayed for five nights in April 2016. We are a family of six; three adults, and three children.   We arrived for checkin at about 2am. Checkin was fast but we had a minor problem. My boyfriends debt card couldn't go through. I tried mine and it worked. I guess you have to use the same card you made the reservation with. Their was also a problem with my sister's reservation, they couldn't find it. My sister booked online through the Hyatt website and even printed out her confirmation to show she had a reservation.They were told at first that the hotel was fully booked but the gentlemen at front desk saved our vacation and found a room across from us which was what we requested to begin with.  The room was

Very good hotel for extended stays.  Rooms are equipped with the necessities.  Lots of kids as it is close to amusement park.  Rooms are a little noisy, but nothing to dramatic.  Would stay again as it is close to the warehouse we use.

Summary Heading: Great room... could be an apartment!
Summary: Very comfortable room over all.  NO complaints!  Check in was easy.  Laundry and Ice on each floor.  The breakfast was good.  All of the food was fresh and hot.  Hallways are nice and wide.  I never heard any neighboring noises. I could comfortably stay here for an extended period of time and be very comfortable.

Save your money! go elsewhere.  If you are traveling for business and just a bed and breakfast will do, then fine.  Otherwise this is not worth it, as it is after all just a bed and breakfast! Staff is nice, but overall will not recommend.

It was a quick stay at the Hyatt House but after a couple of days of intense driving, and putting up with rainstorms east of San Diego and general Southern California traffic this was a terrific choice.  Quiet, extra clean, all the amenities one would want in a general suite property.  We truly appreciate the separate sleeping room as the wife retires for the night a bit earlier than I do.  The pool and spa looked inviting and many were enjoying socialization around the fire pit. Nice getaway for a business meeting (or leisure).  Breakfast a treat with eggs to order.  Friendly staff at this Hyatt - and did we mention clean?  Gold star Hyatt House!

The hotel is very family friendly, with a bedroom and separate living room/kitchen. Very clean and cozy. There is a pool in the yard with a Jacuzzi and fire pit on the side. After long day of travel it's a good place to relax down.  Breakfast is included with many choices. There are a few elevators around the building, occasionally confusing but overall convenient if your room is far from front center. In general it's a great place to stay for family.

I was only here during the night hours as my business got me out very early and back late.  I needed and easy/quite place to stay and Hyatt House was both. It seemed very clean compared to other places I have been recently. I never saw the pool or exercise room. I did not have a suite and my room was compact.  Breakfast was not completely ready when I had to leave, but they did put out some items early so  had something to grab and go. I did use the microwave and fridge in my room. Disappointed the fridge had no freezer. Even a tiny one. The folks at the desk did offer to put my blue ice in their freezer, but I couldn't chance a delay in the morning. They did have a nice option to not have the room serviced, which I used as I didn't need a clean up between the first and second

This was a nice place to stay, clean and comfortable.  The breafast offered was not of quality as compared to other places I have stayed.  I was also looking forwared to a "Full Kitchen" as advertised, all we had was a ver small microwave and two hot plate cooktop to prepare meals.  This did not work out well for my family and out needs and hoped for a cooking range.

Thank you for a delightful stay.  Close to Disney Land, Seal Beach and Golden Coral.  Staff was hospitable and room was clean.  Nice swimming pool and quiet area. Enough already I don't need a pile of words to say something.

A fine hotel in a quiet suburb of Los Angeles. The hotel staff is courteous and honest: I forgot my computer charger in my room when I checked out and housekeeping returned it to me as I was leaving the hotel, saving me time and frustration. The hotel is close to major highways.  A car is a necessity to get around. A definite re-stay when I am back in town.

This is a nice, clean comfortable hotel.  The breakfast included with the room rate was well done.  The staff were helpful and friendly.  The shuttle service was free and very convenient.  I would recommend this hotel.

This hotel was awesome.  Off the beaten path but very comfortable, clean, quiet and excellent staff. It is a resort style hotel with a great indoor courtyard with pool and bar. The room and lobby were of European style.

Front desk staff was polite, but housekeeping was just a disaster. Basically, the room was not kept up, water in the ice bucket was left for days, there was trash on the floor and apparently nobody cared about providing clean glasses.

I chose this property for our family visit to Disney/LA.  Location was convenient, just a 25 min drive to the park. Breakfast was better than average- great made to order omelettes!  Nice variety.  Only peeve was that breakfast didn't open until 7 on the weekend so we missed the opening of the park. Rooms are modern and big with a full kitchen.  We had a king suite which would have been better if the sofa bed would have not been stripped every night!  Ugh .  Shower enclosure is clear glass and the toilet is in the same room.  Pretty but not very practical. Pets are allowed, which I'm not thrilled with, though I never saw any animals. Overall it was a good stay.  With a little tweaking I think it could be better.

Our hotel stay was wonderful! Hotel was very clean from the entrance to the room we stayed in.  Friendly hotel staff, clean, comfortable room, food was excellent. Nothing but nice things to say about this hotel.

We've stayed at the Cypress location on several occasions and find it to suit our needs and we believe it to be the best value fpr what we get there.   It recently went though a renovation and the room are up to date, comfortable and relatively quiet.   The beds and pillow are very good and we enjoy the daily breakfast.   It has  a well equipped fitness room which we were glad to have available for short workouts.   Very nice place.

The Hyatt House is a great alternative to the overpriced hotels near Disneyland. A short car trip (about 10 min) and you are there. The rooms are spacious, we stayed in the King bed suite, complete with a bedroom, dinning area, kitchen, fridge, microwave, pull out sofa, 2 TVs. The room has everything you need (silverware, dinnerware, utensils, glassware, etc) Also you get Free Parking, Free wi-fi and Free Breakfast.   Nice swimming pool and common areas. Avoid the first floor rooms, specially those at the corners close to the hallway doors. The noise of the cars, people, suitcases and doors will keep you up. Other than that, the Hyatt House is a great place to stay, great location, great price and full of amenities.

My husband & I visit this Hyatt every year for the past 5 years with our 3 kids, who are now 15, 13, & 11.  The rooms are beautifully decorated & clean.  It provides the perfect amount of space & the kids really enjoy it.  Its close to alot of major attractions.  The value is amazing as planning vacation for our party of 5 can be costly.  Breakfast is included all time we have went.  This will always be our home away from home!

Excellent King Room Suite-did not expect a kitchenette. Bed was very comfortable, tv's plentiful, towels plentiful. Recommend the breakfast buffet-plenty of fresh, variety and the omlets on order is excellent!

Rooms were comfortable, clean and well lit. The hotel generally was well-located for my business needs. The rooms, lobby, breakfast area and the general facility appeared to be very clean. Enjoyable stay with smiling faces.

Affordable rates, Spacious room, comfortable bed, fast wifi, free hot breakfast, free parking, balcony, nice shower, close to disneyland and knotts. Coudn't ask for more for the price I paid! Excellent for families (apartment style suites).

Love this small Hotel, the Staff is great and most of them have been there for a long time, they remember you and treat you like Family, have stayed there several times and prefer that hotel when in the area.

Accommodations were awesome!  I stayed in a one bedroom suite with a well-equipped kitchen.  My room had a king-sized bed, a sleeper sofa, a flat-screen television in the living room area and in the bedroom.  The space in this room may be compared to the size of a large one bedroom apartment in Southern California.  The hotel property was clean in all areas.  My favorite part of the stay was the FREE daily breakfast buffet!  The offerings included an omelette bar, potatoes, sausage, eggs, cold and hot cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt, miso soup, steamed rice, toast, bagels, premium coffee and tea.  Need I say more??!!  There was a combination of patrons:  business travelers and families.  I stayed three days and two nights and would definitely return to this location and patronize

The room was very small room.  And it was supposed to have a balcony, which it had sliding doors but the balcony was so small and it didn't have any chairs so it was totally useless.  The pool area had no sun at all, at any time during the day! and the pool are had no lounge chairs.  Also, for a smoking hotel, there were definitely people who were smoking on the balconies and first floor, so the smell of cigarettes was totally frustrating!  convenient location, and staff was friendly.

This hotel was updated, clean, and had more amenities than any non-extended stay hotels in this price range.   All rooms had a balcony, a very decent breakfast was included (including an omelet station)  there's a bar for happy hour, kitchenette with a full size fridge, free parking, and we had a 2 room suite for the price (or less) than nearby studio rooms that also charge for parking.   This hotel is a business travelers dream. 5 stars because it exceeded my expectations for the price.   It worked great for family travel but we saw mostly business people. If we come back for the parks (Disneyland or Knotts) this will be my first stop.

Summary Heading: Good room, good staff, good stay
Summary: The room was clean and well appointed. They staff was very helpful. A very nice stay. This is a quality hotel that is well worth staying. It was not perfectly located for my business but I was glad to have chosen it.

Beautiful hotel. Nicest suite I have stayed in in recent years.  Large 2 room suite with complete kitchen facilities. l-shaped couth, 2 large tvs, sitting area with desk, new bathroom area with walk-in shower

Very good location to stay for business near convention center. Good breakfast and friendly stuff. Plenty of parking spaces. Would recommend for business trips to Anaheim location and local destinations.

Summary Heading: Needed a place for the family to stay close to Long Beach
Summary: We needed a comfortable space for the family to stay overnight to catch an early flight out of Long Beach the next day.  This hotel met all our needs - a suite with a full kitchen, big bathroom, comfortable beds, full breakfast, and low rates.  Everything felt fresh and new, and we're really happy with our stay.    Might even consider as a base for attacking Disneyland!

Really nice room, hotel, lobby, food...this place rocks.  This place has nothing but nice rooms.  The staff is very nice, and the location is in the middle of some food spots.  Love it.  Eat at the Loft, grab coffee from Lee's...or make a copy at FedEx Kinkos...it doesn't matter they're all right there!

Wow! Stayed in a king suite. Plenty of room and a full kitchen. Bed was one of the most comfy I've ever slept in at a hotel. They even had a couple complimentary gas bbq grills in the courtyard which I happily used. Free breakfast was nice, except for the turkey sausage patties, which might not pass for dog food. They do make fresh omelettes upon request and even have white rice (which is a first for me).  Lots of free parking and free WiFi.

Summary Heading: Serene place with great stay experience
Summary: This was my first time trying Hyatt House, and the overall experience was great. This hotel is very well located in Cypress, about 50 minutes drive to Beverly Hills, just 10 minutes to Disneyland resort. Front office hosts were very caring during my whole stay, we were able to pick up daily newspaper at the desk. The complimentary breakfast was also very nice, selections were ample and quality was good. My King suite has a full function kitchenette, and the large size corner sofa was comfortable enough to watch the HD news on presidential campaign.

Service, Staff, and Stay is awesome.  We stay here to go to Disneyland and the location is great! Rooms are so clean and spacious. The staff here is excellent.  They really go out of their way to make you feel at home.

Very clean comfortable facility to stay at. I appreciated that by the pool was a gas bar b q grill if you cared to use it. Rooms included with a size refrigerator. cook top, cooking & eating utensils etc. Very family friendly and comfortable.

My husband and I are staying here for 4 nights. The price was great. We chose the pay in advance option for the guest house. It was perfect for the two of us. The room was clean upon arrival. Being a clean freak, I noticed minor details. It seems like housekeeping will cut corners where they can. I noticed some watermarks on the shower door and on the sink countertop, kinda nasty imo. Other than that it's a good location, dining walking distance and 15 min drive to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: The room facing courtyard is really nice
Summary: We got two rooms on the third floor, they were both very nice and clean: the one facing the courtyard/pool area had a balcony, the 2nd room facing the back parking lot had more space in the living room (I might be picky, but I felt the 2nd room was a little empty, needed more furniture and  desk space).   The breakfast was pretty good, the parking space in the front of the hotel was tight. The hotel is very close to Knots Berry Farm and 8 miles to Disneyland, many cars parked there were van and bigger cars, which made the parking space even narrower. The hotel is surrounded by many company/business buildings, so I guess parking in the back parking lot should be safe.

This is a great location, great hotel with amazing service. The accommodations are great. Features of the hotel also great. Would stay here again in a heartbeat! If you are anywhere near, I would highly recommend this hotel. The aesthetics are very pleasing and the extras such as happy hour and food were great.

Recently refurbished, these suites are great quality and very comfortable. After 3+ weeks of road trip stays with teenagers (x3), this was by far the most comfortable and spacious. Nice stone topped kitchen.  Lots of places to eat within walking distance, and the area appears safe and secure.  Supermarkets are just a minute's drive.

This hotel is beautiful and the staff is amazing. After a full day of travel from the East Coast, the check in was seamless, the room inviting and the fire pit in the courtyard was irresistible. I wish I could've stayed longer and I really hope I travel back to the area sometime soon just to stay here!!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, not close to anything
Summary: I just completed a two night stay at this hotel and while the hotel was more than adequate, I did have a few issues.  Upon checking in, I was greeted warmly and it was a pleasant experience.  I was acknowledged as a Gold Passport member and picked the points option.  I was told I had been upgraded to a one-bedroom suite.  The room was plenty big for a single person, but I didn’t care for most of the lights being on motion switches and it was kind of challenging to get the room bright enough without turning on every single light in the room.  The wi-fi seemed to work consistently and had plenty of bandwidth.  The amenities were more than suitable.  The water pressure in the shower was very weak – made it very difficult to wash/rinse my short hair.  The breakfast area doubled as a

Thank you so much to Hyatt house.  Everyone was so nice and friendly.  We had 6 rooms and the staff worked hard to make sure that we were all by each other.  The rooms were beautiful and the breakfasts were amazing.  Our children and grandchildren loved the pool and hot tub.  We Loved our stay!

Summary Heading: I truly enjoyed my stay at your hotel
Summary: In every factor your staff met or exceeded my expectations.  The room was beautiful, spacious, comfortable with every possible amenity that I was in need of during my business conference stay.  I mentioned the ants earlier only because I failed to do so during my stay.  Truly, there were less than 12 ants so I see any nuisance as insignificant.  It was sort of fun just watching them in our room on the second floor, sort of reminding me of my home.  Yes, similar challenge ... perhaps another reason my stay reminded me of home.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel to Stay near Disneyland park
Summary: Nice hotel, clean and quiet, but need to improve the guest market that has very limited items and breakfast area that does not support the volume of guests at same time. The internet service is poor (it takes much time to login and need to try several times), but in general it is a nice hotel to stay. The front desk service was fast and efficient.

Good hotel to stay at with your family. Good full breakfast. Great selection. But poorly executed and set up. Great staff. Great Hotel Love the size of the rooms . Only complaint I could hear EVERYTHING going on upstairs in the room above.

Stayed for a business trip over the weekend and was pleasently surprised how nice this place was. It's in a mix of business HQ's and strip malls - so you have almost anything you need close by. The facility and room were nice, well kept and worked out very nicely for us

Good hotel, 8 miles from Disney, 15 minutes from HB. Much better breakfast buffet than expected. Rooms decent size and the kitchen was helpful. We stayed 8 days including New Years Eve which was the only noisy night.

We stayed over a week at this hotel and we had fun and rested a lot! I love the area is so quiet, plenty of stores and restaurants close by (driving) and 4 out of 8 mornings we took advantage of free breakfast downstairs. The staff thinks about their demographic and truly make an effort to accommodate all their guests. Shout out to the lady making omelets in the morning! They were delicious! I will definitely come back! The location is great! About 10 minutes away from Downtown Disney and Disney parks and 40-45 from Universal Studios. Free parking and no hidden fees. Loved it!!

I loved the value and the staff and room. The breakfast was hot fresh and very enjoyable.  The room was large clean and the shower was hot clean and very much the best part of waking up. The manager was even in the kitchen making sure the home made omelets were pushed out fast for the guest.

Great atmosphere, breakfast was amazing, rooms and hotel were well designed and appealing to the eyes. Overall a perfect experience during my stay. We stayed here due to its vicinity to Disneyland. It was a very convenient stay due to free breakfast, free parking, and its location.

Summary Heading: Really enjoyed out 1st Stay at Hyatt House
Summary: My son and I stayed at the Hyatt House for 1 night while playing in a baseball tournament.  The room was very spacious and very comfortable.  Our room had two beds which were extremely comfortable.  There were two flat screen TV's (one in the family room & one in the bedroom).  There was a kitchen and spacious counter (bar) to eat and talk.  The morning breakfast was the best complimentary breakfast I have had at any other comparable hotel.  We will definitely come back!

this is a great hotel, convenient location, close to everything, only minutes from Disneyland, the staff is very friendly and courteous, clean spacious rooms, the breakfast is great and has a lot of choices,

Comfortable and spacious rooms with nice decor. Highly recommend as a business option since it is centrally located with  many food options around. Surprisingly quiet at night :-) Only suggestion would be to keep the complimentary breakfast food replenished until closing at 9:30 as it seemed pretty slim pickings around 9:20

My family had a great time.  I can tell the room was recently renovated so it was very clean.  The room felt warm and inviting but at the same time, modern.  Only thing about the room was that we were not able to utilize the patio because there no privacy.  I think if there were a fence or landscaping there, it would've provide some privacy. The employee were very nice and helpful.  The breakfast was great.  There were a good varieties of food. They had really good coffee.  I would stay here again.

very good loved everything.  room was nice and clean.  nicely decorated.  breakfast was good quality, tasty, filling.  staff was nice and helpful.  there are various restaurants nearby (wendy's, carls jr and chili's walking distance).  near the freeway.

Summary Heading: unusually nice stay at a hotel
Summary: My wife and I enjoyed our stay very much at The Hyatt.   Cleanliness,  courtesy, qualify, the service was excellent. The location is right in the center of Orange County and its many world known attractions.

The staff were all polite, and knowledge. Each person always had a smile. The hotel was always clean. Housekeeping did great work each day. And to mention, the breakfast bar was wonderful! I would recommend this establishment to all. My family appreciated the kitchen in our room.

We stayed here while visiting Disneyland. The drive wasn't too bad and they offer free parking  The room was spacious and clean and the Continental breakfast had something for everyone. Would definitely stay here again.

I would give it five stars but the bed was uncomfortable. It was to soft and took for ever for me to fall a sleep. Every thing else was good. Food was good. Tv was ruined my eardrums on one channel and i had to put the tv on full blast to hear it. I would give this a 9 out of 10 because of sleep quality.

I loved my stay and it couldn't have been more perfect but when I arrived, I asked the gentleman at the desk if my card was going to be charged ahead of time and was told no.  Well it was at $507.00.  Needless to say, I had no money for dinners and other things.  I just wish they would have been honest from the start.

It was a good place to stay. It was a drive away from Disneyland but over all it was good. I wish there were more food choices for breakfast, we expected a little more.  The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable.

Excellent hotel with good service, convenient location, and newly renovated rooms with full kitchen.  Only complain is TV is not digital.  It's right next to Chilis if you like eating at Chilis.  Used to be called Hyatt Summerfield Suites and now called Hyatt House.

We recently stayed in the 1 bedroom suite for 2 weeks on a business trip. Newly renovated, spacious, quiet, friendly, very clean, it was an ideal hotel for our stay. The greakfast omelettes were excellent, as well as the Seattles best coffee each morning. Only a small fitness room, which easily got crowded.

A quick overnight in Cypress for business and then headed north for a wedding weekend.  The Hyatt House was very comfortable,  clean, nicely appointed and most importantly the staff was very kind, helpful and welcoming. Our room was spacious and the main floor and lobby had many areas to sit and relax. There is also a beautiful outdoor area with firepit and pool.  The area around the hotel was very nice.  The breakfast was quite good and there is a bar in the hotel with an available  menu.  There are restaurants close by and accessible shopping in the many strip plazas around the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that was considering it.

I was overall very happy with my stay at the hotel and all the staff was very friendly, welcoming and supportive. The staff really made my holiday wonderful.I have always found the people that works there to be polite and have never had any problems with the service.

For the price and the amenities, I don't think this can be beat. Breakfast was pretty good and convenient. There was plenty of food and beverages. Room was clean and big. I would definitely stay here again! My trip was for a couple of nights to spend the day at Disney. It isn't the closest location to Disney, but it is close enough for the price and the cleanliness. The staff is also great and very accommodating.

Loved this hotel!  Clean, inviting, accommodating! Great for children and families.  Bed is sooo comfortable!m Pool is small but great to cool down.  Fire pit outside is a great way to unwind from a long day and gather together as a family.  WE REALLY ENJOYED OUR STAY!

Great Experience, Affordable for the area. Great amenities. The room was nice and plush. We enjoyed having the kitchenette. The court yard and hot tub were enjoyable. The room had plenty of space and the shower was wonderful.

The first weeks were amazing, the hot warm weather in the pool was excellent, rooms are very spacious and clean but After that 3 weeks staying they started remodeling the whole hotel, so their was limited parking spaces, too much noise of machines drilling in the courtyard...  besides that excellent hospitality.

Visited the L.A. Area and stayed at this hotel half of the time. Amazing rooms. They are huge with a full kitchen and a bedroom separated from it all. Great breakfast and also free parking which not all accommodations in the area have, and in a very reasonable price! It's 45 minutes drive from L.A. But we soon learned that anything in L.A. Is 45 minutes drive from any other thing so it was as good as staying in L.A. Besides it's really close to Disneyland!! The staff was very friendly too. One thing I didn't like - they advertise free shuttles but it's actually free rides only at a 5 mile ratios (which includes basically walmart and mcdonalds) and the nearest tourist attraction - Disneyland - is conveniently 7 miles away.

We were only at this hotel for a night, but we were both impressed.   First, the people were friendly and helpful. We called directly to reserve the room, because we needed to ensure that they had pet-friendly rooms available. The reservation agent was friendly and able to process our request quickly over the phone.  When we arrived for check in - hot, sweaty, in desperate need of a clean room and sweet A/C - we were told that our room wasn't yet ready. They said we'd only have to wait a few minutes. She then told us that they had upgraded us to a suite, which was a nice bonus.   We hunkered down in the lobby, relishing the beautiful A/C and some comfy chairs, prepared for a long wait. But, not ten minutes later, we were approached to let us know that our room was ready.   We

Summary Heading: Value, Convenient, Spacious and Warm Welcome
Summary: Requiring a spacious, clean and quiet hotel not far from the Honda Center, the Hyatt exceeded my expectations.  Traveling with two teens and a 21-year old, I found the double queen room spacious enough for all four of us.  The suite provided a separate bedroom with two queens, a sleeper sofa, and FULL kitchen, including electric stove, oven, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, full fridge, and dishwasher.  Fully equipped with dishes, utensils, cookware and dish soap the kitchen provides all the comforts of home.  I was impressed with the details including water pitcher in the fridge, dish towels, knives, etc. enough for all.  It is perfect for the business traveler or family needing the conveniences of a longer term stay.  Recently renovated, everything seemed new:  carpets,

We stayed here for two nights while in Orange County for a wedding.  It is obvious that the hotel had a recent renovation.  Our room had a king size bed and work space.  The only drawback to the room was the positioning of the bathroom door.  It had to be closed at all times our you could not move from the sleeping area to the bathroom or exit door.  A minor issue.  Our rate included a breakfast.  There were plenty of choices.  The only holdup seemed to be the omelet station.  It moved pretty slow, and sometimes the line interfered with you getting the buffet items.  Other than that the food was very good, but the coffee was only so-so.  At night time, the breakfast area was transformed into the bar area.  The prices were fair, but it closed too early on a Friday night.  The bar

It's been a couple of years since I have been to this facility and I was amazed with the renovations. What a beautiful and functional place! Service was great and drinks at the fire pit in the courtyard was also a nice touch. My only concern was the internet access. It was slow and then went down for a little while.

Very spacious and beautiful rooms.  Very clean and comfortable . Friendly accommodating staff.  Great complimentary breakfast and prompt shuttle service. Good bar for evening cocktails.  Beautiful pool and grounds. Convenient parking.

Summary Heading: A reasonable hotel for business trip
Summary: This was my second time to come to this hotel for business meetings.  It is at a quiet location.  The hotel people are friendly.  The facility is simple yet just sufficient for sleep in a business trip.  The breakfast is not fancy at all, but just enough for a good start.  My only complaints are the internet is very slow and the air conditioning is quite noisy.  Overall, if one has a limited budget and still wants to have something in good condition, here you are.

The Hyatt House in Cypress is a nice inexpensive hotel with everything you need. The staff is very friendly and helpful. A great place to stay. Our only disappointment was the distance to the Anaheim Convention Center.

Overall: We were pretty happy and comfy in this hotel. It does get busy with business travellers and families going to Disneyland.   Rooms: We had a king suite, which surprisingly is like a mini apartment! It was very comfortable and nicely decorated. The room was cleaned very well each day.  Breakfast: Breakfast is included, but because it's a business hotel runs only until 9:30AM on the weekdays. It gets pretty crazy after 8AM due to the small dining area. They were running out of food by the end of one of the breakfasts.  There is an outdoor patio area with umbrellas and is pleasant to eat at. They had bananas and apples, oatmeal & raisins, pre-cooked eggs, hashbrowns, sausage, & pancakes. The only item that was made fresh were omelettes but they use a mix. They don't have

Summary Heading: My 30-night stay at Hyatt House in Cypress
Summary: Overall, a great hotel with good value. The breakfast did get old quickly. Wish they had provided espresso. In-room wireless internet was virtually zero in my room.  The hotel staff was unable to resolve that issue.

Summary Heading: Fine for Disneyland, Angels Stadium, and Beach.... if you have a car
Summary: I've stayed at many Hyatt's this was my first at the Hyatt House brand.  Very similar to Hyatt Place with the exception of having the extended stay type mini kitchen and the suites.    Location: Yes the hotel is six miles from Disneyland, but this is six miles on surface streets only with many lights, stop signs and traffic.  A better range for Southern California is not miles but time to a location, as traffic rules all.  This hotel is a solid 25-30 minutes to Disneyland, 30-35 minutes to Angel Stadium, and about an hour to the beach.  These are normal traffic times, so rush hour add 10 minutes easy.  Keep in mind also that the hotel is about 10-15 minutes off a major frwy as well, so your not. "close to the action", but if you have your own car, and keep the time frames above

We did a two night stay and went, of course, to Disneyland. It's well located, although the lack of a Disney shuttle is a downer. The room was nice, clean, modern. The pool is warm and clean. The outdoor courtyard is pleasant. The breakfast is very good, basic American hotel buffet. Hot foods, and eggs to order move it up a notch, but skip the scrambled eggs which taste exceptionally nasty for some reason. We put 2 adults and two kids in the one bedroom suite very comfortably, although having the bathroom off the master BR isn't great for private time.

Summary Heading: Nice Family Hotel with One Flaw
Summary: So we went down to Disneyland with a family of four and stayed here (6 miles from Disneyland).   Parking was free and a hot breakfast was included.  The suite was three rooms and main bedroom was separated by double doors from the living room.  The kitchen had everything you need for a family.  The sofabed was large enough only for two young kids (ours are 5 and 3).   It was clean and up to par.  We were happy with the facility except for two things:  1. We were given Room 103 which is attached to the breakfast room so it got noisy from 7 am onwards real quick.   I dont know why they would do that to a family with two young kids...or anyone for that matter.    2. Two, the free shuttle was only offered within a 5 mile radius of the hotel so a shuttle to Disneyland was refused

I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of this hotel.  Double shades, one for blackout and the other for light filtering, was appreciated as my room was on the ground floor.  Excellent breakfast with omelets to order as well as a nice assortment of other dishes.  Free and fast wi-fi, with plenty of room on the kitchenette bar for a laptop and papers.

Very nice (recently remodeled) suite with kitchenette and 2 flat screen TVs, one in each room. Particularly nice: - WiFi is included, as is breakfast and parking - this is one of the few hotels that understands how nice it can be to really make the room dark for sleeping: there are two separate window blinds on each window, a light one and a dark one - a gym with some cardio machines, weights, and an exercise tower, - pool and jacuzzi, which are in the shade during some parts of the day

I attended the Hyatt House to visit with my cousin. She has a horse running at Los Alamitos Race track. We took advantage of the bar in the evening and had a wonderful time sharing old stories and watching football on the television provided in the bar. The bar tender was very knowledgeable about different drinks and actually made us a couple of exotic ones. He also joined in with us in watching the football games.

Stayed for a month and this is a nice property.  Believe it was renovated last year and it shows.  The breakfast is good aside from the breakfast meats. The bed is extremely comfortable and the maid service is great even wash your dishes.  I will come back again.

Summary Heading: Top Rate Hotel - Worth the Stay
Summary: Needed to stay overnight in Orange County and choose the Hyatt House Cypress / Anaheim and glad I did.  The lobby was very inviting, the desk representative was wonderful and helpful, and the modern stylish room was perfect.  The room was spacious with a kitchenette, a very comfortable bed, free high speed Internet, and two HD televisions. Free full breakfast with made to order omelettes and a built your own sushi bar.  I will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel and suggest for family visits to Disneyland CA
Summary: I stayed here 4 days to visit Disneyland. It is only 20 minutes drive from Disney. Hotel was clean, room service was good. I took single bedroom suite with full kitchen, and it is bigger than expected with all kitchenette amenities, hotel staff was good....what else to expect for 120 $ per day...i would prefer to come here again.

New appliances, in full kitchen within your hotel room. Countertop space with 2 bar stools for eating. Pull out couch sleeps 2 and newly renovated bathrooms make this hotel a steal compared to what other hotels in the area charge. Free breakfast with cook to order omelettes, cereal, milk, juice, eggs, potatoes, toast, bagels and cream cheese, muffins, miso soup and rice (for Japanese clientele). Outdoor pool was heated to a comfortable temp and hot tub right next to the pool. staff was friendly!

I stayed this hotel for two days. This hotel gave me a type of room which have kitchen, dish washer and island table.  If I visit this hotel with my family, it will be pleased better than business trip because it looks like my home.  Also, this has outdoor pool which would be joyful with my kids.

we have stayed in a lot of hotels and this is by far one of the best.  our king suite room was huge, clean and comfortable. property is in an area that you can get to any hotel within 5 minutes.  great staff too.

Summary Heading: A Solid and Affordable Place to Stay the Night
Summary: We stayed two nights in a king bedded suite, complete with a kitchenette. The suite featured double doors that separated the bedroom from the living room (complete with a double-sized pull-out sofa).  The hotel was recently renovated and features a pool and gym. I especially thought the extra bathroom on each guest floor was helpful. There’s a small marketplace next to the front desk to pick up some essentials (not a wide variety though). Check-in and checkout was handled swiftly and everything was correct on my bill.   The plusses:  -Internet: complimentary (who doesn’t love free internet?) -Parking: complimentary (the hotel was full and when we came back from Disneyland at around midnight, we were lucky there was ONE spot left near the dumpster).  -Hot Breakfast: complimentary

Hyatt House is the place to be. It's facelift is now modern and makes you feel welcome when you enter the room. It's cozy from the main entrance to the courtyard area. It's located centrally to a lot of family and couples attractions. Yes..i'm a fan!

I've been staying at this hotel since it was the Woodfin. Hyatt's gradual updates and recent major facelift are great. Liked the whimsical, eclectic art.  Kitchen, bath, bedroom, and work area ... big plus.  WiFi is weak and cable is 2nd rate but that's about the only negative.

Summary Heading: Great Choice for Business or Leisure
Summary: Have stayed here multiple times. Everyone is very nice and does a great job. Love the convenience of the kitchens, the breakfast buffet is one of the nicest I've seen. Will be staying here again soon.

Summary Heading: Remodeled and look good.  Above average breakfast.
Summary: Remodeled and look good.  Above average breakfast.  Ralph Food store is only 6/10 mile away, if you want to shop and cook. I did. I was upgraded because I am a Diamond member.  The property has been recently renovated. The front desk staff was helpful and courteous. There is a great breakfast selection including omelettes and other hot items.  A lot of the rooms have balconies so request a room with a pool/courtyard view it's better than the outside which faces the parking lot.  There are many other food options nearby.  i decided to cook.

Great place to stay staff very friendly and accommodating.  Rooms were great and quiet.  Breakfast awesome especially the omelets and then to have seating outdoor by the pool totally awesome.  Hotel is located where there is no traffic noise and still close to freeways

Great location, safe area and convenient to LA and Orange county. Staff were very courteous and followed up on on my requests for balcony chairs. The central courtyard was a great place to enjoy our breakfast. The caliber of guests was very good and the children staying were well behaved.

Hotel allowed 'non-paying' guests to swim in pool w/clothes on and obnoxious behavior and did nothing about it, despite several complaints.  This ruined what was actually started out as a nice trip.  The fact that the staff did not enforce the policies made us feel like they could have cared less about our satisfaction!

This hotel does not have HD on their TV's.  I have not experienced this in years!!  It is not only in the rooms, but the lobby, guest areas, lounge are all ancient in quality.  If you want to watch a sporting event, you cannot even read the names on the jerseys.  Its 1988 at this hotel.

Great room- fridge, microwave, stove. The  gym was nice. Clean equipment- all new. The area was nice area- 20 min from the beach, minutes from Disney and Knotts. The breakfast was amazing. Best omelets ever.

The hotel was absolutely perfect spacious rooms, comfy bed and surprisingly even the sofa bed was comfy. The towels and bed sheets were clean, kitchen was fully facilitated, there is guest laundry room with ice machine. Small pool with nice patio seating. Quiet at night. Loved loved the hotel.  The staff was very friendly and welcoming.location was perfect near anaheim, Santa Ana, Irvine and Fullerton.  There are restaurants near by and also target.  Highly recommend it

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with friendly staff and reasonable rates
Summary: I stayed here for two nights while visiting Disney Land. This Hyatt House has been remodeled to look like all of the other Hyatt Houses and it matched the quality you would expect.   One criticism of this Hyatt House, and all Hyatt Houses to be honest, is when the hotel is sold out it would be a good idea to have extra plates, cutlery, and staff for breakfast. I've stayed about 40 times this year in Hyatt Houses and almost every time the hotel is sold out breakfast devolves into a lack of available food, the use of paper plates, and having to use a fork because there are no spoons. This might be acceptable the first time but after that there's no excuse.   That said, Hyatt is still my first choice for work travel and non-resort type vacations.

I loved my stay here. I had a suite complete with separate bedroom, full kitchen and all the amenities of home plus maid service! The pool courtyard area is lovely for having breakfast, the pool is clean and warm and at night there is a cozy firepit for gathering around. The breakfast buffet featured vegan options, including rice and miso soup. The downside - the Guest Market is not a market - it's a cooler with drinks and a few sandwiches and salads. Seriously overrated. The upside - there are tons of great restaurants and a 7-11 within throwing distance of the hotel so you won't go hungry anyway.

Summary Heading: Small jewel, great find in Area!
Summary: We were totally charmed by this place! Suite was large and comfortable. Hi top table was great for working - complete with egrodynamic chair- or for morning coffee. The large balcony was pleasant seating area at any time day or night. Communal areas in courtyard provided areas for lounging, eating or gathering around the fire pit.  Food at the bar is really a treat!! Limited menu but fresh and delicious!! Spinch salad and juicy hamburger got too reviews!  Chicolate moulton cake - umm good but makevit really super by getting some ice cream from the 24 hr store and add that!!  Laundry area was clean.  Breakfasts were awesome!! Even freshly made omelettes and pancakes! Fresh fruit always.  Front desk and all personnel were friendly, professional and helpful!!

Fabulous suites with everything you might ever need for both business travelers and families. Decent complimentary breakfast.  Comfortable bed. Lovely private pool and garden area in the center courtyard.

Hotel was newly renovated. The breakfast was excellent cook to order Omelets and small Buffet selection. The rooms were clean with plenty of room. My only complaint would be the beds. The mattresses were not that comfortable. I have back problems and the beds did not help. My overall rating for this Hotel would be a 9 out of 10. The price was a little high at $124/night + Taxes. Other Hotels in the area are only $99/night, but do not have the breakfast options. Breakfast was included in the $124/night price. If you have more than one occupant this would justify the price easily.

Summary Heading: Family friendly, with professional touches throughout
Summary: Stayed here for the second time, and the hotel was updated since I visited two years ago.  Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. Had all the amenities we needed. Friendly staff. No complaints whatsoever! We were in town for a family funeral, and the private sitting room in our hotel room gave us a place to meet with a few family members after the services.

Easy check-in and staff is very friendly. The room was spacious and clean. It was close to Disney but off the beaten path a bit. There is a Chili's, Wendy's and others very close by. There is a continental breakfast but lots of kids so be prepared.

Great hotel and service, spacious room. Morning breakfast buffet was great. Overall had a great time...close to everything. Disneyland, Knotts Berry farm, resturants, etc Would highly recommend this Hyatt House

This is a very nice hotel in a quiet commercial district of Cypress.  I stayed here for business in Huntington Beach and was pleased with the cleanliness and amenities of the hotel--modern and clean.  There was quite a bit of pool noise in my room that overlooked the central courtyard so I requested a room change, which faced over the parking lot and was much quieter.  There were a few minor mechanical issues with my room and funky/awkward light switches, but overall the suite-room was very comfortable and functional.

Had to book this hotel on short notice and had to pay top dollar.  Overall hotel was very good, but our room location was terrible.  We were near an outside door that had an electric release and was very loud.  Elevator was across from room and noise was going on until very late from people coming and going.  Poor insulation from noise from our room door.

I have learned to like and look for Hyatt House hotels when I hit the road. They are pretty much upscale versions of Residence Inns, but exclusively newer and with many nice touches. This Hyatt House meets everything that Hyatt House promises. I enjoy the space in the suites and the breakfast provided with many options in a space that never appeared to get crowded. But what I like about this Hyatt House in particular was its location. It's close enough to Disneyland as to be convenient for your visit but far enough away that you don't have all the traffic and noise that you have closer to Disney. It is slightly off the main drag providing a peaceful setting without being remote, not something easily found in Anaheim and environs. There are several nice modest eating choices

Perfect for a weekend getaway from the house. The hotel is placed within walking distance of many great restaurants. Close to Knott's Berry Farm, Disneyland, and Angel Stadium. Every room includes a full kitchen.

This place was perfect for my family, my budget, and its close proximity to Disneyland ( 10 minute drive ). The staff is very professional, extremely polite and the rooms very nice for the price you pay. The complimentary breakfast was excellent and available food selection very well stocked. Best decision I have ever made when it came to savings and finding a quality place to stay at a reasonable price.

Especially great breakfast (included), spacious room, nice outdoor area, and friendly staff. Clean, modern, and overall a great stay.  We found that it was in a good location to act as a launching point to the southern California attractions, and it's in an area with a lot of food  options.

This hotel was recently renovated and is absolutely gorgeous. The decor is modern and sleek and warm at the same time,. A room for myself and husband and teenage son worked out perfectly with a separate bedroom and roomy living area. The only thing to mention is that the construction of the sinks/faucets is a bit off. The spout in the kitchen sink and vanity sink does not come out far enough and therefore water hits the countertops and makes a mess each time. Also the shower door does not close completely which creates a flood on the floor and you have to be sure the bathmat catches the overflow. The staff is very helpful and pleasant. The breakfast is a FULL breakfast, and they'll even do made to order omelets. The bartender Shane was courteous, friendly, and efficient. We had

Definitely more of a home-like feel in these rooms. The remodel makes a HUGE difference. It is clean with a modern touch and a good group of people working there. I came down here for work and it was pleasant to work in the room when needed and comfortable to hang out in the patio area during cocktail time. There was a mix of family and business folks here so I would recommend the 2nd or 3rd floor if you are here for work. There's a little more noise on the 1st floor.

I always thanks to the hyatt house team for providing me free room upgrades, this was my 14th time that I got a free complimentary room upgrade. I`m definitely will go back. Also the breakfast is amazing compare other hotels.

We stayed one week at the Hyatt House and I would say that we have not stayed at a cleaner, nicer hotel in years.  It had the friendliest staff, they took pride in keeping the rooms and common spaces spotless.  Everyone was so friendly and would greet us anytime we came in contact with them, that is a rare thing in most hospitality places these days.  You could tell that the staff took pride in the hotel and in keeping the guests happy. We used the breakfast area every morning and it always had a variety of selections and everything was always stocked and fresh.  The made to order omelets were our favorite.  I would recommend that anyone in the area pick the Hyatt House for their business or pleasure stay.

We have stayed here many times over the years but this trip was the best! The property has been recently renovated and the rooms are simple yet classy. The front desk staff was helpful and courteous. There is a great breakfast selection including omelettes and other hot items. Be sure to get there early as they close it down right at 1000am sharp!! All the rooms have balconies so request a room with a pool/courtyard view it's better than the outside which faces the parking lot. It's also nice that there are many other food options nearby including a "Chili's" next door. Also, Los Alamitos race track is close too!Have fun!

The staff was VERY friendly and accommodating. We were upgraded to one of the larger rooms and it was very spacious and updated with modern features. My only complaint (which is why I didn't give the property more stars) is that the bedroom didn't have a door or privacy feature. When we travel with our daughter we always want a separate bedroom for privacy which is why we usually choose Hyatt House or Embassy Suites. Also the bathroom door was very loud and squeaky. It was loud enough to wake up everyone in the room. We were in a wheelchair accessible room so the aforementioned issues may only be issues for room 362.  Other than the above mentioned setbacks we really enjoyed our stay. We were near the elevator but we didn't hear any noise. We didn't smell any smoke. The linen

I was very happy with my accomdations and will book with the hotel in the future when I am in town for business or leisure.  The staff were very helpful, respectful and courteous.  The breakfast was a big plus and a great way to start the day.

Very clean, small, efficient hotel for any kind of travelling. No fancy on site restaurant, no room service, so you don't pay for any overhead. But it does offer a quiet, efficient, clean place to stay.   But in LA where excellent restaurant is abundance, it really does not matter.

This is a great hotel.  My kids love the pool and the breakfast buffet is great.  Rooms were recently remodeled and there is only showers in the room now.  I had a room with no stove, but overall I had a great time.

I travelend with my family of four that included a toddler and a teen. Everything went smoothly and what was promised on their website is exactly what you get and more. The rooms are huge, tons of amenities and small property so you aren't getting lost or parking super far away from a door. Family oriented so I wasn't made to feel bad when my 2 year old was talking to everyong at breakfast. Staff was courteous.

Summary Heading: great hotel, with a couple minor drawbacks
Summary: This was a very nice, new and clean (as of March 2015) hotel.  The suites are very spacious with plenty of counter space in the kitchen.  The water pressure in the shower is amazingly strong, which I love for rinsing out my hair faster.    We all loved the miso soup for breakfast. We'd never had it for breakfast before, but my family loves it, so that was a great touch!  The only couple drawbacks were probably fixable over time.  On the first floor, people smoke right on their patio, so if you are next door and want to open the windows, you can smell the smoke.   Second, the hotel is so new that all the furniture and carpets still have a strong chemical smell.  That should dissipate over time or with lots of open windows (as long as you don't mind some smokers nearby). Third,

Love, love, love! The three of us booked a one-bedroom suite on the third floor. Quiet. Clean. Plenty of room for kitchenette (which is fully stocked, complete with sink, cupboards, coffee maker, fridge, stove, etc.), sitting area, small dinette. Balcony is tiny but who has time to use it anyway?... Large bedroom and bathroom. Wish there was a door separating the sink area though because when someone is sleeping on bed, too much noise and lights too bright for that person to sleep if other family members are using the sink. TVs need to be hooked up right because picture quality is pretty bad. The staff is amazing, always greet you with a smile and they never sit down, no matter what time of the day or night! Breakfast is awesome, couldn't ask for more hot and cold varieties!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel near Knott's Berry Farm and Disneyland
Summary: This is the 3rd trip that we've made to the Anaheim area.  The last two times we stayed closer to Disneyland.  I liked this hotel because there were fewer small children running around.  We had a two room suite that had a full-sized refrigerator and a stove (I never touched the stove).  The hotel had a nice breakfast area.  Everything seemed new.  My most important quality in a hotel, the bed, was wonderful.  I would definitely choose this hotel again.

We liked the location,close to everything!! They staff very helpful . Pool, hot tub very nice. The best part for us was the baroque, and the propane fire pit!! We were able to make our own dinner by a fire. Then the staff took our dishes.. Robert was fantastic.. Always helpful. I feel he went over and above!! Great guy

We stayed here for one night before heading to Disneyland the next day.
