Overall, I would recommend this hotel for any purpose other than visiting Disneyland on weekends (because of traffic and parking). Below is a summary of our experience.  Pros: * Newly renovated rooms that are comfortable, clean, and tastefully decorated * Excellent buffet breakfast ... kept us going until dinner time  Cons: * Service was a little spotty ... we had to make the sofa bed ourselves because nobody was available at 9 PM on Friday * No shuttle to Disneyland

The hotel is conveniently located, the staff are friendly, they offer a great morning breakfast buffet, the rooms and common areas look newly renovated.  I would definitely stay here again and will look for the Hyatt House brand in other cities.

It was great time with my family during SFO trip. My kids also enjoyed there and we will stay there if we travel there again.. We stayed for 2 days and Bob was very kind from check-in to my many questions regarding super market near there.

Great service and great breakfast, The rooms were very clean and very spacey. The security guards at night made my family feel very safe! We stayed in the suite and the beds were really comfortable and the WIFI worked good.

Stayed at Hyatt House Cypress May 15 through 17. Two Room spacious suite with good tv channel selection, full kitchen. Staff went out of way to be helpful. Very close to a costco with a gas station. Breakfast buffet very good,fresh cooked omelettes etc. Free wsj usa today friday sat, free orange county register sunday. Highly recommend.

Nice big rooms, newly renovated. Very confortable, loved the king size bed. The breakfast buffet was excellent.  You are only 15 minutes from Disney land. Ther is transit, lots of different choices for eating, from fast food to actual dining in. didn't  get a chance to try the gym out or the pool.

This place is newly renovated, has a great pool area out door with a bbq area where you can pickup some food and have a bbq, friendly staff and close to many attractions along the coast, good local area restraints as well.

Clean room, low traffic area. Fairly quiet. Views were of the parking lot and market store items were very overpriced. The morning buffet items  were delicious and varied. The staff were friendly and helpful even though they took a long time to check us in to our rooms.

what a hidden gem! the surrounding area is more business than a line of hotels but still close enough to beaches and theme parks - some reviews stated  the beds were too firm but we found them to be good for us - great breakfast and quiet rooms  and most of all a friendly staff

Perfect location near restaurants. Would be a only a short drive to Disney. Loved the room - having a kitchen was great. Everything was clean and updated. Really nice shower too! The entire staff was helpful and friendly. Already booked for our next trip.

Really enjoyed our stay.  We got a one bedroom unit for three of us.  It worked great.  Wish we had been staying longer.  The breakfast was really good - to order omelettes, fresh fruit, etc.  Weather was great so we sat out by the pool and ate.  Bed was medium firm but comfortable.  Clean, newly decorated, nice little kitchen with all the appliances.  Highly recommend.

Beautiful place. A GREAT place to stay if you are going to Disneyland, just down the road. The beach is about a 15-20 min drive. Love it, and the front desk ladies listened to my old man stories. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Good Place to Stay as Family as well as any Business Trips
Summary: The hotel was very clean overall. It's in a very quite neighborhood and about 20 mins away (approximately 10 - 12 miles away) from the DisneyLand. For just information, the shuttle services only available within 5 miles radius of the hotel. Very nice place to stay as a family or any business trips. Super close to Costco.

Great rooms, great breakfast, location and service, highly recommended, my family was really happy with the hotel selection.  Room had a very well equipped kitchen, the bathroom and shower was very clean, we like the sofa bed as the kids can use it and they really enjoy.

We had a fantastic four night stay! The remodel was great and everything was refreshed and brand new. It was great to have a full kitchen and a room with a separate living room since we all have different sleeping schedules. It was only a short 20 min drive to Disney and an even shorter drive to Knotts. We had a ton of restaurant choices nearby and a few within walking distance. We also had great, helpful interaction with the front staff - they let us check in early and were helpful with directions. The breakfast was also great and an awesome perk! We don't eat too much for breakfast so the selection was perfect. Loved the made to order omelets to oatmeal to bagels! No complaints whatsoever and would definitely stay again!!

I spent two weeks in this hotel. No issues, good service. The rooms are clean. The staff is nice. It seems they renovated lately. The pool area is vconvenient and nice wit tables and barbecues for the customers.

Great place to stay!  The room is spacious and clean.  Has everything you need including a fully stocked kitchen w/dishwasher a full size refridgerator for long stays.  The courtyard has 2 Weber gas grills to cook.  The pool/jacuzzi is nice to relax in.  Staff was helpful with dining selection in the area.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel at a great price!
Summary: This is the second time staying at the Hyatt House in Cypress. The price of the stay was very competitive and the breakfast is amazing.  You can't beat the price of the hotel when you consider the price of paying for your breakfast.  This hotel has been remodeled since our last stay, one year ago.  They did an amazing job.  I did not recognize it.  The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating.  We will definitely come back to this hotel for our future visits to Long Beach.

Travelled with kids and stayed at Hyatt because of brand name. the check-in process was very smooth and the reception staff were very courteous. I stayed on the second floor one bedroom suite. The suite was renovated and clean. The bath tub was old and was the odd man out. Also, the curtains need to have a second layer if you don't want to wake up with sunrise.  But overall experience was very good because of the room, front office staff and kitchen/breakfast room staff

We stayed here for only one night, but all we can say - we wish we had stayed here longer. The family room for 2 adults and 2 kids was super great, and included a small kitchen and living room in addition to bedroom. The kids used the pool and spa. Breakfast had good selection of items. Parking was quite limited due to renovation, but we have managed to find a space. Would definitely return !

I enjoyed the friendly, personalized environment fashioned by the Hyatt House.  The Hyatt House came as close as providing a feeling of being at home away from home as I have ever experienced at a hotel.

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel at a Great Price
Summary: I was very impressed with this recently renovated hotel. My room had a separate bedroom, living room, and kitchen. The kitchen area had a very large bar table with excellent lighting. It was a great place to work. Everything about the hotel felt new and fresh. Definitely would stay here again the next time I'm in the area.

We had a one bedroom suite with two queen's and a sofa with a full kitchen! The breakfast in the morning is really good, the staff is friendly, and H-bar prices are reasonable. There is no happy hour here like there is at other Hyatt houses though. We believe this property  was recently remodeled, the artwork is contemporary and modern in the rooms. The beds are very comfortable with plenty of pillows. If you are traveling with children and planning to visit Knottsberry farm or Disneyland, it is a nice alternative and only a few minutes away from the theme parks.

My parents stayed here for 4 months while awaiting a remodel and we are here for a month for the same reason so we know this facility well.  It's almost done being remodeled so it looks a lot nicer than before.  It's great for families, although they don't have 2 bedrooms.  They do have a presidential suite (2 of them, I think) and we are on the one on the third floor which has bathroom access from the common room (2nd floor one does not).  It's surprisingly quiet here if you are on the 3rd floor.  Breakfast is typical fare, but very very good.  They also have rice and miso soup?  Strange but I might try it one of these days.  Close enough to Disneyland (just down Cerritos).  Lots of great restaurants to walk to like La-Men (noodle house) and the Fish restaurant.  Their business

I've stayed at this hotel while visiting family on several occasions over the last 7 years and have been relatively happy with the location and space. With a recent facilility refresh, the location has become even better! We stayed in the Presidential Suite, lots of wasted space, but very large.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Hyatt House in Cypress on many occasions, it is great to hear from previous guests that the renovation was a success and you enjoyed the new look.

Summary: This was my first time to a Hyatt House and I was very impressed. Modern and gorges rooms.  Friendly staff.  Very comfortable beds.  Weather was great so enjoyed the balcony.  Omelet bar and numerous choices for breakfast.  Excellent value for the price.

Summary Heading: best anaheim hotel to bring your family
Summary: easy access to highway, yet not to close to be bothered by noise as it is usually the case,  great room with super comfortable beds, Great breakfast, consumed in the dining area in outdoor patio. We even put salmon to bbq and enjoyed it poolside

Booked for 3 nights and told NO construction during time of stay.  Upon check in, there were construction throughout the patio area for the entire stay with noise and lots of dust and debris.  My unit faces the patio and could not open due to noise and dust.  Should have not lied just to fulfill the vacancy.

Our family stayed here for 2 weeks, we left early March.  The hotel renovations seemed to be almost completely finished.  When we left they were finishing up repaving the parking lot.  The room we had was newly renovated.  Kitchen in suite included full sized frig, microwave and oven.  It was close enough to Knott's and Disneyland but away from the business of those tourist-y areas.  The room was large and comfortable.  Housekeeping staff did a good job.  Easy access to fwy's, and within 2 miles of grocery stores, drug stores and restaurants.  Costco 1 block away.  All staff we came into contact with was friendly.  Kids enjoyed heated pool.  There was not much neighbor noise, although we periodically heard voices in the hallway.  Business center has 2 computers  available.

Just stayed one night at the Hyatt House.  Check in was quick and friendly.  We stayed here because we were looking at colleges and it wasn't too far from Cal State Long Beach.  The room is good because I had two teenage boys who cannot sleep in the same bed, so the room with 2 queens and the sofa bed is a good option.  Also, the location is close to restaurants and not too far from theme parks and shopping.  Free wi-fi always appreciated.  The breakfast was OK -- nothing special.  They just stopped the hot breakfast a day before for some reason and so we had the continental.  Overall, I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Overnight in Cypress/Brea area, a good option, a good value
Summary: A good value, near major boulevards for access to freeways and adjacent cities.  I'll say that my GP account is a Premier account, but I do not feel that there were services/gestures made due to that status.  I stayed here in order to have a shorter drive to meetings in Long Beach (I live in the San Gabriel Valley, traffic can be horrid). I was paying for my own stay, used GP points and then paid for the 3rd night. Reservations personnel and hotel staff helped ensure that the reservation was clear and understood by all (I think they were treated as 2 reservations, and could have caused confusion).  The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood, many restaurants within a 5-minute drive, grocery stores nearby.  The renovation appears to be complete, I saw no construction/renovation

Undergoing renovations. Workers are loud, messy and rude. Had to literally walk over one worker who was stapling in new carpet. First room had tiny window. Asked for a room with a balcony only to change rooms to a room overlooking the dumpsters. Balcony was a 2 foot concrete space with no furniture. Shower was pretty but constructed all wrong. Had to get all the way in to turn on the water. I like to reach in first to get the temp just right. Confusing hallways that were not marked well. Walked in a complete circle before finding elevator. Lighting too bright in rooms. Alarm woke me up at 3AM from previous guest. Baby crying in next room all night and could here it like it was in my bed. Not my type of place.

Not sure when the other reviewer checked in but my experience this past weekend - Feb 6-9 - was far from not having issues.  The construction was right in the way of people making way to their rooms.  Luckily, we checked in and left for most of the day.  For the unfortunate people who actually needed to stay in their rooms - the noise would not be great.  Housekeeping was POOR.  We checked into a room where it appeared it had been cleaned, but someone had gone in and used the bathroom and left their mark.  We changed rooms and the other one was not very clean either.  They need maid training for sure.  Food on cabinet door handles, greasy stovetop.  The new features won't last long if they don't hire people that clean them better.  Specifically mentioned on their housekeeping

Summary Heading: Clean, friendly and a great location.
Summary: Arrived to find the lobby under renovation but was not an issue.  Front desk staff was very friendly and professional.  Was quickly checked in and given clear directions to our room.  Room was spacious and clean.  This hotel sits in a convenient location and fairly close to theme parks and not far from the beach..  There are fast food as well as sit down restaurants all within walking distance.  Hotel stay was quiet and comfortable.  Breakfast room was under renovation so breakfast was served in a 2nd floor conference room.  Breakfast was decent and tasty with all that you'd need or want.  Overall I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a fair priced, clean hotel that is spacious with all the comforts of home.  Keep doing it right and I will keep coming back!  I left this
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Hyatt House Cypress, we really appreciate you taking the time to fill out a review.  We are committed to providing the best service possible and once again we are glad you enjoyed your stay.  If you need anything in the future to make your stay enjoyable on a return visit do not hesitate to reach out.    Best Regards!

Summary Heading: Under renovations...make sure they tell you.
Summary: Place is under renovation and I they didn't inform us. Went down to see family for new year's even and they had my reservation wrong. It was fixed prior to getting there then found out why...Place was a major construction site. I'm fine with hotels improving but notice would have been nice. No where to park. No ice machines on the floor we were on. Had to go down to the lobby in my pj's to get some. Room was small and very dusty. Stairwell smelt really bad. People working there were nice but again, telling us they were unset renovation would have been great to know. May have elected another place.   Not worth the rate I paid at all.
Manager Response: Thank you for completing a review regarding your recent stay at our hotel. I apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. I can understand how frustrating the renovation must have been for you during your stay. Please know that the hotel renovation will be completed at the beginning of February and I look forward to unveiling the new product to you. I hope you can give us another try in the near future so we can fully provide you with an exceptional stay!  Again, I apologize for the inconvenience during your stay and hope to see you during your next visit. If can provide any assistance especially on a future stay, please contact me directly at 714-828-4000.

Summary: 1-there was no water twice during our stay, 2-its too noisy to stay there due to hotel renovation  3- staff are not helpful at all  4-and last day the WiFi disconnected because of renovation 5-GYM is closed

Summary Heading: A nice place to stay in Southern California
Summary: This hotel is located very close to a number of restaurants and movie theaters. It is currently has a very large construction project going on so there is a lot of construction vehicles etc...However, it is very quiet and I never heard any such activity at night. The breakfast buffet is set up in a large conference room. It is well stocked but it is only average in food quality. Free Wi-Fi is offered in all rooms and it does have laundry facilities on site. The kitchens in the rooms are well stocked with everything that you will need to cook quick meals at night. I stayed at this hotel for three weeks and will return here again when I am in California.

Its simply amazing, how a hotel of this size is made to make your stay completely relaxing, yet seems to be easy. Team work created a very nice, clean and comfortable place to be.  One of the few hotels where nothing is missing. Chose this place, relax and enjoy

Summary Heading: Starting to get a badly needed remodel
Summary: May want to wait till remodel is complete. Rooms were clean but could hear neighbors on both sides. Internet was slow and unreliable. Very limited parking unless you want to park in construction area. Parking lot was not lit well either.

This hotel was being renovated during our stay (Thanksgiving weekend, 2014). I didn't realize renovations were underway until we arrived, at 11pm, after a 400 mile drive.  At 6am the next morning, contractors were moving things around in the parking lot, and turning engines (trucks? construction lifts?) on and off.  We also learned that the pool was closed (disappointment for the kids).  We should have found another hotel for our second night, because the morning after that, the contractors were making the same noises, and using occupied guest areas to move loads of tile and grout around the building.  The truck dropping off a dumpster (literally, dropping) outside of guest room windows at 7am on a weekend was a nice touch.  I wish there had been some warning of this situation

there is ongoing renovation in the hotel. The rooms are not clean. The furniture is worn out and the breakfast is limited in variety. The bed is comfortable though and the front desk personnel are welcoming.

We had no idea the hotel was under construction until we pulled in and the front of the hotel was blocked off. Not only that but the pool was unavailable.  Which for my 5 yr that is all he was looking forward to. Our particular room the kitchen faucet plumbing is backwords. What should be hot is cold and cold is hot. When I went to fill up the bathtub for my kids, stuff came out from the drain. And as my 18 month was taking a nap, all you could hear was pounding from the floor above us.(because of the remodel)

Not worth staying here at this time. I checked in Oct 27th and left the next morning as I was able to check in at a nearby hotel which appeared to have been recently updated. What a difference. This hotel is undergoing a major renovation. The front lobby is where the gym was, so no gym The pathetic bar and breakfast area are in meeting rooms on the 2nd floor. Once you get to the room it is obvious a remodel is overdue. The pool is closed also. There are enough hotels nearby to choose from which is what I did after my 1st night here. Hopefully the remodel will include the rooms, hallway, and even the elevator looked shabby. My understanding is that the renovation will not be done until February. The only plus was the fact that I did not have to pay a cancellation fee for the two

In town for a special event, we booked this hotel after reading the reviews on several travel websites- most of the reviews were quite positive.  Unfortunately, no where does it mention that they are in the middle of an extensive remodel. I even spoke to the front desk twice and there was no mention of this.  The work was not going on at night, but the rest of the day it was EXTREMELY loud from the extensive work that is going on.  I gotta tell you though......the remodel is GREATLY NEEDED as this hotel is shabby and outdated with ABSOLUTELY PAPER THIN WALLS.  Seriously, the noise from just your neighbor talking of their phone or watching television is ridiculous. Also, our bathroom had someone's hair all over it and some dirt and grass in the tub, like someone had dusted off

We went to the Anaheim area on an impromptu trip to Disneyland. Before we left I found this hotel for a good price for a 1 bedroom suite with free breakfast and booked it. The hotel was very pleasant upon check in and staff was very helpful and the process was a breeze. The lobby and food area is nice and clean. Our room was comfortable and clean. the linens and beds were very comfortable and good quality. everything seemed in working order. The reason I cannot give a better star rating is because it was a little run down. while the furniture was nice and the beds and black out curtains were all really good, the carpet had some folds in it, the bathroom tile and grout is in serious need of a redo!! The appliances were old and outdated. I tried to get icemaker to work upon

I am so impressed with the cleanliness and friendliness of the staff.  They greeted and took great care getting us settled in.  Any question I had or need, they responded quickly.  The breakfast was like nothing I'd expect.  The service was great.  I was with several friends, and were able to enjoy the grounds and sit out and enjoy your courtyard.  Very relaxing.  Awesome place to stay.  I am sold on Hyatt!!

I stayed here over the weekend with some friends and didn't know what to expect.  The beds are nice and comfortable.  The kitchen is full of appliances, pots, pans, etc.  You could literally live there for however long.  There's a closet with a full desk, vanity, and tv.  The spa is nice, though a little noisy at 10pm (when it's supposed to be closed) there were many kids and adults around the pool area.  Fitness center was full of parents and kids, too.  That was awkward.  The continental breakfast was great!  Scrambled eggs, turkey sausage, french toast, fruit, yogurt, dry cereal, oatmeal, bagels, english muffins, miso soup, rice, and lots of condiments and beverages.  I was extremely satisfied with their breakfast selection.   Overall, I'd definitely look into staying here

Summary Heading: Disappointed, Expected more from the Hyatt Brand
Summary: Location was very convenient, easy access from freeway.  Check in was smooth, plenty of parking.  Underwhelmed by the room, not very clean, had a old smell.  Room was fine, TV was really small and bathroom was very gross.  Will not stay here again. Chose it based on previous experiences with Hyatt's.

We were moving our daughter into her dorm, and needed a place to stay for a couple of nights.  After an exhausting search of hotels in the area - none of which were 5 star, we decided to stay at the Hyatt House.  We did use our Hyatt Gold Points.  We arrived earlier than the check-in, and were given a room right away.  The staff is very friendly.  Our room was spacious, and clean, and we were very pleased.  The breakfast is just ok - but good enough for being included.  We do usually stay at a higher caliber hotel, and we really were pleasantly surprised with the Hyatt House.  As my daughter is attending a local University, we will be back, and gladly stay at the Hyatt House.  We had not problem with the Wifi - and there were 4 of us using it at the same time! Truly a very good

I wanted to like this hotel a lot more than I did.  Pros: great location, clean, friendly staff, nice little pool and jacuzzi, nice sized suites, sofa-bed had a good thick mattress, free WiFi, free parking.  With all those pros, what could be wrong? Hard bed, annoying issues with WiFi service, not the best in-room lighting, rather small dining area for breakfast.  For some reason I wasn't affected by the mattress as much the first night, but by the second night I couldn't get comfortable.  No matter how I laid my back was hurting - even laying flat on my back I was eventually hurting between my shoulder blades, so very little sleep was had on the second night.  WiFi was constantly disconnecting on its own.  I would be happy to blame my Windows 8 OS laptop, but I had the same

In the height of summer there was alot of noise in the halls and pool. So I was very happy that once in the room, I did not hear the noise or the VERY LOUD party 2 doors down.  The room was large and clean.  I was sharing with another person for a conference and we each had our own TV's. The bed was very comfortable. The only issue with the room was that it had an automatic sensored light and the light would go on in the middle of the night disturbing my roomate who was sleeping on the pull out bed. Breakfast is included with your stay with hot & cold options. Late check out is only 1pm. when we are used to a later checkout when at other hotels for conferences. But there are alot of great dining options with in walking distance for lunches and dinners.

The hotel is not new (elevators look and feel really dated) but the rooms are big. We stayed as a family of four for 4 nights. The kitchen was well stocked and the sofa bed was great for the kids to sleep. Breakfast is great and had varied options every day. There are plenty of eating options within walking distance and a Ralph's super market is a 10 minute drive. Housekeeping was efficient and the laundry though generally quite busy in the evenings was handy as we had been away from home for 10 days already. Taxi costs $25- $30 from here to Disney if you do not have your own car.

As I walked through the hotel to reach my room, I was taken back by the lack of cleanliness in this Hyatt branded hotel. The carpets were heavily stained. The elevators were banged up and also dirty, with the brass bar in both elevators looking like they had not ever been polished. Not sure about the carpet in my room as it was so dark, one wouldn't be able to notice staining. While the room seemed clean,the refrigerator buzzed; the kitchen was dated and I had to look for a waste basket throughout the entire suite before finding one under the kitchen sink. After being so appalled by the lack of cleanliness in the common areas, there was no way I was eating a meal in this hotel. This was a very uncomfortable stay; never again.

Booked 4 nights but left after 2 days. We have stayed at several Hyatt properties in the past, and were expecting similar levels of luxury and convenience.  Our room had dated kitchen equipment, a stale odour, and a hopelessly outdated look and feel to it. We had a 2 room suite. The biggest disappointment was the filthy bath tub, shower curtains and mouldy smell. The toilet would not flush properly and backed up the tissue paper. I complained to the front desk clerk, who arranged to give us a different room.  The second room was certainly an improvement. However, once again we had a malfunctioning toilet, peeling paint in the bathroom and a filthy shower curtain. The towels and linen were all badly stained. A closer inspection of the bathroom revealed some disgusting remnants of

Summary Heading: It's ok but will look for other options next time
Summary: This is a ok place.  The pictures are much nicer than reality.  We had 2 rooms.  The first was clean and comfortable.  The 2nd smelled of old fruit.  I ran the disposal and something was there so by the next day the old fruit smell was almost gone.  The carpet is vacuumed but I would not call it clean.  The bed was comfortable and the couch was also.  Again, it was ok but I will look for other options next time.  The area near the hotel is nice with several good eating places.  Dominic's is just down the street and should not be missed.

We just spent 2 nites here. We found the hotel a great value.  The room a superior king room, clean and well furnished. The hotel staff was very accomodating. We took advantage of the free shuttle to take us to and from a close by event. Breakfast included hot items (eggs, sausage, etc), some asian offferings, toast, etc, fruit, yogurt, coffee and juices. The property has a pool. We recommend the Hyatt House for value and convenience.

We stayed here for 1 night only and arrived really late with the kids after a long day at Disneyland (after midnight), but the lady in front desk was kind enough to allow us a late check out the next morning and so we enjoyed the great breakfast buffet they offered, (do I have to mention it's complementary, taste great, there's something for everyone and it saved us time and money) and even had time for a quick dip in the pool with the kids before checking out. To the front staff, thanks for the extra hour, this is what I call good customer service!

We stayed here for 1 night only and arrived really late with the kids after a long day at Disneyland (to be exact after midnight), but the lady in front desk was kind enough to allow us a late check out the next morning and so we enjoyed the great breakfast buffet they offered, (do I have to mention it's complementary, taste great, there's something for everyone and it saved us time and money) and even had time for a quick dip in the pool with the kids before checking out.  To the front staff, thanks for the extra hour, this is what I call good customer service!

The Hyatt House Cypress/Anaheim is a converted Summerfield Suites Hotel.  Compared to the only other Hyatt House that I have been to (in Scottsdale) this is actually a hotel, rather than a motel set-up.  The hotel is on the smaller side, and upon entering the hotel the lobby feels very small and cramped.  While at the front desk, merely turning around gets you to the elevator doors.  Check-in was quick and efficient.  The front desk agent was friendly and cheerful, and clearly explained all Diamond benefits including the welcome amenity, of which I took the extra 500 bonus points, and the breakfast hours.  I was given a room overlooking the courtyard, which I didn’t think was all that great when I first entered the room as I could hear kids screaming down by the pool.

No aaa discount or senior discount couldn't even apply my company code.not happy.i stayed at the San Diego Hyatt house and the gave me a free up grade do to over booking,so it was very shocking to not get my Entitled discount..best of luck to u and I haven't even got there yet.they messed up my res. 3 times failed to apply my gold member number to earn points .waited on hold for over5 times in 30 min.fixing bed size and adding more guests to my presidential sweet..omg

Summary Heading: Everything we hoped for - exceeded our high expectations
Summary: We stayed at the Hyatt House Cypress/Anaheim in early Feb 2014 for an AYSO soccer tournament. Our entire team stayed there and everyone agreed that it was a fantastic value and our stay exceed our expectations, especially when you consider the price we paid for the huge, well appointed rooms.  I had called prior to our check-in to make sure it was OK for us to have a team 'party' in the courtyard, since the girls were going to want to swim all afternoon. Everything wen't perfect and everyone had a great time. They accommodated us any way they could.  This property is ideal for any family and we look forward staying there any time we find ourselves over-nighting in the area again.  Quick points: The staff was very courteous and quick during our early check-in. The room was clean

I always consider location when reviewing hotels and compare to others in the area in regards to price and amenities. Therefore, The Hyatt House Cypress/Anaheim is a good choice considering the other hotels around Disneyland and the Convention center. Here's the good... Compared to other hotels in the area, this hotel would be considered very affordable for the star level. It was about 15 minutes from both Disneyland and the Convention center and had a FedEx Office directly across the street (perfect for business) and very convenient. Also, Chili's right next door too! The room was clean and bed was comfortable. However, a little out-dated. I had a kitchen suite (which wasn't really necessary for me) But I could see it a real plus for families with kids. Now the

I stayed at this property back in April 2013 for a friends wedding I was attending nearby. I don't recall the names of the agents that checked me in/out, but I do know they were always friendly and willing to help. Even the housekeeper who serviced our room each day was very pleasant to deal with. The room itself was very clean and comfortable.   Some recommendations: 1. On a hot day, when a guest leaves the room with the A/C on, please don't come behind them and turn it off so they have to come back to a hot and stuffy room later. It's uncomfortable to have to wait for the room to cool down again.   2. On a busy weekend, 2 people running the breakfast area is not enough. I had to tip toe my way around the dining room over spilled food and drinks to not get any on my shoes and

Summary Heading: A bit expensive, but worth it
Summary: This hotel is a Hyatt brand but is more relaxed and informal than a Hyatt.  We stayed three days including Christmas in room 103, a king suite facing the pool and next to the breakfast room.  From the bedroom we never heard a sound, but from the living room we could hear people passing in the hallway.  It was the perfect place to be as the breakfast room was quite crowded the first morning so we took our breakfast back to our room.  Pros: The suite was clean and roomy.  The kitchen was well equipped for preparing and serving meals. The bed was very comfortable.  The queen sized sofa bed in the living room is perfect for young teens and kids. The breakfast selections were good. Complimentary shuttle vans will take you anywhere within a five mile radius.  Cons: The pool is a bit

Summary Heading: Hyatt shouldn't put their name on this Chain
Summary: I stay at Hyatt Regency and Grand Hyatt when on Biz travel.  So figured this extended stay hotel would be okay.   Was I wrong !!!    Stayed there for 4 days during Christmas Holidays and what a disappointment.   The hotel's infrastructure is incapable of handling the guest load: 1)  The free WiFi usually said "too many people logged in"  when I tried in the evenings 2)  The breakfast buffet room was too small, over crowded with long wait line.  And they kept running out of clean dishes  (um, anyone thought of running down to Walmart to buy 50-100 more dishes?) 3)  The AC system is noisy, both in my room and I could hear the next door's AC when it kicked on.  Woke me up during the night. 4)  The plumbing system had issues.   In the AM, I went to the bathroom to take a shower and

Rooms are spacious with separate living room with kitchen/kitchenette and closed off bedroom. Beds are so comfy!! Housekeeping is so attentive and rooms are kept spotless. Downside is breakfast room is PACKED every morning with food and supplies constantly running out; staff did their best to keep up. TIP: Make sure you specify full kitchen if you want one; website states suites have full kitchens and many have just old micro and mini fridges.  Room Tip: Ask for 3rd floor room in the corners. Even though they are off the elevator it is so quiet there. Rooms on 1st floor and with pool view can get VERY LOUD.

My husband, 2 boys and I stayed for 10 days. The staff was very friendly. The free breakfast was amazing. Our room was clean and very spacious. This hotel is so close to everything; Disneyland, Knotts and a lot of restaurants. The price is very reasonable considering all the amenities. I will be back in the L.A. area in January and will be coming back to the Hyatt House in Cypress.

The hotel staff allows guests whom they claim do not understand english to skinny dip in the pool. Disgusting and absolutely ridiculous that the hotel responds so unprofessionally to guests skinny dipping in the pool area. Also when you call about guests next door making loud noises after 10pm, again the hotel does not know how to respond and provides no assistance. However, the hotel responds great to charging you over $100 a night at this place. Please consider another hotel before staying here.

Summary Heading: Clean and Modern, But Older Appliances
Summary: Our room was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was fairly large and clean. We didn't cook anything, but did notice that the stove was a bit old.  The breakfast was delicious: there were lots of food options! We had choices of different coffee, tea, and juice, plus hot food, baked goods, and fruit. Oddly they had three TVs playing different channels in the dining area though.  The only complaint I have was that the floor layout was a bit confusing; if you turned the wrong direction after the stairs or elevator, you had quite a long walk back to your room.

Visited the Hyatt House during the Educause conference, and had an overall good stay.    I usually look forward to Hyatt stays, but a few things to note for staying here in the future:  1. Try to secure a room away from the breakfast area.  Loud noise and food traffic got me up every morning 2. Be sure to check your new towels before using - I opened one post-shower to find it full of hair  Otherwise, the location was nice and I liked the nearby restaurants.

Summary Heading: Better If You Are Not A Morning Person
Summary: Breakfast doesn't start until 6:30 a.m. and plenty of early risers wait anxiously for the buffet to be opened. Typically hotels in the area open breakfast at 6:00 a.m., so staying here is a serious disadvantage if you need to take the freeways. No problems with the food though, it is a very good buffet. The rooms are huge, with a large living room, kitchen, and dining area separated from the bedroom and bathroom. The property and rooms are very dated, but well-maintained. This is a good choice for an extended stay in the area, even better if you like to sleep in.

Summary Heading: Great Value, Great Location, Hidden Gem
Summary: I stayed at Hyatt House Cypress/Anaheim CA for business. The staff was welcoming and it was convenient to the location of my conference in Anaheim. My room had a kitchen and was comfortable and well furnished. The bed was comfortable and had nice linens. Some hotels offer breakfast but Hyatt House offered BREAKFAST. It was well done with lots of options. It was quiet. The breakfast room was also a restaurant open for dinner until 10 PM. For people on business, this is helpful at the end of a long work day. If you have an extended stay in Orange County, choose Hyatt House. You won't be disappointed.

Summary Heading: Overall a good stay, some minor problems...
Summary: The good: the king suite I stayed in on the 3rd floor corner in the back of the hotel was spacious and kept clean by a good housekeeping staff. It was quiet and I was not disturbed by other guests or staff. The furnishings inside the room were comfortable and not worn. The price was right, love the free wifi, parking and delicious breakfast. We had a really nice dinner in the bar (Harp on tap - nice!) with great service from a friendly bartender.   The bad: the first floor smells funny, like old hotel. The elevator also smelled like trash sometimes - this was taken care of by the front staff when I let them know. The pool is dinky, but appeared clean. Like the library, but the furniture appears old and worn throughout the hotel. A little updating is definitely in order, along

Stayed at Hyatt house Cypress/Anaheim for a week with family. The hotel is located in a business neighborhood, but it is close to highways and there are quite a few restaurants around. The room was spacious with a good size living room and a separate bedroom. The hotel is old and the interiors were little outdated but overall the rooms were clean. The breakfast buffet was decent. We traveled with our 2 year child, so we cooked meals for the day during our stay. The best part was house keeping cleaned the pats, pans and plates and kept it clean when we returned in the evening. Overall a very good place to stay if you are traveling with family.

We booked this hotel through online hotel booking after reading most of the good reviews. we stayed at this hotel when it was something else about three or four years ago. Unfortunately they have not updated there carpet or there dinning area since then. The room had a really bad odor when the front desk told us this was the last one they had so we had to stay in it!!! after being out with the kids came back around 9pm there was lots of loud noise coming from top of our room from  stomping and running and jumping around continued until after 11 pm we called the front desk when they mentioned they would send someone to see what was going on and after about another 30 minutes I called back the front desk and they said that it was weird because they didn't hear any thing when they

Nice hotel stay Here for four nights. We had a one bedroom suite. Two queen beds and Pull-out Double bed. Staff are very friendly And the breakfast was excellent. Great location For Visiting attractions

Summary Heading: Worst Hyatt House I have ever experienced
Summary: I was visiting a client when I drove by this Hyatt property and thought I would give them a try instead of the Courtyard Marriott in Buena Park where I was booked.  I asked if they had rooms available and they did.  They wanted $133 a night for a non-suite room which for one night, I figured was OK.  When I went up to my room I was surprised that "Non-Suite" meant a very tiny room and a bed.  No microwave, no fridge, no nothing.  It did have a bulletin board on the wall.  As a matter of fact, it reminded me of a college dorm room.  Very small with ratty carpet and a ratty worn set of dresser drawers.  I was so disappointed with the room that I went back downstairs and handed the key back and said "thanks, but no thanks" and I explained why.  I was surprised that they did not

Pros: great location, minutes to most places in OC, like Huntington Beach, Disney, Little Saigon, etc. Fast and reliable Internet, everything is clean and well organized. Hot breakfast is definitely very popular and is very good food too. Cons: pool is a little small.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for our visit to Disneyland
Summary: We recently stayed here for 4 nights when we took our 2 kids to Disneyland. Check in was easy and friendly thanks to Yohanna (sorry if I spelled that wrong). She was helpful and very courteous. The hotel was clean and easily accessible, liked being able to park near the back to use an entrance closest to our room. The room was fine, we were able to get a room with a full kitchen which is great with kids. It was well appointed, spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was not great, my chief complaint about the room. And room service didn't pay any attention to the bathroom, either. Sound travels right through the walls and doors, so the kids had some trouble sleeping on the pull-out sofa in the living area due to really loud, rude guests in the hallway, good thing I had packed

Summary Heading: Very nice and close to Long Beach
Summary: I always enjoy staying at this hotel. Right next to several restaurants and easy to get to. Will shuttle you to and from Long Beach airport free of charge. Only complaint I have is the TV's both times I stayed have had poor reception. Great breakfast, nice rooms. Bathrooms are average.

The breakfast was great. There is a large variety of food: eggs, bacon, french toast, cereal, granola, bagels, etc. The walls in the room are a little thin. Next to me was a family with really whiney kids who wouldn't shut up. The parents couldn't control them. That is my only complaint. Besides that the hotel is clean, reasonably priced, and I would stay there again.

This hotel is an average hotel stay for a night stay or average tourist expense. The pool, staff, food, and room are of average quality. It is recommended for a stay without the luxury of a upper Hyatt hotel. So do not expect too much from this hotel.

We chose this location because I really enjoy all the Hyatt locations.  I was at first concerned of staying at this location because of the reviews that I read on this website.  I thought we were staying at a run down hotel.  However it was very clean and the room was comfortable.  Yes the appliances in the kitchen requires updating but they have been rarely used.  The bathroom could use an update but it was clean.  The food is definitely great!!!  Better than the food at Disneyland.  There are many shops and restaurants around this hotel.   The staff were very friendly.  We were closer to Disneyland than I thought...It took us 10mins to drive to Disneyland.  If we were to return to Disneyland in the future I would stay at this hotel again.

Bed was comfortable.  Desk/vanity did not have chair nor did the patio, even my 3 year old asked what happened to the chairs.  Unlike what even their in room booklet said our suite did not have full size fridge and associated appliances,  it had a mini fridge in spot where dishwasher should be and open spot where fridge should be.  Breakfast was also good but yet again not enough seating for the volume of people using the space.  Gym small and also with a broken elliptical.

Hotel was OK and rooms are suites. Great for families.  While TV in living room was good size, bedroom tv could not be smaller and stand took up valuable room space. Convenient if doing business in the area. Otherwise, it's 4 miles via surface street from 405 Freeway.

We stayed here for my daughter's high school track meet in the area then took the kids to Disneyland the next day.  I knew it wasn't in the Disney neighborhood, but didn't mind the ~10 minute drive (it's a quick drive using non-busy main streets).  This hotel was very convenient for our family.  We had a lot of drinks from our road trip and were able to put all of them in the mini frig.  The microwave also came in handy for heating up leftovers.  It was nice to be able to take a nap after the long drive and close the door to our room and leave the teen and smaller kids in the "living room" to hang out, watch tv and snack while we recharged for Disneyland. The entire room is very spacious.  Only weird thing was the bathroom set-up, you have to go through the bedroom to get to it,

Summary Heading: Location was very poor for Disneyland, but a roomy, typical Hyatt House
Summary: We very likely would stay at a Hyatt House, again, as we love the Hyatt loyalty program, but only stayed there because the Hyatt next to Disneyland (which is fantastic for families) was full.  Staff was super nice, and it is all-suite, which is good for a family of four. Full size beds, instead of queen, and the pull-out couch is un-sleep-able.  Very clean, and housekeeping was thorough and responsible.  The breakfast, while better than most hotels that include it, was whisked up on the dot of the closing hour. So, if you are on a trip for pleasure, and wish to sleep in, do not wait until the edge of breakfast hours to come down.

Just a quick review.... This hotel is good for a family. Having a kitchen is great. Bathroom a little outdated. The breakfast in the morning is fabulous! The staff are nice and helpful. Pool area nice- Pool on the cold side. Disneyland an easy drive. About 15-20 min away. Lots of food and stores around. I suggest getting a room on ground floor looking out to courtyard. I would book our room again #129. For the price and a basic place to lay your head its a great spot. Happy Traveling!

Me and my friend stay here for a night and I'm very impressed with what we have got with just USD127 a night.  Good:   It's all suite hotel and it's big.  Proper living room and bedroom...comfortable bed too.  It's included BBF but I didn't try.  The location is quite good if you have biz around the area.  The staff is really really friendly and helpful.  Bad:  The room is bid dark and run down...with that price in LA, I'll take it!  Ugly:    Couldn't think of anything...  I'll definitely recommend budget biz traveler or family w children for Disneyland vacation to stay in hotel.

Stayed here for business in Downey.  Convenient to 680 (couple of miles) and thhe 405.  Lots of restaurants within a few mile radius.  Also close enough to riun to Disney for a quick visit.  Lobby is clean and staff is pleasant.  Large variety at breakjfast.  rooms are large and clean.  Parking is ample and there are several doors in which is convenient.  I plan to stay again.

I stayed here with family, we got two separate rooms as we went to Disneyland 3 days in a row for Xmas 2012. OMG I was super impressed with the rooms and at how REMARKABLE CLEAN the rooms were!! The Secret MAYBE that its a corporate hotel, less family...but to be able to walk on the carpet with socks and have those socks stay clean and not dirty wins big time in my book!!!   The beds and sofa sleeper were comfy!! Showers hot and spacious!! The property clean!! The employees FRIENDLY!!!   BREAKFAST WAS DELISH!!!! OMG!! STAY HERE!! YOU WON'T REGRET IT!!!

We loved this hotel!  We had just spent a week in a small hotel in San Diego and we were really excited to spread out at the Hyatt house!  It was comfortable and quiet.  The breakfast was great and very fresh.  They were really good at keeping the food stocked up even though it was busy.  It was close to the parks and very convenient.  The parking wasn't ever a problem even when we came back late from the parks.  We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

According to some of the other clients who apparently stay here regularly, every floor has one "businessman's special" room in each hallway.  These are rooms -- about 12 X 12 -- with a bed, chair, and dresser -- but a full-sized bathroom and wardrobe.  There's no kitchenette and no dining area.  Okay, I scored one from Hotwire at a very reasonable rate for a six-day stay.  The bedding and chair were comfortable, and the room even had a balcony.    I had a great stay -- except for one thing.  My room had a connecting door to the next room.  And I kept catching Disneyland-age kids unlocking the connecting door and trying to enter my room, out of curiousity.  It's okay -- I scared them worse than they scared me.  And I took pictures of it, but I'm deliberately leaving them out of

I have done several reviews on Trip Advisor and I must admit I struggled on this one. I eventually gave it an Average rating but my expectations for a Hyatt House were definitely not met.  The lobby area, breakfast area are nice. However, as other reviewers have pointed out the hotel definitely needs updating. We got a room along the back side of the property and the elevators and carpet looked really worn and dirty. Even my daughter commented on it. The elevators were old.  The rooms themselves were fine. They had flat screen TVs and plenty of room. Kitchen appliances need an update. We were surprised that there was no dishwasher. Break fast was good.  We also used the laundry on the 2nd floor and the staff at the front desk was courteous and helped us buy the suppliers and the

What a surprise. We really discovered a hidden gem. This hotel really made our holiday. The room or rather suite was fantastic. Huge bed and so much space. The kitchen although not the most modern was well equiped and the rest of the suite was just perfect. Breakfast was included and even with the hotel being close to Disneyland and very busy we never had a shortage of anything. If you want a perfect place to stay in Cypress/Anaheim this is it.

We stayed 7 days from 12/24-12/31, Found the hotel very comfortable and clean.Breakfast was good.Staff was very friendly and helpful.Disneyland was about 7 miles away -perfect if you have a rental car! Plenty of take out food options around. hot tub was nice after a long day at disney. We had 4 adults and 2 children,would recommend a second room if you have this many,the double beds a little small for 2 adults. The laundry faucilities need updating,had to duck tape dryer closed .Otherwise no complaints.

This place would be fabulous had we gotten what was confirmed for us! King Suite with "Fully equipped kitchen" is not what you get unless you "stay 4 nights or more" or "request it in advance", regardless of what you reserved or what your confirmation says! The mini fridge was no where near capable of storing the food I had purchased in advance of arriving to feed two teenage boys....so much for saving money on eating out! There are only 2 (yes, two!) DVD players for the entire place (over 120 rooms)...those need to be requested in advance as well. If a small microwave and a mini fridge in my King Suite was what I reserved and  expected, this would be a great couple of days.. and the staff is less then sympathetic. Be forewarned, be sure what you are getting when making your

We needed a hotel close to relatives and this one caught our eye because it's an all non-smoking hotel which is what we prefer.  Also, the rooms are large; there was a bedroom as well as a living room.  There was also a good size kitchen had we needed one.  The hotel provided a good size breakfast which the attentive staff worked very hard to keep filled.  We were a bit disappointed that we had a shower curtain that had mold on it (gross); a first for us.  It makes one question the cleanliness of the rest of the room.  The carpet was in great need of a cleaning (spots, etc.).  Also, my husband had to fix the non-flushing toilet at 10:30 at night which wasn't what we look for in a hotel.  They would have moved us to another room but it was already pretty late.  It would have been

Summary Heading: Disneyland - comfortable stay, but needs some updating!
Summary: We chose to stay at this hotel because of the name.  We've stayed at multiple Hyatt hotel chains and none of them have never disappointed.  It looks like this one was only half way renovated.  The beds and decor have been updated, but the kitchen appliances and bathroom fixtures (from the late 80's early 90's) have not.  The furniture, although updated, looks very worn down.  We didn't even use the kitchen, so it didn't bother us too much.  The hotel is about 5 miles (15 minutes) away from Disneyland.  Plus another 20 minutes to park and ride the tram to the entrance of Disneyland. We also chose this hotel because of the value and no charge for parking.  All the hotels near Disney charge for parking now.  If you're traveling with a group and only one car, this place is too far.

Summary Heading: Had a nice stay for a few days during Thanksgiving!
Summary: My husband booked this hotel for the name and because it had a kitchen!!!! During our visits a kitchen is becoming more important due to the cost of eating out all the time. I read some of the reviews and were kinda fearfull of what to expect. The hotel is older maybe lat 80's I am guessing. The room were partially updated, bathroom was not. It was clean but really needs a new shower head, tile and lose the wallpaper. The room was furnished except for the bathroom. So far we have been to many places that don't put 4  sets of towells in the room? Why? Oh well they came the first day but had to call the next day. I went down to the front desk and we got 6 sets!!. The bed was wonderful kingsize and comfortable for me and my hubby!!! The pull out sofa needs to be thrown out. The

We found Hyatt House Cypress was a great place to stay.  The front desk staff were extremely helpful and friendly - nothing was too much trouble.  All other staff encountered were similarly friendly.    The room was clean, a great size and had everything we needed. The pool and hot tub were a great place to relax after a long day.  The hotel's location was great too, close to the Disney parks and with easy access to freeways to other areas of the city.  The area also had lots of choices for shopping and eating.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will be using this hotel again if we return to LA in the future.

Summary Heading: In need of a desperate makeover/renovation!
Summary: We arrived at this hotel and the staff at the desk were friendly.  We proceeded to our room and got out of the lift and no biggie but the signage is not good, so be prepared to locate your room.  The lifts are so old probably built in the 80's.  Got to the room and it is quite small although we had a king size bed.  A bit outdated but it was still clean.  We could not believe there was no fridge as we wanted to store some items in there.  Contacted the desk and they said for a fridge it would be abt an extra $30.00 per night.  Considering we were staying 3 nights I didn't believe it was a worthwhile investment to keep things cool.  The hotel did state if we put our names on items that they would put it in a fridge located in the lobby.  There was no ice machine you need to go

The reason my family and I chose the Hyatt House in Cypress, CA is because we had stayed at a Hyatt Hotel in Nashville, TN a few years ago and it was a superb experience. We were expecting consistency but this was not what we experienced. The positive parts of our stay included the complimentary breakfast and layout design of our room (kitchenette and living area). The first thing we noticed upon arrival was the lack of signage indicating how to locate our room, fitness center, pool, lobby, etc. It is unusual for a hotel not to have signage to help guests navigate themselves about the hotel. Our room did not have a safe to keep our valuables so I called the front desk and was told that it would be looked into and I would be notified. I never heard back about the safe. The small

Summary Heading: Great staff, comfortable rooms, super breakfast
Summary: I had a convention to go to at the Anaheim Convention center and this looked like a good place to stay.  It was only 15 minutes away from the convention and convenient to all of the major highways in OC.  I checked in very late at night...the clerk at the front desk was efficient, prompt and extremely courteous in getting me to my room.  I was really impressed with how big the room was and the amount of space to spread out.  The room was very clean, the aircon was great and the internet work perfectly.  The only complaint was the lighting.  I think they had these motion sensor lights or something...it was confusing to use and a bit of a hassle, but not a huge issue.  I was really blown away by the breakfast.  I've stayed at a lot of Hyatt Houses...the breakfast is the same

Summary Heading: Nice stay, but rooms need major renovation.
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for one night. I was with my husband and two kids, ages 3 1/2 yrs. and 15 months. This is a great hotel for families because the room came with a kitchen plus free breakfast! I also loved the fact that parking was free. We stayed here after a day at Disneyland, which is just a shirt 15 minute drive from hotel. And i thought the rate for the room was pretty good. Now the cons: 1)the carpet had many stains in it. There were even 2 burn spots near the bar stools/counter top area about the size of a donut each. 2)The kitchen appliances can definitely use some updating. 3)The bathroom sink had some permanent stains that looked like blood. 4)The bathtub/toilet area needs major renovation. The tiles on the floor were cracked, the grout all over was brown. The

Summary Heading: If you have a car, planning to stay couple days in LA, planing to cook your own food, planning to not to pay for parking and wil
Summary: This place had one if the best breakfast provider hotel I have ever been. Free parking place. Very clean rooms and kitchen area. Quite.  This place has even a good size pool and hot tub.  If you are with your family and planing to stay nice place with cooking facilities, this place is really good.

Summary Heading: Some nice touches. Should be better when if renovations will fix the hot water controls
Summary: Hyatt bought up this former Woodfin Suites and has completed the initial re-branding to turn it into a Hyatt House. As a former Woodfin property, the room configuration is different from other Hyatt Houses which were part of the Summerfield Suites chain. However, there's the familiar Hyatt Grand beds and other nice Hyatt touches like the 24-hour fitness center, Portico toiletries, Aquafresh toothpaste and Wall Street Journals in addition to USA Today. There's also standard extended stay amenities like free American breakfast, sofa-beds, kitchens and free wifi and clean, comfortable rooms.   We enjoyed several nice touches that made this property stand out:  -- Breakfast includes Japanese items (miso soup, rice, umeboshi, etc) because the hotel is right round the corner from

Stayed over Labor Day weekend and found it to be exactly what I was looking for - small kitchenette - toaster, sink, microwave, and refrigerator, and a little counter-top that wasn't reserved as part of the bathroom sink, but stand alone.  It's less than 10 minutes from Anaheim, and easily accessible to the highways.  Free hot breakfast, and as a vegetarian, I was able to find enough to keep me full :)  Also was able to get ice for the cooler as well.  Found the room very clean and safe.  Plenty of parking around the building.  I would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Another excellent stay at the hyatt house
Summary: Stayed here with my wife and son from 19th July to 23rd July  Thiis was our second time here(See my review August 2009 and Photographs) I booked quite a long time in advance directly through the Hotel. Alex took my booking and I mentioned to him that I would like the same pool view room He said He would do his best. When we arrived the same room was waiting for us. Full marks Alex you were great . This place was perfect for our needs. nice and peaceful. The pool was never crowded. The lines for breakfast were not too long, It was a pleasure to take our food outsidfe in the Garden or by the Pool. The 2 Bed room with full Kitchen was great. We hired a car, and from the Hotel all the attractions of Socal were within easy reach eg. Disney, The Beaches of Newport and Huntington  and

Nicely decorated and clean.  The overnight stay was quiet, no problems of any kind.  Area looks newer with Chilis and Wendy's at the corner.  Majority of this area was business buildings, but very clean and safe feeling. I would feel very comfortable booking this hotel in the future.

The following is a very detailed review of the Hyatt Hotel in Cypress.  Our party had two rooms we purchased through Hotwire – Room #348 and Room #351 and stayed two nights at the property.  The exterior of the hotel is gorgeous, and the landscaping is well manicured.  There is ample parking and there are 5 card key entrances to the hotel which makes it convenient for guests.  The hotel has a courtyard area which is nice, and the pool and spa is on one side – not in the center of the courtyard.  Our rooms were regular rooms and not kitchen suites.  Room #348 had a very small balcony facing the parking and a desk/bureau combo, where as our room (facing the courtyard) did not have a balcony.  The regular rooms are very small, and there is a locked closed that seems to serve as the

Summary Heading: great place would stay there again
Summary: My children and I spent 5 nights at the Cypress Hampton Inn. My daughter uses a wheelchair and  the room was very spacious and the bathroom had a sturdy shower bench. No complaints at all. The place was clean, the staff friendly, the area safe. I'd definitely stay there again.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night after a trip to Disneyland. We booked the hotel through hotwire so it was really cheap, less than £50 for the night. We arrived quite late so didn't spend much time in the hotel. The bed was humongous and the bathroom was well equipped with toothpaste, shampoo, body lotion and a sunglasses case! They call the rooms a suite, but it was only a room and wasn't that big, but that didn't matter to us! Breakfast was nice with a good selection of hot food, cereal, pancakes, fruit etc. We would certainly stay here again if we were in the area and would recommend it as a great place to stay for resting your head after a day out and about!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but pay extra for an upgrade
Summary: I reserved this hotel on line through a third party I use heavily. It is a nice hotel that is a mix of large suite like rooms and adjoining sleeping rooms. With the average price I paid I was given a king size bed in a bedroom. While it was nice it was also small with no work desk, fridge or microwave that comes with the other style rooms. If you make a reservation here I would suggest upgrading to the larger rooms. The breakfast was very nice with hot and cold items served in a comfortable community room with attached patio. I seemed that most of the guests were business travelers such as myself.

We stayed here last July as it was being converted & I swore I would never be back. This trip, we needed to stay somewhere for one night before moving closer to Disneyland so we're back. This time it was MUCH BETTER. The room we were in was a little different (it had a small kitchenette instead of a full kitchen). We chose a king bed with a sofa hide-a-bed- in the living room area. Nice linens, kitchen table a plus, microwave, mini-fridge, coffee pot. NO OUTLETS though, so I travel with my own power strip to fix that problem. Breakfast was big with eggs, sausage, pancakes, fruit, juices, coffee. We might try it again.

Short story first. My teenage daughter was starting to complain about flying on vacation. I had to nip this in the bud because driving to vacation destinations was getting old fast. I made a deal that if I drove two days to Orlando last year she could pick where we went this year but we had to fly. She chose Disneyland and Hollywood so off we went this year. Thank goodness flying was no problem and I think that issue is behind us. Now for the hotel. I traded Hyatt points for six nights in a suite and this was a great place to stay and operate from. The location was perfect for us. It was 10-15 minutes from Disneyland and about 45-50 minutes to Grauman's Chinese Theater and Hollywood Blvd.  The staff was very nice. The name was changed to Hyatt House but I think that was all they

We got a great deal on this hotel through Hotwire. It was about a 10-15 minute drive to Disneyland, but unless you're going to pony up the bucks to stay right by the park, what's a 5 min drive vs. a 15 min drive. It's now called the Hyatt House, by the way.  Pros: Free, good, hot continental breakfast Comfy bed Good size room and bathroom Fairly convenient to expressways Pleasant staff  Cons: Blackout curtain didn't quite close right; had to use the icebox to seal out the light Pillows were way too fluffy Older (i.e., non hi-def) TV [This is b/c we stayed in a non-suite room. All suite rooms apparently have a HDTV.]

Summary Heading: nice place, good value, but watch out!
Summary: we stayed overnight during our trip from san francisco to san diego.  The staff was very friendly. Because we booked with priceline we didn't get a suite, but a room on the 3rd floor at the back of the hotel. The room was not big, but for 1 night it suited very well. a nice balcony and a lounge seat. The decor is clean and recently redecorated.  The wifi is great and complimentary! also the breakfast is complimentary but during weekends quite busy (too busy for me). 1 very big negative is that there are airco units on the roof and on the 3rd floor the sounds isolation isn't very good. So during the night you hear the airco unit very loudly! So be carefull not to take a room on the 3rd floor at the back!

My only bad thing to say about this hotel is that it is dated.  I was told that they are going to spend some money on this hotel in the coming year. I have stayed at the Hyatt house at Denver Airport and this does not even compare, because the Denver location was brand new and felt like a Hyatt.  It does need renovation in the rooms as the room is layer out odd and plugs are are to find.  The bed and linens were great, I think this is something they have updated. The staff at check in and when I went to get something to eat was one of the friendliest I have seen.  The grounds look great and it's in a very quiet neighborhood.  I think this hotel will only get better as Hyatt continues to improve this property.

Very good job providing service and support for a weekend traveler.  Staff was very accommodating picking me up at the airport after the flight was late.  Great support setting me up with a cab to take  me to the Long Beach Grand Prix.  Nick was very reasonably priced and friendly.  Good full complimentary breakfast.  The hotel is located in a quiet and nice community  within walking distance of some places to grab a casual meal.  Overall great stay, I would recommend to everyone visiting the greater Long Beach area.

This hotel is nice.  Pretty quiet.  The only negatives we found were that there is no "business center".  There is just one computer available for guest use and it is in the middle of a hall.  That one computer was VERY slow.  Would be nice to have more computers in a quiet area.  Also the breakfast was very good but got very crowded with no place to sit if you weren't in there by 8 a.m.  There only seemed to be a couple of people working and they worked very hard but couldn't seem to keep up with the food, cleaning tables, etc.  The workout room isn't much, doesn't have much equipment.  The location is good.  Very convenient to everything.  The staff were all very nice and very helpful if we had any questions.  We had a room with a full kitchen and didn't have to ask for it or

Booked the hotel through hotwire. I understand that when we do that we don't usually get a choice of the room. Spoke to Travis the manager to see if we can have a room with a microwave since we were traveling with a baby and needed to heat the milk and he said that we would have to pay $30 a night extra for this or don't stay here go somewhere else. I HAVE STAYED AT BESTWESTERNS AND DOUBLETREE HOTELS THAT HAVE ACCOMMODATED ME BETTER. I have stayed at many hyatts and booked a number of times through hotwire and have never had an experience like this.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, friendly staff, quiet neighborhood
Summary: I was there for a convention in Anaheim, which is about 6-7 miles away, but the hotel is good. Nice amentities, great breakfast but get there early if you want it to be a liitle quieter. my only grips would be limited TV channel selection and work out equipment needs to be updated. Fed Ex Kinkos across the street was a life saver also.

Nice, comfortable room and bed. Had to pay to upgrade to the room I thought I was getting in the first place. If you are hoping for a room with a full kitchen or at least a fridge and microwave, call the hotel. We were assigned to a room with neither. Thought when it said "Suites" in the name we'd be getting a suite. Super friendly staff. Better than average continental breakfast with all the usual fare and some ethnic choices too. Free parking, breakfast and WIFI. Parking is quite tight around the hotel. Not enough places if the hotel is full. We found this out by coming back from Disneyland after midnight. Ended up parking in a lot across the street, Good, safe area with  several fast food places and a Chilis within walking distance. We liked that it is not located on a loud,

We only stayed one night so we did not use most of the ammenitites.  The room was nice and clean.  We booked through priceline so we just got a basic room and it was a little small but worked for us.  Parking was easy, check in was easy, staff was friendly.  The pool looked nice and it did say there was free wifi and a 24 hour gym.  The free breakfast was very good and a large selection of items.  I would recommend the Hyatt House.  Its located in a business district area.  But there is a main road that you can walk to with some places to eat and shop if needed.  No hidden fees were we charged (not that I know of yet).  Like resort fees, parking fees etc.  Which seems to be the norm lately.  We got a great rate from priceline and were very happy with our stay.

Summary Heading: Great staff really makes the place.
Summary: During our visit, the front desk staff was terrific.  The usual Hyatt Summerfield Suites, good rooms, pretty clean, decent breakfast (free) and reasonably safe.  But the front desk service was attentive and worked to make sure our stay was good.  In this day and age of indifference, it was nice to see someone working hard to deliver superior service.

The Hyatt brand name is one that comes with certain expectations and this hotel certainly did not meet them. The decor looks tacky and cheap. The lobby is far from welcoming. We had just come from Vegas where we stayed in a beautiful one bedroom Hilton suite for less the price, so maybe I was a little let down upon arrival. The perks were that it was close to Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm, the free breakfast is decent and there is a Chilis next door. Other than that, our 1 br suite was just average. The kitchen looks ancient-- the fridge, microwave and stove are old and the cabinets look like they had some paint slapped on them to look new again. Bottom line is it looks like they had some very cheap renovations done. Also, we had requested a non-smoking room and when we
I never sleep well for the first couple nights in hotels. I had an easier time here due to a quiet room and comfortable bed. I will go back if I am in Anaheim again.

We stay at the Hyatt Suites frequently, because our granddaughter lives nearby.  When it was the Woodfin, we knew we could count on the little extras that made us choose this hotel every time.  Now that it’s become a Hyatt, we see these little things beginning to disappear.   Our two grown children travelled with us.  We need three beds because they (boy and girl) obviously don’t want to share a bed.  The Woodfin always offered a comfortable rollaway, so all we needed was a one bedroom suite.  The Hyatt no longer offers a rollaway. This meant we needed two rooms this time, at a much greater expense.  Cutbacks are evident in the breakfast room.  There is a reduction in the breakfast buffet, including removal of the waffle maker, which is always a hit with children.  The breakfast

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay on business
Summary: Very friendly and the suites are nice.  If you want a quiet atmosphere, this hotel has it.

Summary Heading: Much improved over the last 6 or so months
Summary: I gave this hotel a 2-star review about 6 months ago because it did not meet the typical Hyatt standards.  My work kept taking me to the area, not really my choice but it's the only Hyatt near OC that doesn't always sell out (probably for a good reason).  I am glad to report things are getting much better.  1) staff are all very nice, polite and talkative - definitely getting that Hyatt touch 2) they recognize my Diamond status and provides free room upgrade without asking 3) bath amenity are now standard Portico spread with toothpaste and I have seen some tile replacement in the bathroom, so things are getting "cleaner" 4) breakfast still remain very strong and highlight of the stay  The remaining weak items: 1) still no free social hours, still charge 50% - go figure 2) some

We host an event in town every year requiring multiple rooms.  The normal place we stayed was booked so we stayed here.  I must say, I wish I knew of this place before!  We got a better rate, a better room and better amenities.  Nice size rooms, comfortable beds and a complete kitchenette.  We will be back next year and every year after.

The good, the bad and the ugly...First, I booked and prepaid our room on their website.  When I received the emailed confirmation, a few minutes later, I noticed they had us booked in a 1 bedroom apt with a king instead of the 1 bedroom w/two doubles I requested.  I called the 800 # on the website and explained what happened and requested the change to the doubles.  The operator was efficient, professional and I received a corrected email confirmation within 5 minutes. No hassle nor fuss.  I was traveling with my two adult children (opposite genders), my husband and my 9 mos old grandson.  My grandson and I have very strict dietary needs which required us to bring food prepared at home. These detailes are important for the remainder of the story.  I choose this Hyatt location

I stayed here for a few days a met several interesting people. The beds were excellent. There was free breakfast every morning and a full bar and restaurant at night.  The rooms were great. The location was near the 22, 405 and the location made it very easy to get to my appointments.  The front desk, bartenders and servers were great.  Everyone was very cordial and friendly.

Summary Heading: Now a Hyatt Summerfield.  Great place to base your OC adventure.
Summary: We normally stayed at the La Quinta just a few miles away when we visit this area, but that hotel was getting a bit rundown, so we decided to try this one.  We were very pleased with our decision.  PROS:  LOCATION:  Perfect.  It's in a very quiet neighborhood, yet, just off of a main street, so it's easy to get to your destinations.  It's also a short drive to all the sights in the area (Knotts, Disneyland, etc.).  Lots of eateries, shops and stores close by as well.  The exterior of the building can use a bit of a sprucing up, but the landscaping is just fine.  Lots of trees and foliage surround the place, so you don't feel like you're in the middle of a big city.  ROOMS:  Huge.  I believe they are all suites.  We had a one bedroom suite with a complete kitchen.  The living

At this property now and I am plesantly suprised. New carpet,some new furniture,New paint and paper.new flat screen TV's(reception is not the greatest)and brand new beds.   Staff could not have been nicer.Upgraded me to a suite and offered amenity points without my having to ask.Everything in the public areas are new-and sparkilng clean. WiFi is free and fast.  Bath products are Portico White Ginger.  Very pleased with this property.  Now if there was only something to do around here

I took off a star because, and your experience may differ, the hallway smelled bad...some inconsiderate numbskull brought in some really stinky food.    But, again, this may have been a mere temporary setback.  The rooms here are BIG, comfortable, and clean.  Check-in was a breeze.  The TV situation was a bit bizarre, as one was a modern flat screen and the other was an old tube-type set.  But we weren't there to watch TV, we just needed a place to hang out and sleep for a night.  This hotel more than exceeded our meager need for slumber.  Every room comes with a fridge and microwave...great if you've got leftovers (hopefully not stinky leftovers) from one of the nearby restaurants.
