The location is pretty good...not too far from Disneyland and there are several restaurants

I've stayed here three times now and will continue to return. Easily the best value in the Cypress area. Good location with many places to eat within walking distance. Very good hot breakfast with fresh fruit. Large comfortable suites with full kitchens available in many of them. The only thing that kept me from giving a perfect score is that some of the fixtures (particularly bathroom) are getting a bit dated and the carpets are pretty worn. NOTE: This hotel is now a Hyatt brand "Summerfield Suites".

I have stayed there many times. It is truly the best secret in town!! The rooms are above and beyond what you think youll get, the buffet breakfast is suprisingly awesome! A very conveinent location close to attractions business and beaches. I wish I could live there full time.

Room was perfect for our family stay. The bed and pull out sofa was very comfortable, the room was nice size and immaculate. The breakfast that was included was above average and opened up to a relaxing courtyard. The kitchen in the room was very great too when we came back with take out and had the dishes, silverware and glasses..and full size fridge too.

Summary Heading: Waste of Money for a Hyatt Summerfield Suites Hotel
Summary: We stayed in room 314 on 7/21-7/23 for $114/night after spending 7 nights at the Hyatt Regency in Anaheim (paid $98/night). I had read this hotel was undergoing a transition from a Woodfin Hotel to Hyatt Summerfield Suites, but in no way would you know this was a Hyatt, except for the Portico shampoos. First, they tried to charge me $144/night instead of my confirmed $114/night. I had the email to prove it. Second, the sticky dirt on the exterior hotel door was astonishing. The entire facility is old...outdated Hotpoint appliances, wood facade microwave, door hinged are busted or not working properly so the cupboards won't close or hang crooked, TV's unusually small for the size of the room. The thing that REALLY irritated me was the safe situation. I needed to lock up my ipad

This hotel is fairly close to both Disneyland and Knott's for those who wish to go to these places, And they have a shuttle to/from Disneyland. We stayed here for a family wedding. Stayed with my 2 teens and it was suitable for all. Breakfast was amazing!  The pool is the BEST I've seen in a hotel--very warm and comfortable. The room rate was very affordable considering what you get for the price. I am an Orange Co. native living in WA state. We will be staying here from now on every summer when we go to visit family!

Summary Heading: CLEAN, QUIET and a GREAT HOTEL!!!!!
Summary: Now the HYATT SUMMERFIELD SUITES: I am the PICKIEST guest when to comes to hotels. Kind of a germophobe. This one was exceptional! Quiet and CLEAN!!! I would even go as far as saying the carpet was clean enough to sleep on and it did not feel icky to walk barefoot. Some hotels are iffy where that is concerned. We had originally reserved a 1 bdrm suite which has full kitchen (normal size frig and stove!), a living room area in which the couch folds to a queen bed and a flat screen for Friday/Saturday night stay. It was only 109.00 (99.00 a nt. if we got a king instead of 2 doubles) a night! We got a courtyard view not an parking lot view on the 3rd floor. A balcony overlooking the courtyard area with a soothing sounding fountain and pool area. The bedroom had 2 double beds, very

Summary Heading: Very poor hotel, not worthy of the Hyatt name
Summary: I booked this hotel after the name change to Hyatt Summerfield Suites not knowing it was a Woofin being rebranded.  I was excited to see a new Hyatt property in the area but was quickly disappointed by the vast shortcomings of this hotel.  I am surprised to see so many positive reviews, surely those folks must have been staying in crappy hotels to think this place is worthy of 4 or 5 stars, or that Woofin has really slow standards.  I can't compare this to other Woofins but this place is DEFINITELY NOT up to the Hyatt standard and not worthy of the price of the Hyatt Summerfield brand.  Here are my issues: 1) Complementary Socal Hour is NOT honored at this hotel - It is a common feature for all Hyatt Summerfield brand.  It's basically a free light meal with drinks (soft drinks,

We stayed at the Woodfin Suites and could not have asked for a better place. We needed a room that had extra space and beds and this place was almost perfect! We got the 1 bedroom with two double beds and the sofa couch extended to a bed as well. Full kitchen comes with almost everything you may need for basic nessicities, along with a dish washer! The front desk staff were all very friendly and our rooms were always nice and cleaned when returning at night. The breakfast was wonderful and offered many options from eggs, sausage and other hot dishes to a variety of fruit. The make your own waffles was an awesome plus! Rooms were comfortable although it got rather muggy when the showers were going but since the weather was nice, we opened the sliding glass door in the living room

I have traveled around the world and have experienced destination resorts and small bed and breakfast accommodations.  From the large corporate to the small personal rooms, and I have to say that the Woodfin at Cypress is one of the nicest accommodations that I have been to.  I stay at the Woodfin 3 to 4 times a month and the consistency with both the staff and accommodations never varies.  They are always pleasant and the rooms immaculately clean.   The breakfast, which is included, has many cultural choices to please any palate.  Travis, who is the General Manager, is a wealth of information regarding the area and has always been helpful in making my stay a pleasant one.

I have read  the few poor reviews below and it seems these guest were under the impression that Woodfin should be comparable to the Ritz Carlton ($400+ per night) or The Grand Wailea in Maui ($600+++ per night). It is not. However, it a great place to stay for business or for that family trip to Disneyland for around $120 per night for a suite and they provide breakfast. Would I recommend it to family and friends, YOU BET!  This is a fairly new facility in a quiet location with great access to all that is Orange County. Woodfin is a hidden gem and while you will find the price average, the rooms, service and staff are not.   If you are looking for a great hotel that offers modern quality accommodations for a valued price, this is it.

I wanted to share my experience in this hotel, It was clean and comfortable. We are having mini visit to Knotts berry farm and Adventure city.  I was amazed by this hotel because it was clean and I have two toddlers they love to run around. This hotel suites are great with family with children.  The free breakfast buffet are fantastic!! I will go back and stay in this hotel again. Disneyland and Knottsberry farm are really close by. =)  But make sure you get the second floor room if you want to have really quiet night. downstair they have bar at night so it's kinda noisy at night.
Manager Response: Thank you for response regarding your past stay at the Woodfin Hotel in Cypress. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed the cleanliness and size of our suites. Having complimentary breakfast is always a great amenity for our guests that are on vacation. We are conveniently located close enough to Disneyland and Knott’s Berry Farm but at a distance so that you do not have to deal with theme park traffic and congestion. Thank you again for taking the time to respond on your recent stay at the Woodfin.  Maribel Munoz- Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Pretty decent for the price, but some room for improvement
Summary: I stayed for three nights on business. Being that this is part of a smaller chain I was not super familiar with, I had some slight reservations about it, but it turned out to be OK.  Pros: - King suite room was very spacious  - Newer updated plasma TV's - Hotel was generally quiet. I had a first floor room near a side entrance and directly across from the fitness room, yet the noise outside my room seemed minimal. Also, even though my room was directly level with the parking lot I didn't have a noise issue, and I am a light sleeper. I do think the AC helped create some white noise that helped, but all in all it seemed like a lot of business travelers and a quiet crowd. - Room seemed clean - Front desk associates were professional and pleasant - Location is in an area that isn't

We felt completely safe and welcome and thought that the property looked like a nice hotel geared towards business customers, but as a family it worked very well for us.  We stayed here during our trip to Disneyland and found the location to be close enough and there were a lot of restaurants and stores in the area for necessities.  The breakfast was good and the staff at reception were very nice too.   I would stay here again for sure.

Had a great weekend.  Not only did we visit Mickey near by but relaxed at a nice hotel.  Had small kids and the Suite worked out great.  We had enough room where we didn't fell like we were on top of each other.  It was clean and breakfast was great.  Near by resturants and fast food made things easy too.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review on your recent stay at the Woodfin Hotel in Cypress. Our spacious suites are ideal for guests like you traveling with families. Our location and various nearby restaurants are a big advantage with guests traveling with out cars or for just a quick bite to eat. Thank you again for choosing to stay with us and look forward to seeing you in the future. -Maribel Munoz- Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect for Extended Stay with Kids!
Summary: We live in Cypress but we're having work done on our home so we needed a place to stay for 5 nights that provided the amenities of home.  I am so glad we chose this hotel!  We had a sutie with 2 double beds and the sofa pulled out into a bed, which was perfect. Our internet was excellent as we used our laptop and my daughter used her Ipod Touch.  The morning breakfast buffet was excellent and served different food each day.  The room was very clean and quiet and the staff was excellent!  We had a great experience and I just found out they have a property in San Diego, which I will use when we take our trip  to Sea World. I HIGHLY recommend this hotelto anyone staying in the Cypress/Los Alamitos area.

Summary Heading: Great value. Good location and rooms.
Summary: This was our first stay here and planned a Disney day and Hollywood tour day for 4 adults and 3 kids. We were pleasantly surprised at the great location this was located - nice, quiet and close to several other amenities.  The suites were clean and spacious(we had 2 bedrooms - 1 with 2 queens the other had 1 king, each with their own bathroom - center room was the living area with pullout sofa and kitchen), we noticed a dripping sound from one of the AC units and it was fixed immediately. Breakfast was great - there was enough variety for everyone to find something. However, they did continuously run out of hot food and folks had to stand in line - they need better preparation on that end. Beds - don't expect Hilton comfort beds..on the hard side.  But overall we enjoyed our

Summary Heading: Obviously a bad experience is not the norm
Summary: You will read a lot of glowing reviews here, but my experience certainly wasn't a good one.  I booked the reservation through Hotwire, which will make me think twice before doing that again in the Cypress/Anaheim area.  With a two night reservation through Hotwire, you can't simply walk out and go to another hotel.  You are STUCK.   Upon returning at the end of the first day my room was very hot and turning on the air conditioner resulted in a fan about the noise level of a 747 - one speed - HIGH, blowing semi-hot air.  They sent maintenance up right away and he informed me the room needed a new thermostat. (first time this has come up in this room?)  They said they would move me to another room for that night, fix it in the morning but then have to move me back.  I said that

We were xtremely happy with our suite. We had a room with a king bed and TV and bathroom.In the middle was a living room with a pullout couch TV, and full kitchen with dish washer and a fridge with an ice maker. On the other side was a room with 2 double beds TV and its own bathroom. The breakfast was hot and good. The pool was warm,the kids loved that.

Summary Heading: Unbelievable Value- Especially for a long stay
Summary: Stayed here just for one night as part of the package for a friend's wedding in Garden Grove.  They gave it to us for 99/night as part of the wedding package.  The room is a steal for that price.  This all suite hotel has enough space to comfortably house a family of four, especially with the bed room and the living room separated by double doors. The bathroom is off the bedroom though. The kitchenette was fully equipped with appliances (including a full size fridge) and dishes.  Loved the decor as well, tastefully done in creams and beiges. Soft mattress and adequate bedding for the pull out couch.           Within 2 miles of the hotel is a movie theater, major golf course, and several eateries.  It seems like Cypress is a very nice, quiet community.  The front desk staff was

I stayed for my business.  The room was really comfortable and wide enough you can relax . The kitchenette was also good and had enough dishes, a microwave, a coffee maker. Breakfast buffet was available, and there are Japanese foods, and it is very good for Japanese guests.  The stuffs were friendly and kind. Wireless LAN was available, but not free.  The hotel is very good for business especially Japanese, and very good for family.

Summary Heading: Very comfortable and spacious room wonderful for families
Summary: We found the Woodfin Suites through reviews on Trip Advisor.  This hotel is away from the busy Disneyland area, but only a short drive to restaurants and attractions of Harbor Blvde.  Hotel staff were very helpful with directions and room was extremely comfortable and the kitchen is a bonus if you don't want to go out each night.  Our coffee and tea supplies were not replenished during our stay but this was a small complaint.  Free parking is great too.  Would recommend to families as a great alternative to the immediate Disney area.  Breakfast was ok, but on the weekend very crowded and some of the families looked like they did not care how much mess they made and how much food they wasted.  This was not the fault of the hotel and during the weekdays, the breakfast area was

Summary Heading: Nice hotel.  You will like it.
Summary: A perfect hotel for families.  Free breakfast to begin the day, and their breakfast for guests is truly wonderful.  Eggs, sausages, French toasts, oatmeal, breads, juice, coffee, waffle, fruit, yogurt, muffins, bagels, potato skillet, and even hot soup.    If you have small children, then I recommend a suite with a full kitchen.  My son and daughter are college students, so the mini kitchen worked just fine.    The bed is quite comfortable.  The sofa bed in the living room is queen size.  We didn't use balcony that much, but it's there.    I loved the central unit temperature control air/heat.  Just make sure the temperature control works.  Ours didn't worked on the first day, but the maintenance guy changed to a digital controller the next day and it worked wonderfully.    The

Summary Heading: Good Overall Value, but doesn't absorb rude and noisy guests well.
Summary: First time staying here.  We selected Woodfin because it is close to family and offered a clean comfortable suite for a great price.  We were there over the Christmas holiday, and the first morning the complementary hot breakfast was adequate.  The remaining mornings, though, the place was SO busy, the breakfast bar could not sustain the croud.  Long lines, supplies/offereings running low and not replenished well.  We gave up and went elsewhere for breakfast.  Lots of noise, starting our first morning...groundskeepers mowing and trimming machines all over.  Then there were the rude guests who let their doors slam...frequently...and shout up and down the hallways...adults and children. The hallways were not well insulated or sound-proofed, so it didn't take much for noise to

the room was too big and confortable, 2 lcd tv, the rate excelent, offers computer and printing free, free parking and shuttle to disney, the only thing is that only departures at 5.30pm from disney to the hotel, and is about 15 or 20 mins distance, the breakfast very well, eggs, saussages, cereal, waffles, bread, yogurth fruit and orange juice, i surely return again

We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights after Christmas 2010.  The hotel location is quiet and safe.  We stayed in the king suite with kitchenette.  It was modern, clean and up-to-date.  The bed was one of the best hotel beds we've ever experienced.  The suite was large with living and dining areas, separate bedroom, and two lcd tvs.  At $94 per night including taxes, it would be hard to beat in SoCal.  Problems: if you could get on the network, the wireless network was very slow.  The free breakfast was decent, but way too crowded and inefficient.  It's evident that this was an afterthought and not planned when the hotel was built.  One morning, we gave up and went elsewhere for breakfast.  Overall,  I would definitely stay again at that price!

Summary Heading: Cant handle full capacity; go somewhere else
Summary: This hotel was fine for us last summer, but has lost our business this holiday season for the following reasons:  a. Breakfast is completely overwhelmed, not enough space, food, long lines, etc.  We are going out for breakfast now rather than brave the inexperience.  The management should be ashamed.  They need to put more resources into making sure guests' stay is convenient.     b. The rooms are less well-insulated than I remember, and we get a load dripping noise whenever the upstairs occupant uses the sink.  (called, maintenance, still waiting.)  We are comforted by the fact that we have only 2 nights left.

Summary Heading: Good hotel at a good price, decent breakfast, 8 miles from Disney
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights during the Thanksgiving break.  The place is clean, and the rooms are big.  Clean place, Roomy rooms, Good staff, and decent breakfast.  The neighborhood is safe, and has restaurants (Chili's next door), and Costco, etc. close by.  The hotel is about 8-9 miles away from Disneyland. Good price, and got about 10% discount on the daily rate by calling them directly vs. the travel websites.

I was looking for a multi room suite for me, my wife and our twin 14 year old girls. In the past we have stayed at the Doubletree and Embassy Suites and I just happened to stumble onto the Woodfin on Expedia. At first I was put off by the not so known brand name. I sure am glad that I didn't pass this one up. This hotel and staff far outshines both of those previously mentioned hotels. We were able to get their 2 bedroom suite (rooms 349 and 351 with adjoining door) with large living room and full kitchen for an incredible $139.00 a night. My wife and I in one totally enclosed master bedroom suite complete with large Cal King bed, full bath and a real door that closed. The girls were on the other side of the suite in their own master bedroom suite with two full size beds and

Summary Heading: Terrific for the price, only a couple of problems.
Summary: When I first walked into the room, I said "WOW." It is big.  It is nice & clean!  It didn't look at all cheap, and since I'm a government employee, they gave a BIG discount, which I loved.  We brought our dog & was really happy to see that the suite had doors that separated the sleeping from the kitchen/living room which leads to the entry door.  My dog might otherwise have barked at passer-by's, but behind the closed doors, she couldn't hear them.  The free breakfast is above average & close to excellent.  The kitchenette has a large fridge with freezer, and dishes for about 4 people, but  just a couple of pots & pans.  Also a nice bonus to have free wi fi internet connection!!  It would all have been really perfect except for two complaints: 1) We left the sliding glass window

Initial impression of "Wow! This is very nice," quickly chased away.  Stayed three nights in two different rooms. Very spacious and good for families, does accept pets which is absolutely lovely.  First and formost the carpets were absolutely filthy.  I had bathed my little girl and an hour later put her down for bed and noticed her black feet, which made me look and notice my black feet, not dingy, BLACK! This happened in both rooms and guest from four other rooms noticed the same thing.  In the second suite two of three TV remotes were inoperable(but were replaced), the handle to the shower faucet fell off (which did get fixed), and stoppers in the tubs didn't work in both bathrooms of that suite, which made bathing the kids a bit more inconvienent. Also, the carpet in the

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when seeing Disney.
Summary: We spent 3 nights at this hotel on our tour of California. We chose this hotel because having teenage daughters the one bedroom suite would be of great benefit. The hotel is in a decent area with plenty of places to eat on Katella Avenue which is also the road that takes you to Disney, probably takes about about 10 minutes. The hotel room is on the large side and the bed is probably the biggest bed that I have slept in. Both the main bed and also the sofa bed in the lounge were very comfortable. The hotel also has a free breakfast which is of excellent standard with plenty of choice. The staff were always helpful and very pleasant. Having wifi included in the price was also a bonus. Also had a great meal in Chilis which is right next to the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to

Summary Heading: Awesome, economical, good base for Disney and LA!!!
Summary: Just got back from ten days at this hotel, it was absolutely great!  We stayed in a 2 double bed suite complete with a kitchenette.  It was about 10 min to Disney and easy access to freeways to get to all other sightseeing/ beaches.  The breakfast (included with the room) was really good, it saved us alot of money!  It included eggs, bacon or sausage, hashbrowns, waffles, toast, bagels, fresh fruit salad and even asian selections (rice, miso, etc.).  The service was fabulous, everyone was so friendly and helpful.  Our room was cleaned everyday, they even did the dishes for us when we ate in for the night!  The room was spacious and it was nice having separate living/sleeping areas.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to go to Disney.  The city of Cypress is a

Summary Heading: Rooms are large and beds are very comfortable
Summary: I was shocked was a great value.  Had a business trip and the rooms were very large.  Breakfast each morning was fantastic with fresh fruit, eggs, waffles, etc.  The bed was so comfortable with nice sheets. I would stay here again especially for the price!  I normally stay at the Hilton and can be a snob when it comes to staying at hotels.

We were in going to Los Angeles for vacation and were looking for a hotel with a one bedroom suite.  The Woodfin Hotel was great.  I had never heard of it and was a little apprehensive, but after reading other reviews decided to book.   The rooms were just as described, very clean with all of the amenities-kitchen with stove, refrigerator and microwave.  I worried about noise from other rooms that I had read in other reviews, but did not have problem at all, and our room was adjacent to the lounge and the pool.  The breakfast was very good with different hot item choices each day of our stay. There were two laundry rooms each with 2 washers and dryers.  The staff were all helpful with all of our needs.  I would definitelty stay at a Woodfin again.

I stayed a week at Woodfin and I will tell you that they make sure your stay is as nice as possible. The breakfast was good but the dinner was very impressive. The Southwestern hamburger plate was great. PJ & Sunny were very good bartenders but in general the whole staff makes you feel at home. If I ever get out that way again, I will stay there!!!!!!

Wow! Just returned from a one night stay at the Woodfin and wished it would have been longer!  This hotel is GREAT!  The price was average, but the room and service was anything but.  Large spacious room with a wonderful king bed.  It was actually a two room suite that included a kitchen area and balcony.  Stayed here primarily to go to Huntington Beach (about 7 miles away), but realized that it is also just a short drive to Disney as well.  It is located in a very quiet area and has free parking and free breakfast buffet included.  The breakfast area is large and feels less crowded.  Close to restaurants and fast food.  When we return to the Disney area we WILL be staying at the Woodfin!

Any-one with a family I highly recommend this hotel!!!!  Very nice area, clean rooms and facilities, warm pool and very clean and the breakfast were amazing.  We went to Disneyland and it was about a 15 minute shuttle drive away.  The staff were all so freindly and helpful at all times.  We had a king suite and it was very roomy and comfortable.  The best hotel I've stayed in all around.  Truly a gem.  Thankyou.

Summary Heading: High class service and amenities, without the high class prices.
Summary: We stayed at the Woodfin with the Ambassadors Academy on two separate occasions and both times it was a wonderful stay, very clean, great room, friendly staff, and the prices were good.  Their complimentary continental breakfast was by far the best I have had at any hotel anywhere, and when we come back to Cypress area, we will definitely try to book the Woodfin first.  Their patio and pool area was gorgeous and very tropical, and appealing.  Great place to relax and have breakfast or just chill by the pool.  Very close to local attractions and not far from the beach as well.  It was a great trip and The people at the Woodfin make you feel at home.  I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great place at a great price.  We will be back.  :-)

Summary Heading: This hotel b/c it looked nice & was away from Disney traffic
Summary: I am picky about hotels, and was pleased with this one.  The hotel has a difficult time keeping common areas and carpet clean, due to the fact that there are flowering trees EVERYWHERE; it is easy to track the fallen flowers and tree rubbish into the hotel, and the flowers look like roaches on the carpet.  Other than the flower problem, the hotel was clean -- not spic-n-span, but I felt like I was using clean linens and a clean bathroom.  Location is great:  In Cypress, about 6 miles from Disneyland, and although you travel through some questionable areas on the 6 mile straight-path from Disney, Cypress is really nice, and appeared very safe.  Plenty of free parking too.  Our  room was a Double Queen suite with sofa-bed and it was quite roomy.  A large TV for the main room, and

I stayed at The Woodfin Suites while attending a Conference in May of 2010.  It was the perfect location, great suite, beautiful courtyard with pool & spa, and the BEST complimentary breakfast I have experienced in any hotel to date (it resembled a Sunday brunch with eggs, hash browns, sausage, toast, make your own waffles, fresh fruit, etc.)!   Will stay here again and highly recommend this hotel to others.   Dawn
Manager Response: Thank you for your review on your recent stay at the Woodfin Hotel Cypress. We are pleased to hear that you really enjoyed our fully equipped suites, courtyard, and our Complimentary Breakfast. We try our best to make our guests feel like they are at a home away from home. Thank you again for choosing to stay with us and recommending our hotel to others. We look forward to your next stay at the Woodfin.  Maribel Munoz- Asst. General Manager

Summary: Haven't actually stayed here but I've had to make reservations for guests traveling from overseas. Karen helped. This girl is on top of things. Best service ever! Fast friendly accurate.  Makes my job a little easier.   Boss, give this girl a raise!
Manager Response: Thank you for your response regarding your booking experiences with the Woodfin Hotel and our employee Karen.  We look forward to having you stay with us in the future, so that you may experience our friendly customer service during your stay as you do when making reservations for your guests.  Maribel Munoz- Asst. General Manger

Summary: We stayed at the Woodfin, Cypress~Ca from 4-10 thru 4-17, 2010. I had called and emailed ahead a request to a certain room we have stayed in over 5 times~~~ yet this time especially  due to a broken foot! Christy ,whom I talked to at the hotel and Travis Widerien ,the GM both assured me they would try to accomodate ,although they could not assure the request as I fully understood.  Much to our surprise, we checked in early on Sat. 4/10-2010 and the room was not only available, but ready for us!!! Phew!! The accomodations are wonderful with our full sized kitchen, separate living/sleeping quarters with shut doors (I love this as my hubby gets up early to eat and I sleep in a bit.) The breakfast buffet is still amazing with foods ranging each day from scrambled eggs (not powdered
Manager Response: Thank you again for choosing The Woodfin Hotel in Cypress as your home away from home. We are pleased to hear that the staff provided you and your husband with excellent customer service through out your stay. The staff greatly appreciates all of the wonderful feedback and comments you have provided us in return. As you noticed there have been quite a few changes in the past 6 years including our Newly Opened Woodfin Bar & Grill, patio furniture, and fire pit, and more to come in the near future. Our hotel is centrally located near major attractions, highways, restaurants, and businesses which accommodate not only our corporate travelers but our leisure travelers as well. Thank you again for continuing to make Woodfin Hotel your choice hotel.  Maribel Munoz- Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Hidden Gem! You have to know about this hotel.
Summary: I was in Cypress on business in early March. This was my first time staying at a Woodfin Hotel. The Woodfin Cypress was in the heart of where I needed to be. I was visiting several offices in the surrounding business park. Boeing, was right across the street,  much easier to get to than I expected. My room was huge. Had a livingroom, separet bedroom, and full kitchen, though I did not need it this trip. Nice rooms, had a inside view of the courtyard. Their free breakfast was very busy but  amazing! Enjoyed the scrambled eggs and homemade waffels. Everyone at the hotel made me fee welcome and at home. I will be back next visit for sure!  Oh yes... I had dinner at the Bar at the Hotel my last night there, wish I ate there every night. Wonderful food, great Bartender! Ordered
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Woodfin Hotel and taking the time to write a review about your stay. We greatly appreciate the feed back. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our spacious suites and complimentary breakfast. Our Woodfin Bar & Grill just opened a few months ago, so it’s good to hear that our staff is doing a great job to make your experience memorable. We hope your next stay is even better than your last.

Summary: I traveled with my husband on business.  He attended a Solar training class which the hotel shuttled to the site.  Well, the class went over by 15 minutes and he called me when he didn't get picked up...they eventually picked him up an HOUR later.  If you drop someone off it stands to reason you should know to pick them up.  The other problem was at breakfast there was a religious conference and we were approached and harassed about god / religion... It was totally inappropriate and we could not enjoy our breakfasts the remainder of the week.  I would really recommend having a car if you visit as the town of Cypress is pretty lame and the bar was never open at night and there was no manager reception as advertised on the website.  You will need to drive to Anaheim or  Huntington
Manager Response: Thank you for your response on your recent stay at the Woodfin Hotel in Cypress. I am sorry to hear that your husband was picked up late from his training class. I will also apologize on behalf of our group that was in house during your stay, which should not have approached you under any circumstances. As you said on the bright side, I am glad to hear that we were able to accommodate you and your husband with one of our fully equipped and spacious suites. Our Woodfin Bar & Grill is now open daily for dinner service as opposed to only having it open Monday through Thursday, so that our leisure/weekend guest may enjoy it as well.  We hope that your next stay will be more pleasant than your last.  Maribel Munoz- Asst. General Manager

Summary: Very nice hotel.  Primarily a business hotel.  Good prices on weekends.  A little off the beaten path but that's ok.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Woodfin Hotel in Cypress. Our hotel is a corporate business hotel but at the same time we try our best to accommodate our weekend/leisure travelers with our competitive rates. We hope you choose to stay with us again on your next visit to the Cypress/ Orange County Area.  Maribel Munoz- Asst. General Manager

Summary: Stay here often to visit son and family that live nearby.  Always clean and spacious rooms.  Breakfast was wonderful this trip.  Quiet area, restaurants nearby, great location.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response on your recent stay at The Woodfin Hotel in Cypress. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our complimentary deluxe buffet breakfast and also our fully equipped and spacious suites. Our hotel is located near major attractions like Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm, and has many great restaurants nearby including our Newly Opened Woodfin Bar & Grill right here on property. We hope that you continue to stay with us in the future when visiting your family and son in the area.  Maribel Munoz-Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Best kept secret in the area
Summary: Despite the prior reviews, we were shocked at how great our experience was.  I had made the reservation prior to reading the prior reviews. So when we showed up I was a little afraid.  WHAT A MISCONCEPTION. We had a wonderful room-very quiet and clean.  The full breakfast was delicious and varied.  The staff was solicitous and friendly. And the local eateries offered and wide choice.  We will definitely be back.  This hotel could be one of the best kept secrets in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Woodfin Hotel in Cypress. We are glad you decided to take a chance on our hotel and found it to be a great experience, which is what we aim for here at the Woodfin.  We are pleased to hear you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast which we try to keep stocked with a variety of items for our guests to enjoy and our spacious suites which give a home away from home feeling instead of the typical hotel stay experience. Thank you again for choosing the Woodfin Hotel and look forward to your next visit.  Maribel Munoz-Asst. General Manager

Summary: I would absolutely not recommend this hotel to anyone! One is the minimum rating you can give a hotel and even that is more than this hotel deserves.  At one point this may have been a nice hotel, however, that is no longer the case.  As my colleague arrived and our first impression of the lobby was that it was a bit tired but not terrible. We were assigned rooms at opposite sides of the hotel. I started getting a bit leary as I walked to my room. It smelled like a herd of cats without a litter box had been roaming the halls. When I got to the first room  I walked in to hear a non-stop running toilet and smell a horrible odor.  I went back to the desk to request an alternate room.  The new room didn't having a running toilet but still smelled bad.  I figured since it was already

Summary Heading: We had a very bad experience with this hotel
Summary: They gave us a very small room and the floor was stink.  The hotel didn't have an ice machine which I think it's inconvenient.  As we always needed ice, we had to wait for one of their staff members at the bar to get it for us such so inconvenient.  We travel a lot and never seen any hotels like this one.  The phone in our room was not working and we requested to have some one fixed it, but no one showed up at all.  I can hear a lot of slamming doors, especially at night time.  Also, I can hear an alarm next door every morning.  They mentioned that they had free wireless internet which you have to go to the main conference room to get access to the internet which is another inconvenient thing where other hotels you can get free wireless internet right in your room. I wouldn't

Stayed here 16th July for 4 nights room 330. We went to Vegas and  returned  to the Woodfin. We stayed a further 10 nights from 20th July. room 317. At first we were a little dissapointed with a view of the Parking lot but we asked them if they could arrange a pool view on our return from Vegas. They explained they could not promise but would try their best. On our return we had a lovely room with a nice balcony table and 2 chairs with a pool view. room much nicer than on our first stay. We did a deal with Nick the reservations Manager and we were very happy with the agreed rate.Beautiful room usual refinements for a suite Full Kitchen nice Lounge area with Huge Plasma in Lounge and smaller one in bedroom. We had a room with 2 Doubles.. Breakfast was very good with Ample Choice
Manager Response: Thank you for your recommendation for others to stay at the Woodfin Hotel in Cypress after your past experience. I am glad that we were able to accommodate you with a pool view suite on your second stay and thank you for including the wonderful pictures of the property.  Since your last visit we are proud to announce the Opening of our Woodfin Bar & Grill which is opened every evening from 5-10 with room delivery available. For any guest with or with out a vehicle we do provide an on site shuttle to and from Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm, and anywhere in a 5 mile radius of the hotel. Thank you again for taking the time to write a review about your experience at the Woodfin and look forward to accommodating you on your next stay. Maribel Munoz- Asst. General Manager

Summary: We booked a king suite for 3 days and it was Gorgeous ! 1 room (living room) with a pullout bed, fully stocked kitchen, balcony, flat screen T.V. Bedroom with privacy doors also had a flat screen T.V., King bed and the bathroom had plenty of room. Continental Breakfast was FANTASTIC !! It saves a family money while traveling.     We stayed here for our Annual Disneyland trip. The hotel is about 10 mins. from the park so we had to drive & pay to park at Disney ($12.00) good all day . Woodfin does have a shuttle to the park, but it leaves at one time in the morning and returns at one time in the evening. Beds were super comfortable and room was very clean. Service & Hotel staff were very kind. we would stay here again in a heartbeat !
Manager Response: Thank you for your response on your recent stay at the Woodfin Hotel in Cypress. We are glad you and your family enjoyed your stay in our newly renovated king suite which is very accommodating to families on vacations. Our location being only 7 miles away from Disneyland is also key for families who do not want to deal with the Disney Traffic. We appreciate the positive comments and feedback you have provided us and look forward to making your next Annual Disneyland trip when staying at the Woodfin Hotel better than your last.   Maribel Munoz-Asst. General Manager

Summary: We loved this placed!  We booked it on Hotwire so got a great deal.  Had a lovely suite with kitchenette, seperate seating area, fridge, dishes, etc.  Lovely terrace on our room.  We happened to be there on a Wed. the hotel had free dinner, drinks, appetizers.  Loved it!

Summary Heading: The best hotel to stay at with the family
Summary: We visited Disneyland last week and we stayed at the Woodfin for 5 nights and we had no complaints at all. Great breakfast every morning and the staff is very very nice.  We had no problem getting a crib in our room at no additional charge.
I had a great stay at Woodfin Suites. We were welcomed by the warm staff each time we entered.  The breakfast is the best I've had compared to other continental breakfast!
It was a pleasure staying at the Woodfin.  The people at the front desk were very nice and were very helpful.  The room we stayed in was nice too.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again

We were very happy with our King Suite. The breakfast was excellent and  the staff was very accomodating.  My one disappointment was the plumbing in our room. The toilet never worked properly throughout our stay. The maintenance man came 2 times. I had to use the public bathroom down the hall. The toilet just wouldn't flush.  The hotel has a shuttle to Disney Land which we used 2 days. We drove the last day when we discovered that the shuttle won't run after 9:30 pm and we didn't want to miss the DisneyLand fireworks.  I recommend staying here. I'm sure the plumbing is fixed by now. I'd definately stay here again with my family. The price was reasonable. We liked it so much we wanted to stay at the Woodfin in San Diego.

Great stay at the Woodfin  There for a one week business trip. Had a problem with refrigerator and was taken care of immediately.   Great free breakfast every morning.  I love staying there.   Staff is great!  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Do yourself a favor and stay at this hotel, you wont be sorry
Summary: This hotel is top notch.  Felt as though it was my home away from home.   I had to upgrade my room to a suite and it was no problem.  Friendly smiling faces and beautiful clean comfortable rooms.  Complimentary breakfast was fantastic.  I will stay here on my mext visit to this area.

We checked in late night and the employee at the reception counter was very friendly and helpful.  The hotel was kept in good shape...very clean and nicely decorated.   The lobby had a nice sitting area in front of a gas fireplace next to a conference room/library with a large table and comfortable business chairs.  Did not have any problems so could not put the service to the test on how they would handle situations.  We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with a nice kitchen and a large living room.   The flat screen television sets (one in the bedroom and one in the living room) were cool to have.  One thing about having rooms with kitchens was that I would always smell someone cooking curry as I walked though the hallway.  Breakfast was decent and kind of cool to have rice and miso

Stayed here over Christmas and New Years with our family in 2009.  The breakfast was excellent, my teenage children even made sure they were up in time to enjoy it.  Loved the full kitchen.  The management and staff were excellent.  Took time to help us navigate to places as our GPS quit working.    They gave us an exceptional price on the room for Christmas as they were having a managers special.  The courtyard view to the pool was peaceful.  If you want to get away from the hussle and bussle of Disney, yet still be close...this is the place.

We enjoyed our stay at the Woodfin while taking our sons to Disneyland.  The staff was very accomodating; they shuttled us to Disneyland for free (about a 10 minute drive), dropped us off 15 minutes before the gates opened but allowed us enough time to get through security and walk around Mainstreet...perfect timing, they provided their own car seats so we didn't have to use ours, the included breakfast was great with many choices for the whole family, you can buy Disneyland tickets at the front desk so you don't have to hassle with it at the park, the staff gave great advice about "must see" attractions and age appropriate rides for the little ones, our suite was spacious enough for a family of four, the refrigerator was key as it allowed us to bring in cold drinks into the

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Family Vacations to Disneyland!!
Summary: My sister, her husband and my two fabulous nephews stayed at the Woodfin for the boys' first trip to Disneyland.  It was great!  We had a two bedroom suit that was lovely.  Then I was able to purchase my ticket for Disneyland (important--tell the hotel in advance to be sure they are not sold out on tickets).  Finally, they have a FREE shuttle to disneyland and it drops you off right at the front. We called in the evening and they met us 30 minutes later--PERFECT!  I highly recommend staying at this hotel for family trips to Disneyland-- so easy and relaxing.

Excellent experience! Would definately stay again. The breakfast downstairs was a full on breakfast, nice change from the "Continental" breakfasts at most places. Loved having a kitchen. Loved the suite, my friend stays up late so I could close the door and go to bed early. Staff was very helpful and very nice. Room was really clean and the AC worked like a dream. I have nothing bad to say. They lock the front door late at night so you need your key to enter at side entrances. We went to store late and came back to a locked front entrance, we laughed about getting "home" too late and "mom" locking us out of the house. Luckily there were 2 people in the parking lot that told us how to get back in as at check in the front desk forgot to tell us. It was a great experience. Only 6

We have stayed at this motel several times over the last five years, but it is in dire need of a renovation.  The furniture is old, the bathroom is basically right in the bedroom so if one person is using the sink, the light and noise will keep the other person awake.  The rooms could use better lighting, and the Internet access is an extra charge.   There is a mangers reception four nights a week so if you are there Friday through Sunday, you miss the reception.  The breakfast is actually quite good and plentiful, with eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, juice, fruit, etc.  Unless there is some work done to improve the quality of the rooms we will no longer be staying there.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We do appreciate the constructive feedback you have provided for us. We are happy to report that our hotel has recently undergone a complete renovation! The issues you discussed in your review were some of our main focus points when renovating the property. We know that if you give our property another chance you won't be disappointed. Regards.

Summary: Originally I was supposed to be put into a suite; however they gave me a standard room because they had overbooked the suites.  Carpet was absolutely filthy, something I would have expected a $70 motel, but not acceptable in a place like this.  Air conditioner/heater only had one setting which sounded like a tornado in the room.  The Ethernet cable was located on the opposite side of the room from the "desk” which made it impossible for me to work comfortably on my laptop.  I did have a nice balcony, and the breakfast was good, but those were the only positives of staying in this place. I won't be staying there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property. We do apologize for any inconveniences you may have experienced during your visit. We are happy to report that our property recently underwent a full renovation! Some of your comments were the focus point of our renovation project. We take great pride in our breakfast and appreciate your positive comments. We think that with the renovation behind us that we can not only provide the value you desire but also the comforts of a modern decor. Thank you again and we hope that you will consider our property on your next visit to the Cypress/Anaheim area.

Summary: I flew in and was shuttled to Woodfin Hotel.  The front desk people seemed inexperienced and slow.  I was booked for the second floor, and my room was lackluster.  The linoleum floor looked 80s and the sofa couch was a bit faded.  The sofa cushion's zipper was broken.  The soaps melted easily when wet.  The toilet flooded on more than one occasion while we stayed there and we were told we could use the restroom in the front of the building.  I'm sorry, but I am a woman and I don't do my dirty deeds in public restrooms.  The maintenance guy came in and worked on the toilet, but left it wet.  He didn't speak any English when I asked him if he could have someone bring in fresh towels.  I don't like people going in my room when I'm not there, so I prefer to have my towels delivered
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property. Your constructive feedback is crucial in our attempt to better serve our guests. We would like to apologize for not meeting your expectations. I am happy to report that the hotel has recently undergone a complete renovation. I assure you that some of the issues you encountered on your visit have been addressed in the renovation process. I would hope that you would give our property another chance. I do not think you will be disappointed. Thank you again.

Summary: My wife and I flew to Long Beach for her training.  We decided on the Woodfin Suite Hotel.  On a few occasions, the housemaid Mimi came in to clean up our room.  She was really nice and attentive and although the second day she came by, we didn't really need anything, but she reminded us of our trash and extra towels.    The breakfast was great.  We had eggs, sausage, omelets, hash browns, home fries, waffles.  They have a small store in there too where they sell snacks like candy bars and even alcohol.    The pool was refreshing, and we were just literally a minute away from Wendy's so we got ice cream there.  They have a Chili's Restaurant and other restaurants and fast food as well  Cypress is not a busy city like Long Beach or LA, so not too much traffic.  It was overall a
Manager Response: Thank you very much for reviewing our property. It is always refreshing to receive positive feedback from our guests. We hope that you will continue to make Woodfin Suites your accommodation choice when traveling to the Cypress/Anaheim area. Regards.

Summary: I was on a business trip with my company and all the other hotels in the area were booked so my secretary booked me at the Woodfin, one of the few places with available rooms.  I expected to be staying in one of the 2-room suites with the kitchen and living area but instead I was greated by a 200 square foot oversized closet that the Woodfin tried to pass off as a hotel room.  I pulled off the sheets to rest my weary head but found the body hair of prior guests scattered across the sheets and pillows.  Needless to say, that was my last night at the Woodfin.  Granted, it was 20% cheaper than the Radisson and Marriott but I'd gladly let my company foot the extra $20 per night to have some space to call my own and a clean set of sheets.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property. I would like to apologize for the experience you had during your visit. Our Traditional rooms are small in comparison to our Suites but they are comparable to most Standard Hotel rooms. The Traditional rooms are 300 sq. ft. Although I can not change the size of the Traditional room, I can recommend our One Bedroom Suite. It is equipped with a full-kitchen, living room, and a separate bedroom area. I am certain you will find the space you are looking for with this room type. Thank you again for your constructive feedback and hope that you would give our property another opportunity when traveling to the Cypress/Anaheim area.

Summary: My family stayed for a week a the hotel in late August - we had a 2-bedroom suite on the 3rd floor overlooking the pool.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay, the hotel was a good value, the staff was friendly, the breakfasts (as long as you like scrambled eggs for breakfast every morning - actually there was also potatoes of some type, sausage or bacon, waffles that you could make, cereal, fresh fruit, bagels, english muffins, yogurt, etc.) and light snack Monday to Thursday evening was very good (enough for the kids for dinner, actually), it is convenient to Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm, and there are a couple of supermarkets within a few minute dirve.  On the down side - the water in the pool was murky and they had to close the pool twice for maintenance and the gym equipment is
Manager Response: Thank you for completing a review on our property. We take great pride in our breakfast and social hour and appreciate the positive feedback. I do apologize for the situation surrounding the availability of the pool area. This was certainly an isolated case and our pool and spa are fully functional. I understand how important the pool area can be for a traveling family. I would like to update that the equipment in the Fitness Center has been replaced. Thank you again for your constructive feedback and look forward to accommodating you and your family on your next trip to the Cypress/Anaheim area.
